1710                  }
1711              }
1712          }
1713          
1714          
1715          /**
1716           * Get an array of unique th elements, one for each column
1717           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
1718           *  @param {node} nHeader automatically detect the layout from this node - optional
1719           *  @param {array} aLayout thead/tfoot layout from _fnDetectHeader - optional
1720           *  @returns array {node} aReturn list of unique ths
1721           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
1722           */
1723  		function _fnGetUniqueThs ( oSettings, nHeader, aLayout )
1724          {
1725              var aReturn = [];
1726              if ( !aLayout )
1727              {
1728                  aLayout = oSettings.aoHeader;
1729                  if ( nHeader )
1730                  {
1731                      aLayout = [];
1732                      _fnDetectHeader( aLayout, nHeader );
1733                  }
1734              }
1735          
1736              for ( var i=0, iLen=aLayout.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1737              {
1738                  for ( var j=0, jLen=aLayout[i].length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
1739                  {
1740                      if ( aLayout[i][j].unique && 
1741                           (!aReturn[j] || !oSettings.bSortCellsTop) )
1742                      {
1743                          aReturn[j] = aLayout[i][j].cell;
1744                      }
1745                  }
1746              }
1747              
1748              return aReturn;
1749          }
1750          
1751          
1752          
1753          /**
1754           * Update the table using an Ajax call
1755           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
1756           *  @returns {boolean} Block the table drawing or not
1757           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
1758           */
1759  		function _fnAjaxUpdate( oSettings )
1760          {
1761              if ( oSettings.bAjaxDataGet )
1762              {
1763                  oSettings.iDraw++;
1764                  _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, true );
1765                  var iColumns = oSettings.aoColumns.length;
1766                  var aoData = _fnAjaxParameters( oSettings );
1767                  _fnServerParams( oSettings, aoData );
1768                  
1769                  oSettings.fnServerData.call( oSettings.oInstance, oSettings.sAjaxSource, aoData,
1770                      function(json) {
1771                          _fnAjaxUpdateDraw( oSettings, json );
1772                      }, oSettings );
1773                  return false;
1774              }
1775              else
1776              {
1777                  return true;
1778              }
1779          }
1780          
1781          
1782          /**
1783           * Build up the parameters in an object needed for a server-side processing request
1784           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
1785           *  @returns {bool} block the table drawing or not
1786           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
1787           */
1788  		function _fnAjaxParameters( oSettings )
1789          {
1790              var iColumns = oSettings.aoColumns.length;
1791              var aoData = [], mDataProp;
1792              var i;
1793              
1794              aoData.push( { "name": "sEcho",          "value": oSettings.iDraw } );
1795              aoData.push( { "name": "iColumns",       "value": iColumns } );
1796              aoData.push( { "name": "sColumns",       "value": _fnColumnOrdering(oSettings) } );
1797              aoData.push( { "name": "iDisplayStart",  "value": oSettings._iDisplayStart } );
1798              aoData.push( { "name": "iDisplayLength", "value": oSettings.oFeatures.bPaginate !== false ?
1799                  oSettings._iDisplayLength : -1 } );
1800                  
1801              for ( i=0 ; i<iColumns ; i++ )
1802              {
1803                mDataProp = oSettings.aoColumns[i].mDataProp;
1804                  aoData.push( { "name": "mDataProp_"+i, "value": typeof(mDataProp)==="function" ? 'function' : mDataProp } );
1805              }
1806              
1807              /* Filtering */
1808              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bFilter !== false )
1809              {
1810                  aoData.push( { "name": "sSearch", "value": oSettings.oPreviousSearch.sSearch } );
1811                  aoData.push( { "name": "bRegex",  "value": oSettings.oPreviousSearch.bRegex } );
1812                  for ( i=0 ; i<iColumns ; i++ )
1813                  {
1814                      aoData.push( { "name": "sSearch_"+i,     "value": oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[i].sSearch } );
1815                      aoData.push( { "name": "bRegex_"+i,      "value": oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[i].bRegex } );
1816                      aoData.push( { "name": "bSearchable_"+i, "value": oSettings.aoColumns[i].bSearchable } );
1817                  }
1818              }
1819              
1820              /* Sorting */
1821              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bSort !== false )
1822              {
1823                  var iFixed = oSettings.aaSortingFixed !== null ? oSettings.aaSortingFixed.length : 0;
1824                  var iUser = oSettings.aaSorting.length;
1825                  aoData.push( { "name": "iSortingCols",   "value": iFixed+iUser } );
1826                  for ( i=0 ; i<iFixed ; i++ )
1827                  {
1828                      aoData.push( { "name": "iSortCol_"+i,  "value": oSettings.aaSortingFixed[i][0] } );
1829                      aoData.push( { "name": "sSortDir_"+i,  "value": oSettings.aaSortingFixed[i][1] } );
1830                  }
1831                  
1832                  for ( i=0 ; i<iUser ; i++ )
1833                  {
1834                      aoData.push( { "name": "iSortCol_"+(i+iFixed),  "value": oSettings.aaSorting[i][0] } );
1835                      aoData.push( { "name": "sSortDir_"+(i+iFixed),  "value": oSettings.aaSorting[i][1] } );
1836                  }
1837                  
1838                  for ( i=0 ; i<iColumns ; i++ )
1839                  {
1840                      aoData.push( { "name": "bSortable_"+i,  "value": oSettings.aoColumns[i].bSortable } );
1841                  }
1842              }
1843              
1844              return aoData;
1845          }
1846          
1847          
1848          /**
1849           * Add Ajax parameters from plugins
1850           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
1851           *  @param array {objects} aoData name/value pairs to send to the server
1852           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
1853           */
1854  		function _fnServerParams( oSettings, aoData )
1855          {
1856              _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoServerParams', 'serverParams', [aoData] );
1857          }
1858          
1859          
1860          /**
1861           * Data the data from the server (nuking the old) and redraw the table
1862           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
1863           *  @param {object} json json data return from the server.
1864           *  @param {string} json.sEcho Tracking flag for DataTables to match requests
1865           *  @param {int} json.iTotalRecords Number of records in the data set, not accounting for filtering
1866           *  @param {int} json.iTotalDisplayRecords Number of records in the data set, accounting for filtering
1867           *  @param {array} json.aaData The data to display on this page
1868           *  @param {string} [json.sColumns] Column ordering (sName, comma separated)
1869           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
1870           */
1871  		function _fnAjaxUpdateDraw ( oSettings, json )
1872          {
1873              if ( json.sEcho !== undefined )
1874              {
1875                  /* Protect against old returns over-writing a new one. Possible when you get
1876                   * very fast interaction, and later queires are completed much faster
1877                   */
1878                  if ( json.sEcho*1 < oSettings.iDraw )
1879                  {
1880                      return;
1881                  }
1882                  else
1883                  {
1884                      oSettings.iDraw = json.sEcho * 1;
1885                  }
1886              }
1887              
1888              if ( !oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite ||
1889                     (oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite && (oSettings.bSorted || oSettings.bFiltered)) )
1890              {
1891                  _fnClearTable( oSettings );
1892              }
1893              oSettings._iRecordsTotal = parseInt(json.iTotalRecords, 10);
1894              oSettings._iRecordsDisplay = parseInt(json.iTotalDisplayRecords, 10);
1895              
1896              /* Determine if reordering is required */
1897              var sOrdering = _fnColumnOrdering(oSettings);
1898              var bReOrder = (json.sColumns !== undefined && sOrdering !== "" && json.sColumns != sOrdering );
1899              var aiIndex;
1900              if ( bReOrder )
1901              {
1902                  aiIndex = _fnReOrderIndex( oSettings, json.sColumns );
1903              }
1904              
1905              var aData = _fnGetObjectDataFn( oSettings.sAjaxDataProp )( json );
1906              for ( var i=0, iLen=aData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1907              {
1908                  if ( bReOrder )
1909                  {
1910                      /* If we need to re-order, then create a new array with the correct order and add it */
1911                      var aDataSorted = [];
1912                      for ( var j=0, jLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
1913                      {
1914                          aDataSorted.push( aData[i][ aiIndex[j] ] );
1915                      }
1916                      _fnAddData( oSettings, aDataSorted );
1917                  }
1918                  else
1919                  {
1920                      /* No re-order required, sever got it "right" - just straight add */
1921                      _fnAddData( oSettings, aData[i] );
1922                  }
1923              }
1924              oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
1925              
1926              oSettings.bAjaxDataGet = false;
1927              _fnDraw( oSettings );
1928              oSettings.bAjaxDataGet = true;
1929              _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, false );
1930          }
1931          
1932          
1933          
1934          /**
1935           * Generate the node required for filtering text
1936           *  @returns {node} Filter control element
1937           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
1938           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
1939           */
1940  		function _fnFeatureHtmlFilter ( oSettings )
1941          {
1942              var oPreviousSearch = oSettings.oPreviousSearch;
1943              
1944              var sSearchStr = oSettings.oLanguage.sSearch;
1945              sSearchStr = (sSearchStr.indexOf('_INPUT_') !== -1) ?
1946                sSearchStr.replace('_INPUT_', '<input type="text" />') :
1947                sSearchStr==="" ? '<input type="text" />' : sSearchStr+' <input type="text" />';
1948              
1949              var nFilter = document.createElement( 'div' );
1950              nFilter.className = oSettings.oClasses.sFilter;
1951              nFilter.innerHTML = '<label>'+sSearchStr+'</label>';
1952              if ( !oSettings.aanFeatures.f )
1953              {
1954                  nFilter.id = oSettings.sTableId+'_filter';
1955              }
1956              
1957              var jqFilter = $("input", nFilter);
1958              jqFilter.val( oPreviousSearch.sSearch.replace('"','&quot;') );
1959              jqFilter.bind( 'keyup.DT', function(e) {
1960                  /* Update all other filter input elements for the new display */
1961                  var n = oSettings.aanFeatures.f;
1962                  for ( var i=0, iLen=n.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1963                  {
1964                      if ( n[i] != $(this).parents('div.dataTables_filter')[0] )
1965                      {
1966                          $('input', n[i]).val( this.value );
1967                      }
1968                  }
1969                  
1970                  /* Now do the filter */
1971                  if ( this.value != oPreviousSearch.sSearch )
1972                  {
1973                      _fnFilterComplete( oSettings, { 
1974                          "sSearch": this.value, 
1975                          "bRegex": oPreviousSearch.bRegex,
1976                          "bSmart": oPreviousSearch.bSmart ,
1977                          "bCaseInsensitive": oPreviousSearch.bCaseInsensitive 
1978                      } );
1979                  }
1980              } );
1981          
1982              jqFilter
1983                  .attr('aria-controls', oSettings.sTableId)
1984                  .bind( 'keypress.DT', function(e) {
1985                      /* Prevent form submission */
1986                      if ( e.keyCode == 13 )
1987                      {
1988                          return false;
1989                      }
1990                  }
1991              );
1992              
1993              return nFilter;
1994          }
1995          
1996          
1997          /**
1998           * Filter the table using both the global filter and column based filtering
1999           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2000           *  @param {object} oSearch search information
2001           *  @param {int} [iForce] force a research of the master array (1) or not (undefined or 0)
2002           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2003           */
2004  		function _fnFilterComplete ( oSettings, oInput, iForce )
2005          {
2006              var oPrevSearch = oSettings.oPreviousSearch;
2007              var aoPrevSearch = oSettings.aoPreSearchCols;
2008              var fnSaveFilter = function ( oFilter ) {
2009                  /* Save the filtering values */
2010                  oPrevSearch.sSearch = oFilter.sSearch;
2011                  oPrevSearch.bRegex = oFilter.bRegex;
2012                  oPrevSearch.bSmart = oFilter.bSmart;
2013                  oPrevSearch.bCaseInsensitive = oFilter.bCaseInsensitive;
2014              };
2015          
2016              /* In server-side processing all filtering is done by the server, so no point hanging around here */
2017              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide )
2018              {
2019                  /* Global filter */
2020                  _fnFilter( oSettings, oInput.sSearch, iForce, oInput.bRegex, oInput.bSmart, oInput.bCaseInsensitive );
2021                  fnSaveFilter( oInput );
2022          
2023                  /* Now do the individual column filter */
2024                  for ( var i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoPreSearchCols.length ; i++ )
2025                  {
2026                      _fnFilterColumn( oSettings, aoPrevSearch[i].sSearch, i, aoPrevSearch[i].bRegex, 
2027                          aoPrevSearch[i].bSmart, aoPrevSearch[i].bCaseInsensitive );
2028                  }
2029                  
2030                  /* Custom filtering */
2031                  _fnFilterCustom( oSettings );
2032              }
2033              else
2034              {
2035                  fnSaveFilter( oInput );
2036              }
2037              
2038              /* Tell the draw function we have been filtering */
2039              oSettings.bFiltered = true;
2040              $(oSettings.oInstance).trigger('filter', oSettings);
2041              
2042              /* Redraw the table */
2043              oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2044              _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
2045              _fnDraw( oSettings );
2046              
2047              /* Rebuild search array 'offline' */
2048              _fnBuildSearchArray( oSettings, 0 );
2049          }
2050          
2051          
2052          /**
2053           * Apply custom filtering functions
2054           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2055           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2056           */
2057  		function _fnFilterCustom( oSettings )
2058          {
2059              var afnFilters = DataTable.ext.afnFiltering;
2060              for ( var i=0, iLen=afnFilters.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2061              {
2062                  var iCorrector = 0;
2063                  for ( var j=0, jLen=oSettings.aiDisplay.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
2064                  {
2065                      var iDisIndex = oSettings.aiDisplay[j-iCorrector];
2066                      
2067                      /* Check if we should use this row based on the filtering function */
2068                      if ( !afnFilters[i]( oSettings, _fnGetRowData( oSettings, iDisIndex, 'filter' ), iDisIndex ) )
2069                      {
2070                          oSettings.aiDisplay.splice( j-iCorrector, 1 );
2071                          iCorrector++;
2072                      }
2073                  }
2074              }
2075          }
2076          
2077          
2078          /**
2079           * Filter the table on a per-column basis
2080           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2081           *  @param {string} sInput string to filter on
2082           *  @param {int} iColumn column to filter
2083           *  @param {bool} bRegex treat search string as a regular expression or not
2084           *  @param {bool} bSmart use smart filtering or not
2085           *  @param {bool} bCaseInsensitive Do case insenstive matching or not
2086           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2087           */
2088  		function _fnFilterColumn ( oSettings, sInput, iColumn, bRegex, bSmart, bCaseInsensitive )
2089          {
2090              if ( sInput === "" )
2091              {
2092                  return;
2093              }
2094              
2095              var iIndexCorrector = 0;
2096              var rpSearch = _fnFilterCreateSearch( sInput, bRegex, bSmart, bCaseInsensitive );
2097              
2098              for ( var i=oSettings.aiDisplay.length-1 ; i>=0 ; i-- )
2099              {
2100                  var sData = _fnDataToSearch( _fnGetCellData( oSettings, oSettings.aiDisplay[i], iColumn, 'filter' ),
2101                      oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn].sType );
2102                  if ( ! rpSearch.test( sData ) )
2103                  {
2104                      oSettings.aiDisplay.splice( i, 1 );
2105                      iIndexCorrector++;
2106                  }
2107              }
2108          }
2109          
2110          
2111          /**
2112           * Filter the data table based on user input and draw the table
2113           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2114           *  @param {string} sInput string to filter on
2115           *  @param {int} iForce optional - force a research of the master array (1) or not (undefined or 0)
2116           *  @param {bool} bRegex treat as a regular expression or not
2117           *  @param {bool} bSmart perform smart filtering or not
2118           *  @param {bool} bCaseInsensitive Do case insenstive matching or not
2119           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2120           */
2121  		function _fnFilter( oSettings, sInput, iForce, bRegex, bSmart, bCaseInsensitive )
2122          {
2123              var i;
2124              var rpSearch = _fnFilterCreateSearch( sInput, bRegex, bSmart, bCaseInsensitive );
2125              var oPrevSearch = oSettings.oPreviousSearch;
2126              
2127              /* Check if we are forcing or not - optional parameter */
2128              if ( !iForce )
2129              {
2130                  iForce = 0;
2131              }
2132              
2133              /* Need to take account of custom filtering functions - always filter */
2134              if ( DataTable.ext.afnFiltering.length !== 0 )
2135              {
2136                  iForce = 1;
2137              }
2138              
2139              /*
2140               * If the input is blank - we want the full data set
2141               */
2142              if ( sInput.length <= 0 )
2143              {
2144                  oSettings.aiDisplay.splice( 0, oSettings.aiDisplay.length);
2145                  oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
2146              }
2147              else
2148              {
2149                  /*
2150                   * We are starting a new search or the new search string is smaller 
2151                   * then the old one (i.e. delete). Search from the master array
2152                    */
2153                  if ( oSettings.aiDisplay.length == oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.length ||
2154                         oPrevSearch.sSearch.length > sInput.length || iForce == 1 ||
2155                         sInput.indexOf(oPrevSearch.sSearch) !== 0 )
2156                  {
2157                      /* Nuke the old display array - we are going to rebuild it */
2158                      oSettings.aiDisplay.splice( 0, oSettings.aiDisplay.length);
2159                      
2160                      /* Force a rebuild of the search array */
2161                      _fnBuildSearchArray( oSettings, 1 );
2162                      
2163                      /* Search through all records to populate the search array
2164                       * The the oSettings.aiDisplayMaster and asDataSearch arrays have 1 to 1 
2165                       * mapping
2166                       */
2167                      for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.length ; i++ )
2168                      {
2169                          if ( rpSearch.test(oSettings.asDataSearch[i]) )
2170                          {
2171                              oSettings.aiDisplay.push( oSettings.aiDisplayMaster[i] );
2172                          }
2173                      }
2174                }
2175                else
2176                  {
2177                    /* Using old search array - refine it - do it this way for speed
2178                     * Don't have to search the whole master array again
2179                       */
2180                    var iIndexCorrector = 0;
2181                    
2182                    /* Search the current results */
2183                    for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.asDataSearch.length ; i++ )
2184                      {
2185                        if ( ! rpSearch.test(oSettings.asDataSearch[i]) )
2186                          {
2187                            oSettings.aiDisplay.splice( i-iIndexCorrector, 1 );
2188                            iIndexCorrector++;
2189                        }
2190                    }
2191                }
2192              }
2193          }
2194          
2195          
2196          /**
2197           * Create an array which can be quickly search through
2198           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2199           *  @param {int} iMaster use the master data array - optional
2200           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2201           */
2202  		function _fnBuildSearchArray ( oSettings, iMaster )
2203          {
2204              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide )
2205              {
2206                  /* Clear out the old data */
2207                  oSettings.asDataSearch.splice( 0, oSettings.asDataSearch.length );
2208                  
2209                  var aArray = (iMaster && iMaster===1) ?
2210                       oSettings.aiDisplayMaster : oSettings.aiDisplay;
2211                  
2212                  for ( var i=0, iLen=aArray.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2213                  {
2214                      oSettings.asDataSearch[i] = _fnBuildSearchRow( oSettings,
2215                          _fnGetRowData( oSettings, aArray[i], 'filter' ) );
2216                  }
2217              }
2218          }
2219          
2220          
2221          /**
2222           * Create a searchable string from a single data row
2223           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2224           *  @param {array} aData Row data array to use for the data to search
2225           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2226           */
2227  		function _fnBuildSearchRow( oSettings, aData )
2228          {
2229              var sSearch = '';
2230              if ( oSettings.__nTmpFilter === undefined )
2231              {
2232                  oSettings.__nTmpFilter = document.createElement('div');
2233              }
2234              var nTmp = oSettings.__nTmpFilter;
2235              
2236              for ( var j=0, jLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
2237              {
2238                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[j].bSearchable )
2239                  {
2240                      var sData = aData[j];
2241                      sSearch += _fnDataToSearch( sData, oSettings.aoColumns[j].sType )+'  ';
2242                  }
2243              }
2244              
2245              /* If it looks like there is an HTML entity in the string, attempt to decode it */
2246              if ( sSearch.indexOf('&') !== -1 )
2247              {
2248                  nTmp.innerHTML = sSearch;
2249                  sSearch = nTmp.textContent ? nTmp.textContent : nTmp.innerText;
2250                  
2251                  /* IE and Opera appear to put an newline where there is a <br> tag - remove it */
2252                  sSearch = sSearch.replace(/\n/g," ").replace(/\r/g,"");
2253              }
2254              
2255              return sSearch;
2256          }
2257          
2258          /**
2259           * Build a regular expression object suitable for searching a table
2260           *  @param {string} sSearch string to search for
2261           *  @param {bool} bRegex treat as a regular expression or not
2262           *  @param {bool} bSmart perform smart filtering or not
2263           *  @param {bool} bCaseInsensitive Do case insenstive matching or not
2264           *  @returns {RegExp} constructed object
2265           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2266           */
2267  		function _fnFilterCreateSearch( sSearch, bRegex, bSmart, bCaseInsensitive )
2268          {
2269              var asSearch, sRegExpString;
2270              
2271              if ( bSmart )
2272              {
2273                  /* Generate the regular expression to use. Something along the lines of:
2274                   * ^(?=.*?\bone\b)(?=.*?\btwo\b)(?=.*?\bthree\b).*$
2275                   */
2276                  asSearch = bRegex ? sSearch.split( ' ' ) : _fnEscapeRegex( sSearch ).split( ' ' );
2277                  sRegExpString = '^(?=.*?'+asSearch.join( ')(?=.*?' )+').*$';
2278                  return new RegExp( sRegExpString, bCaseInsensitive ? "i" : "" );
2279              }
2280              else
2281              {
2282                  sSearch = bRegex ? sSearch : _fnEscapeRegex( sSearch );
2283                  return new RegExp( sSearch, bCaseInsensitive ? "i" : "" );
2284              }
2285          }
2286          
2287          
2288          /**
2289           * Convert raw data into something that the user can search on
2290           *  @param {string} sData data to be modified
2291           *  @param {string} sType data type
2292           *  @returns {string} search string
2293           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2294           */
2295  		function _fnDataToSearch ( sData, sType )
2296          {
2297              if ( typeof DataTable.ext.ofnSearch[sType] === "function" )
2298              {
2299                  return DataTable.ext.ofnSearch[sType]( sData );
2300              }
2301              else if ( sType == "html" )
2302              {
2303                  return sData.replace(/[\r\n]/g," ").replace( /<.*?>/g, "" );
2304              }
2305              else if ( typeof sData === "string" )
2306              {
2307                  return sData.replace(/[\r\n]/g," ");
2308              }
2309              else if ( sData === null )
2310              {
2311                  return '';
2312              }
2313              return sData;
2314          }
2315          
2316          
2317          /**
2318           * scape a string stuch that it can be used in a regular expression
2319           *  @param {string} sVal string to escape
2320           *  @returns {string} escaped string
2321           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2322           */
2323  		function _fnEscapeRegex ( sVal )
2324          {
2325              var acEscape = [ '/', '.', '*', '+', '?', '|', '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '\\', '$', '^' ];
2326              var reReplace = new RegExp( '(\\' + acEscape.join('|\\') + ')', 'g' );
2327              return sVal.replace(reReplace, '\\$1');
2328          }
2329          
2330          
2331          
2332          /**
2333           * Generate the node required for the info display
2334           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2335           *  @returns {node} Information element
2336           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2337           */
2338  		function _fnFeatureHtmlInfo ( oSettings )
2339          {
2340              var nInfo = document.createElement( 'div' );
2341              nInfo.className = oSettings.oClasses.sInfo;
2342              
2343              /* Actions that are to be taken once only for this feature */
2344              if ( !oSettings.aanFeatures.i )
2345              {
2346                  /* Add draw callback */
2347                  oSettings.aoDrawCallback.push( {
2348                      "fn": _fnUpdateInfo,
2349                      "sName": "information"
2350                  } );
2351                  
2352                  /* Add id */
2353                  nInfo.id = oSettings.sTableId+'_info';
2354              }
2355              oSettings.nTable.setAttribute( 'aria-describedby', oSettings.sTableId+'_info' );
2356              
2357              return nInfo;
2358          }
2359          
2360          
2361          /**
2362           * Update the information elements in the display
2363           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2364           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2365           */
2366  		function _fnUpdateInfo ( oSettings )
2367          {
2368              /* Show information about the table */
2369              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bInfo || oSettings.aanFeatures.i.length === 0 )
2370              {
2371                  return;
2372              }
2373              
2374              var
2375                  iStart = oSettings._iDisplayStart+1, iEnd = oSettings.fnDisplayEnd(),
2376                  iMax = oSettings.fnRecordsTotal(), iTotal = oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay(),
2377                  sStart = oSettings.fnFormatNumber( iStart ), sEnd = oSettings.fnFormatNumber( iEnd ),
2378                  sMax = oSettings.fnFormatNumber( iMax ), sTotal = oSettings.fnFormatNumber( iTotal ),
2379                  sOut;
2380              
2381              /* When infinite scrolling, we are always starting at 1. _iDisplayStart is used only
2382               * internally
2383               */
2384              if ( oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite )
2385              {
2386                  sStart = oSettings.fnFormatNumber( 1 );
2387              }
2388              
2389              if ( oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() === 0 && 
2390                     oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() == oSettings.fnRecordsTotal() )
2391              {
2392                  /* Empty record set */
2393                  sOut = oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoEmpty+ oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoPostFix;
2394              }
2395              else if ( oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() === 0 )
2396              {
2397                  /* Rmpty record set after filtering */
2398                  sOut = oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoEmpty +' '+ 
2399                      oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoFiltered.replace('_MAX_', sMax)+
2400                          oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoPostFix;
2401              }
2402              else if ( oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() == oSettings.fnRecordsTotal() )
2403              {
2404                  /* Normal record set */
2405                  sOut = oSettings.oLanguage.sInfo.
2406                          replace('_START_', sStart).
2407                          replace('_END_',   sEnd).
2408                          replace('_TOTAL_', sTotal)+ 
2409                      oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoPostFix;
2410              }
2411              else
2412              {
2413                  /* Record set after filtering */
2414                  sOut = oSettings.oLanguage.sInfo.
2415                          replace('_START_', sStart).
2416                          replace('_END_',   sEnd).
2417                          replace('_TOTAL_', sTotal) +' '+ 
2418                      oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoFiltered.replace('_MAX_', 
2419                          oSettings.fnFormatNumber(oSettings.fnRecordsTotal()))+ 
2420                      oSettings.oLanguage.sInfoPostFix;
2421              }
2422              
2423              if ( oSettings.oLanguage.fnInfoCallback !== null )
2424              {
2425                  sOut = oSettings.oLanguage.fnInfoCallback.call( oSettings.oInstance, 
2426                      oSettings, iStart, iEnd, iMax, iTotal, sOut );
2427              }
2428              
2429              var n = oSettings.aanFeatures.i;
2430              for ( var i=0, iLen=n.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2431              {
2432                  $(n[i]).html( sOut );
2433              }
2434          }
2435          
2436          
2437          
2438          /**
2439           * Draw the table for the first time, adding all required features
2440           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2441           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2442           */
2443  		function _fnInitialise ( oSettings )
2444          {
2445              var i, iLen, iAjaxStart=oSettings.iInitDisplayStart;
2446              
2447              /* Ensure that the table data is fully initialised */
2448              if ( oSettings.bInitialised === false )
2449              {
2450                  setTimeout( function(){ _fnInitialise( oSettings ); }, 200 );
2451                  return;
2452              }
2453              
2454              /* Show the display HTML options */
2455              _fnAddOptionsHtml( oSettings );
2456              
2457              /* Build and draw the header / footer for the table */
2458              _fnBuildHead( oSettings );
2459              _fnDrawHead( oSettings, oSettings.aoHeader );
2460              if ( oSettings.nTFoot )
2461              {
2462                  _fnDrawHead( oSettings, oSettings.aoFooter );
2463              }
2464          
2465              /* Okay to show that something is going on now */
2466              _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, true );
2467              
2468              /* Calculate sizes for columns */
2469              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bAutoWidth )
2470              {
2471                  _fnCalculateColumnWidths( oSettings );
2472              }
2473              
2474              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2475              {
2476                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth !== null )
2477                  {
2478                      oSettings.aoColumns[i].nTh.style.width = _fnStringToCss( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth );
2479                  }
2480              }
2481              
2482              /* If there is default sorting required - let's do it. The sort function will do the
2483               * drawing for us. Otherwise we draw the table regardless of the Ajax source - this allows
2484               * the table to look initialised for Ajax sourcing data (show 'loading' message possibly)
2485               */
2486              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bSort )
2487              {
2488                  _fnSort( oSettings );
2489              }
2490              else if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bFilter )
2491              {
2492                  _fnFilterComplete( oSettings, oSettings.oPreviousSearch );
2493              }
2494              else
2495              {
2496                  oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
2497                  _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
2498                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
2499              }
2500              
2501              /* if there is an ajax source load the data */
2502              if ( oSettings.sAjaxSource !== null && !oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide )
2503              {
2504                  var aoData = [];
2505                  _fnServerParams( oSettings, aoData );
2506                  oSettings.fnServerData.call( oSettings.oInstance, oSettings.sAjaxSource, aoData, function(json) {
2507                      var aData = (oSettings.sAjaxDataProp !== "") ?
2508                           _fnGetObjectDataFn( oSettings.sAjaxDataProp )(json) : json;
2509          
2510                      /* Got the data - add it to the table */
2511                      for ( i=0 ; i<aData.length ; i++ )
2512                      {
2513                          _fnAddData( oSettings, aData[i] );
2514                      }
2515                      
2516                      /* Reset the init display for cookie saving. We've already done a filter, and
2517                       * therefore cleared it before. So we need to make it appear 'fresh'
2518                       */
2519                      oSettings.iInitDisplayStart = iAjaxStart;
2520                      
2521                      if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bSort )
2522                      {
2523                          _fnSort( oSettings );
2524                      }
2525                      else
2526                      {
2527                          oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
2528                          _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
2529                          _fnDraw( oSettings );
2530                      }
2531                      
2532                      _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, false );
2533                      _fnInitComplete( oSettings, json );
2534                  }, oSettings );
2535                  return;
2536              }
2537              
2538              /* Server-side processing initialisation complete is done at the end of _fnDraw */
2539              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide )
2540              {
2541                  _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, false );
2542                  _fnInitComplete( oSettings );
2543              }
2544          }
2545          
2546          
2547          /**
2548           * Draw the table for the first time, adding all required features
2549           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2550           *  @param {object} [json] JSON from the server that completed the table, if using Ajax source
2551           *    with client-side processing (optional)
2552           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2553           */
2554  		function _fnInitComplete ( oSettings, json )
2555          {
2556              oSettings._bInitComplete = true;
2557              _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoInitComplete', 'init', [oSettings, json] );
2558          }
2559          
2560          
2561          /**
2562           * Language compatibility - when certain options are given, and others aren't, we
2563           * need to duplicate the values over, in order to provide backwards compatibility
2564           * with older language files.
2565           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2566           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2567           */
2568  		function _fnLanguageCompat( oLanguage )
2569          {
2570              /* Backwards compatibility - if there is no sEmptyTable given, then use the same as
2571               * sZeroRecords - assuming that is given.
2572               */
2573              if ( !oLanguage.sEmptyTable && oLanguage.sZeroRecords )
2574              {
2575                  _fnMap( oLanguage, oLanguage, 'sZeroRecords', 'sEmptyTable' );
2576              }
2577          
2578              /* Likewise with loading records */
2579              if ( !oLanguage.sLoadingRecords && oLanguage.sZeroRecords )
2580              {
2581                  _fnMap( oLanguage, oLanguage, 'sZeroRecords', 'sLoadingRecords' );
2582              }
2583          }
2584          
2585          
2586          
2587          /**
2588           * Generate the node required for user display length changing
2589           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2590           *  @returns {node} Display length feature node
2591           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2592           */
2593  		function _fnFeatureHtmlLength ( oSettings )
2594          {
2595              if ( oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite )
2596              {
2597                  return null;
2598              }
2599              
2600              /* This can be overruled by not using the _MENU_ var/macro in the language variable */
2601              var sName = 'name="'+oSettings.sTableId+'_length"';
2602              var sStdMenu = '<select size="1" '+sName+'>';
2603              var i, iLen;
2604              var aLengthMenu = oSettings.aLengthMenu;
2605              
2606              if ( aLengthMenu.length == 2 && typeof aLengthMenu[0] === 'object' && 
2607                      typeof aLengthMenu[1] === 'object' )
2608              {
2609                  for ( i=0, iLen=aLengthMenu[0].length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2610                  {
2611                      sStdMenu += '<option value="'+aLengthMenu[0][i]+'">'+aLengthMenu[1][i]+'</option>';
2612                  }
2613              }
2614              else
2615              {
2616                  for ( i=0, iLen=aLengthMenu.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2617                  {
2618                      sStdMenu += '<option value="'+aLengthMenu[i]+'">'+aLengthMenu[i]+'</option>';
2619                  }
2620              }
2621              sStdMenu += '</select>';
2622              
2623              var nLength = document.createElement( 'div' );
2624              if ( !oSettings.aanFeatures.l )
2625              {
2626                  nLength.id = oSettings.sTableId+'_length';
2627              }
2628              nLength.className = oSettings.oClasses.sLength;
2629              nLength.innerHTML = '<label>'+oSettings.oLanguage.sLengthMenu.replace( '_MENU_', sStdMenu )+'</label>';
2630              
2631              /*
2632               * Set the length to the current display length - thanks to Andrea Pavlovic for this fix,
2633               * and Stefan Skopnik for fixing the fix!
2634               */
2635              $('select option[value="'+oSettings._iDisplayLength+'"]', nLength).attr("selected", true);
2636              
2637              $('select', nLength).bind( 'change.DT', function(e) {
2638                  var iVal = $(this).val();
2639                  
2640                  /* Update all other length options for the new display */
2641                  var n = oSettings.aanFeatures.l;
2642                  for ( i=0, iLen=n.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2643                  {
2644                      if ( n[i] != this.parentNode )
2645                      {
2646                          $('select', n[i]).val( iVal );
2647                      }
2648                  }
2649                  
2650                  /* Redraw the table */
2651                  oSettings._iDisplayLength = parseInt(iVal, 10);
2652                  _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
2653                  
2654                  /* If we have space to show extra rows (backing up from the end point - then do so */
2655                  if ( oSettings.fnDisplayEnd() == oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() )
2656                  {
2657                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = oSettings.fnDisplayEnd() - oSettings._iDisplayLength;
2658                      if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart < 0 )
2659                      {
2660                          oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2661                      }
2662                  }
2663                  
2664                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayLength == -1 )
2665                  {
2666                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2667                  }
2668                  
2669                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
2670              } );
2671          
2672          
2673              $('select', nLength).attr('aria-controls', oSettings.sTableId);
2674              
2675              return nLength;
2676          }
2677          
2678          
2679          /**
2680           * Rcalculate the end point based on the start point
2681           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2682           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2683           */
2684  		function _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings )
2685          {
2686              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bPaginate === false )
2687              {
2688                  oSettings._iDisplayEnd = oSettings.aiDisplay.length;
2689              }
2690              else
2691              {
2692                  /* Set the end point of the display - based on how many elements there are
2693                   * still to display
2694                   */
2695                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart + oSettings._iDisplayLength > oSettings.aiDisplay.length ||
2696                         oSettings._iDisplayLength == -1 )
2697                  {
2698                      oSettings._iDisplayEnd = oSettings.aiDisplay.length;
2699                  }
2700                  else
2701                  {
2702                      oSettings._iDisplayEnd = oSettings._iDisplayStart + oSettings._iDisplayLength;
2703                  }
2704              }
2705          }
2706          
2707          
2708          
2709          /* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
2710           * Note that most of the paging logic is done in 
2711           * DataTable.ext.oPagination
2712           */
2713          
2714          /**
2715           * Generate the node required for default pagination
2716           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2717           *  @returns {node} Pagination feature node
2718           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2719           */
2720  		function _fnFeatureHtmlPaginate ( oSettings )
2721          {
2722              if ( oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite )
2723              {
2724                  return null;
2725              }
2726              
2727              var nPaginate = document.createElement( 'div' );
2728              nPaginate.className = oSettings.oClasses.sPaging+oSettings.sPaginationType;
2729              
2730              DataTable.ext.oPagination[ oSettings.sPaginationType ].fnInit( oSettings, nPaginate, 
2731                  function( oSettings ) {
2732                      _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
2733                      _fnDraw( oSettings );
2734                  }
2735              );
2736              
2737              /* Add a draw callback for the pagination on first instance, to update the paging display */
2738              if ( !oSettings.aanFeatures.p )
2739              {
2740                  oSettings.aoDrawCallback.push( {
2741                      "fn": function( oSettings ) {
2742                          DataTable.ext.oPagination[ oSettings.sPaginationType ].fnUpdate( oSettings, function( oSettings ) {
2743                              _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
2744                              _fnDraw( oSettings );
2745                          } );
2746                      },
2747                      "sName": "pagination"
2748                  } );
2749              }
2750              return nPaginate;
2751          }
2752          
2753          
2754          /**
2755           * Alter the display settings to change the page
2756           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2757           *  @param {string|int} mAction Paging action to take: "first", "previous", "next" or "last"
2758           *    or page number to jump to (integer)
2759           *  @returns {bool} true page has changed, false - no change (no effect) eg 'first' on page 1
2760           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2761           */
2762  		function _fnPageChange ( oSettings, mAction )
2763          {
2764              var iOldStart = oSettings._iDisplayStart;
2765              
2766              if ( typeof mAction === "number" )
2767              {
2768                  oSettings._iDisplayStart = mAction * oSettings._iDisplayLength;
2769                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart > oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() )
2770                  {
2771                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2772                  }
2773              }
2774              else if ( mAction == "first" )
2775              {
2776                  oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2777              }
2778              else if ( mAction == "previous" )
2779              {
2780                  oSettings._iDisplayStart = oSettings._iDisplayLength>=0 ?
2781                      oSettings._iDisplayStart - oSettings._iDisplayLength :
2782                      0;
2783                  
2784                  /* Correct for underrun */
2785                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart < 0 )
2786                  {
2787                    oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2788                  }
2789              }
2790              else if ( mAction == "next" )
2791              {
2792                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayLength >= 0 )
2793                  {
2794                      /* Make sure we are not over running the display array */
2795                      if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart + oSettings._iDisplayLength < oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() )
2796                      {
2797                          oSettings._iDisplayStart += oSettings._iDisplayLength;
2798                      }
2799                  }
2800                  else
2801                  {
2802                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2803                  }
2804              }
2805              else if ( mAction == "last" )
2806              {
2807                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayLength >= 0 )
2808                  {
2809                      var iPages = parseInt( (oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay()-1) / oSettings._iDisplayLength, 10 ) + 1;
2810                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = (iPages-1) * oSettings._iDisplayLength;
2811                  }
2812                  else
2813                  {
2814                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
2815                  }
2816              }
2817              else
2818              {
2819                  _fnLog( oSettings, 0, "Unknown paging action: "+mAction );
2820              }
2821              $(oSettings.oInstance).trigger('page', oSettings);
2822              
2823              return iOldStart != oSettings._iDisplayStart;
2824          }
2825          
2826          
2827          
2828          /**
2829           * Generate the node required for the processing node
2830           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2831           *  @returns {node} Processing element
2832           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2833           */
2834  		function _fnFeatureHtmlProcessing ( oSettings )
2835          {
2836              var nProcessing = document.createElement( 'div' );
2837              
2838              if ( !oSettings.aanFeatures.r )
2839              {
2840                  nProcessing.id = oSettings.sTableId+'_processing';
2841              }
2842              nProcessing.innerHTML = oSettings.oLanguage.sProcessing;
2843              nProcessing.className = oSettings.oClasses.sProcessing;
2844              oSettings.nTable.parentNode.insertBefore( nProcessing, oSettings.nTable );
2845              
2846              return nProcessing;
2847          }
2848          
2849          
2850          /**
2851           * Display or hide the processing indicator
2852           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2853           *  @param {bool} bShow Show the processing indicator (true) or not (false)
2854           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2855           */
2856  		function _fnProcessingDisplay ( oSettings, bShow )
2857          {
2858              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bProcessing )
2859              {
2860                  var an = oSettings.aanFeatures.r;
2861                  for ( var i=0, iLen=an.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2862                  {
2863                      an[i].style.visibility = bShow ? "visible" : "hidden";
2864                  }
2865              }
2866          
2867              $(oSettings.oInstance).trigger('processing', [oSettings, bShow]);
2868          }
2869          
2870          
2871          
2872          /**
2873           * Add any control elements for the table - specifically scrolling
2874           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
2875           *  @returns {node} Node to add to the DOM
2876           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
2877           */
2878  		function _fnFeatureHtmlTable ( oSettings )
2879          {
2880              /* Check if scrolling is enabled or not - if not then leave the DOM unaltered */
2881              if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX === "" && oSettings.oScroll.sY === "" )
2882              {
2883                  return oSettings.nTable;
2884              }
2885              
2886              /*
2887               * The HTML structure that we want to generate in this function is:
2888               *  div - nScroller
2889               *    div - nScrollHead
2890               *      div - nScrollHeadInner
2891               *        table - nScrollHeadTable
2892               *          thead - nThead
2893               *    div - nScrollBody
2894               *      table - oSettings.nTable
2895               *        thead - nTheadSize
2896               *        tbody - nTbody
2897               *    div - nScrollFoot
2898               *      div - nScrollFootInner
2899               *        table - nScrollFootTable
2900               *          tfoot - nTfoot
2901               */
2902              var
2903                   nScroller = document.createElement('div'),
2904                   nScrollHead = document.createElement('div'),
2905                   nScrollHeadInner = document.createElement('div'),
2906                   nScrollBody = document.createElement('div'),
2907                   nScrollFoot = document.createElement('div'),
2908                   nScrollFootInner = document.createElement('div'),
2909                   nScrollHeadTable = oSettings.nTable.cloneNode(false),
2910                   nScrollFootTable = oSettings.nTable.cloneNode(false),
2911                  nThead = oSettings.nTable.getElementsByTagName('thead')[0],
2912                   nTfoot = oSettings.nTable.getElementsByTagName('tfoot').length === 0 ? null : 
2913                      oSettings.nTable.getElementsByTagName('tfoot')[0],
2914                  oClasses = oSettings.oClasses;
2915              
2916              nScrollHead.appendChild( nScrollHeadInner );
2917              nScrollFoot.appendChild( nScrollFootInner );
2918              nScrollBody.appendChild( oSettings.nTable );
2919              nScroller.appendChild( nScrollHead );
2920              nScroller.appendChild( nScrollBody );
2921              nScrollHeadInner.appendChild( nScrollHeadTable );
2922              nScrollHeadTable.appendChild( nThead );
2923              if ( nTfoot !== null )
2924              {
2925                  nScroller.appendChild( nScrollFoot );
2926                  nScrollFootInner.appendChild( nScrollFootTable );
2927                  nScrollFootTable.appendChild( nTfoot );
2928              }
2929              
2930              nScroller.className = oClasses.sScrollWrapper;
2931              nScrollHead.className = oClasses.sScrollHead;
2932              nScrollHeadInner.className = oClasses.sScrollHeadInner;
2933              nScrollBody.className = oClasses.sScrollBody;
2934              nScrollFoot.className = oClasses.sScrollFoot;
2935              nScrollFootInner.className = oClasses.sScrollFootInner;
2936              
2937              if ( oSettings.oScroll.bAutoCss )
2938              {
2939                  nScrollHead.style.overflow = "hidden";
2940                  nScrollHead.style.position = "relative";
2941                  nScrollFoot.style.overflow = "hidden";
2942                  nScrollBody.style.overflow = "auto";
2943              }
2944              
2945              nScrollHead.style.border = "0";
2946              nScrollHead.style.width = "100%";
2947              nScrollFoot.style.border = "0";
2948              nScrollHeadInner.style.width = "150%"; /* will be overwritten */
2949              
2950              /* Modify attributes to respect the clones */
2951              nScrollHeadTable.removeAttribute('id');
2952              nScrollHeadTable.style.marginLeft = "0";
2953              oSettings.nTable.style.marginLeft = "0";
2954              if ( nTfoot !== null )
2955              {
2956                  nScrollFootTable.removeAttribute('id');
2957                  nScrollFootTable.style.marginLeft = "0";
2958              }
2959              
2960              /* Move any caption elements from the body to the header */
2961              var nCaptions = $(oSettings.nTable).children('caption');
2962              for ( var i=0, iLen=nCaptions.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2963              {
2964                  nScrollHeadTable.appendChild( nCaptions[i] );
2965              }
2966              
2967              /*
2968               * Sizing
2969               */
2970              /* When xscrolling add the width and a scroller to move the header with the body */
2971              if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" )
2972              {
2973                  nScrollHead.style.width = _fnStringToCss( oSettings.oScroll.sX );
2974                  nScrollBody.style.width = _fnStringToCss( oSettings.oScroll.sX );
2975                  
2976                  if ( nTfoot !== null )
2977                  {
2978                      nScrollFoot.style.width = _fnStringToCss( oSettings.oScroll.sX );    
2979                  }
2980                  
2981                  /* When the body is scrolled, then we also want to scroll the headers */
2982                  $(nScrollBody).scroll( function (e) {
2983                      nScrollHead.scrollLeft = this.scrollLeft;
2984                      
2985                      if ( nTfoot !== null )
2986                      {
2987                          nScrollFoot.scrollLeft = this.scrollLeft;
2988                      }
2989                  } );
2990              }
2991              
2992              /* When yscrolling, add the height */
2993              if ( oSettings.oScroll.sY !== "" )
2994              {
2995                  nScrollBody.style.height = _fnStringToCss( oSettings.oScroll.sY );
2996              }
2997              
2998              /* Redraw - align columns across the tables */
2999              oSettings.aoDrawCallback.push( {
3000                  "fn": _fnScrollDraw,
3001                  "sName": "scrolling"
3002              } );
3003              
3004              /* Infinite scrolling event handlers */
3005              if ( oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite )
3006              {
3007                  $(nScrollBody).scroll( function() {
3008                      /* Use a blocker to stop scrolling from loading more data while other data is still loading */
3009                      if ( !oSettings.bDrawing && $(this).scrollTop() !== 0 )
3010                      {
3011                          /* Check if we should load the next data set */
3012                          if ( $(this).scrollTop() + $(this).height() > 
3013                              $(oSettings.nTable).height() - oSettings.oScroll.iLoadGap )
3014                          {
3015                              /* Only do the redraw if we have to - we might be at the end of the data */
3016                              if ( oSettings.fnDisplayEnd() < oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() )
3017                              {
3018                                  _fnPageChange( oSettings, 'next' );
3019                                  _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
3020                                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
3021                              }
3022                          }
3023                      }
3024                  } );
3025              }
3026              
3027              oSettings.nScrollHead = nScrollHead;
3028              oSettings.nScrollFoot = nScrollFoot;
3029              
3030              return nScroller;
3031          }
3032          
3033          
3034          /**
3035           * Update the various tables for resizing. It's a bit of a pig this function, but
3036           * basically the idea to:
3037           *   1. Re-create the table inside the scrolling div
3038           *   2. Take live measurements from the DOM
3039           *   3. Apply the measurements
3040           *   4. Clean up
3041           *  @param {object} o dataTables settings object
3042           *  @returns {node} Node to add to the DOM
3043           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3044           */
3045  		function _fnScrollDraw ( o )
3046          {
3047              var
3048                  nScrollHeadInner = o.nScrollHead.getElementsByTagName('div')[0],
3049                  nScrollHeadTable = nScrollHeadInner.getElementsByTagName('table')[0],
3050                  nScrollBody = o.nTable.parentNode,
3051                  i, iLen, j, jLen, anHeadToSize, anHeadSizers, anFootSizers, anFootToSize, oStyle, iVis,
3052                  iWidth, aApplied=[], iSanityWidth,
3053                  nScrollFootInner = (o.nTFoot !== null) ? o.nScrollFoot.getElementsByTagName('div')[0] : null,
3054                  nScrollFootTable = (o.nTFoot !== null) ? nScrollFootInner.getElementsByTagName('table')[0] : null,
3055                  ie67 = $.browser.msie && $.browser.version <= 7;
3056              
3057              /*
3058               * 1. Re-create the table inside the scrolling div
3059               */
3060              
3061              /* Remove the old minimised thead and tfoot elements in the inner table */
3062              var nTheadSize = o.nTable.getElementsByTagName('thead');
3063              if ( nTheadSize.length > 0 )
3064              {
3065                  o.nTable.removeChild( nTheadSize[0] );
3066              }
3067              
3068              var nTfootSize;
3069              if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3070              {
3071                  /* Remove the old minimised footer element in the cloned header */
3072                  nTfootSize = o.nTable.getElementsByTagName('tfoot');
3073                  if ( nTfootSize.length > 0 )
3074                  {
3075                      o.nTable.removeChild( nTfootSize[0] );
3076                  }
3077              }
3078              
3079              /* Clone the current header and footer elements and then place it into the inner table */
3080              nTheadSize = o.nTHead.cloneNode(true);
3081              o.nTable.insertBefore( nTheadSize, o.nTable.childNodes[0] );
3082              
3083              if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3084              {
3085                  nTfootSize = o.nTFoot.cloneNode(true);
3086                  o.nTable.insertBefore( nTfootSize, o.nTable.childNodes[1] );
3087              }
3088              
3089              /*
3090               * 2. Take live measurements from the DOM - do not alter the DOM itself!
3091               */
3092              
3093              /* Remove old sizing and apply the calculated column widths
3094               * Get the unique column headers in the newly created (cloned) header. We want to apply the
3095               * calclated sizes to this header
3096               */
3097              if ( o.oScroll.sX === "" )
3098              {
3099                  nScrollBody.style.width = '100%';
3100                  nScrollHeadInner.parentNode.style.width = '100%';
3101              }
3102              
3103              var nThs = _fnGetUniqueThs( o, nTheadSize );
3104              for ( i=0, iLen=nThs.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
3105              {
3106                  iVis = _fnVisibleToColumnIndex( o, i );
3107                  nThs[i].style.width = o.aoColumns[iVis].sWidth;
3108              }
3109              
3110              if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3111              {
3112                  _fnApplyToChildren( function(n) {
3113                      n.style.width = "";
3114                  }, nTfootSize.getElementsByTagName('tr') );
3115              }
3116              
3117              /* Size the table as a whole */
3118              iSanityWidth = $(o.nTable).outerWidth();
3119              if ( o.oScroll.sX === "" )
3120              {
3121                  /* No x scrolling */
3122                  o.nTable.style.width = "100%";
3123                  
3124                  /* I know this is rubbish - but IE7 will make the width of the table when 100% include
3125                   * the scrollbar - which is shouldn't. When there is a scrollbar we need to take this
3126                   * into account.
3127                   */
3128                  if ( ie67 && ($('tbody', nScrollBody).height() > nScrollBody.offsetHeight || 
3129                      $(nScrollBody).css('overflow-y') == "scroll")  )
3130                  {
3131                      o.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( $(o.nTable).outerWidth()-o.oScroll.iBarWidth );
3132                  }
3133              }
3134              else
3135              {
3136                  if ( o.oScroll.sXInner !== "" )
3137                  {
3138                      /* x scroll inner has been given - use it */
3139                      o.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss(o.oScroll.sXInner);
3140                  }
3141                  else if ( iSanityWidth == $(nScrollBody).width() &&
3142                     $(nScrollBody).height() < $(o.nTable).height() )
3143                  {
3144                      /* There is y-scrolling - try to take account of the y scroll bar */
3145                      o.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iSanityWidth-o.oScroll.iBarWidth );
3146                      if ( $(o.nTable).outerWidth() > iSanityWidth-o.oScroll.iBarWidth )
3147                      {
3148                          /* Not possible to take account of it */
3149                          o.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iSanityWidth );
3150                      }
3151                  }
3152                  else
3153                  {
3154                      /* All else fails */
3155                      o.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iSanityWidth );
3156                  }
3157              }
3158              
3159              /* Recalculate the sanity width - now that we've applied the required width, before it was
3160               * a temporary variable. This is required because the column width calculation is done
3161               * before this table DOM is created.
3162               */
3163              iSanityWidth = $(o.nTable).outerWidth();
3164              
3165              /* We want the hidden header to have zero height, so remove padding and borders. Then
3166               * set the width based on the real headers
3167               */
3168              anHeadToSize = o.nTHead.getElementsByTagName('tr');
3169              anHeadSizers = nTheadSize.getElementsByTagName('tr');
3170              
3171              _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer, nToSize) {
3172                  oStyle = nSizer.style;
3173                  oStyle.paddingTop = "0";
3174                  oStyle.paddingBottom = "0";
3175                  oStyle.borderTopWidth = "0";
3176                  oStyle.borderBottomWidth = "0";
3177                  oStyle.height = 0;
3178                  
3179                  iWidth = $(nSizer).width();
3180                  nToSize.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iWidth );
3181                  aApplied.push( iWidth );
3182              }, anHeadSizers, anHeadToSize );
3183              $(anHeadSizers).height(0);
3184              
3185              if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3186              {
3187                  /* Clone the current footer and then place it into the body table as a "hidden header" */
3188                  anFootSizers = nTfootSize.getElementsByTagName('tr');
3189                  anFootToSize = o.nTFoot.getElementsByTagName('tr');
3190                  
3191                  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer, nToSize) {
3192                      oStyle = nSizer.style;
3193                      oStyle.paddingTop = "0";
3194                      oStyle.paddingBottom = "0";
3195                      oStyle.borderTopWidth = "0";
3196                      oStyle.borderBottomWidth = "0";
3197                      oStyle.height = 0;
3198                      
3199                      iWidth = $(nSizer).width();
3200                      nToSize.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iWidth );
3201                      aApplied.push( iWidth );
3202                  }, anFootSizers, anFootToSize );
3203                  $(anFootSizers).height(0);
3204              }
3205              
3206              /*
3207               * 3. Apply the measurements
3208               */
3209              
3210              /* "Hide" the header and footer that we used for the sizing. We want to also fix their width
3211               * to what they currently are
3212               */
3213              _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer) {
3214                  nSizer.innerHTML = "";
3215                  nSizer.style.width = _fnStringToCss( aApplied.shift() );
3216              }, anHeadSizers );
3217              
3218              if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3219              {
3220                  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer) {
3221                      nSizer.innerHTML = "";
3222                      nSizer.style.width = _fnStringToCss( aApplied.shift() );
3223                  }, anFootSizers );
3224              }
3225              
3226              /* Sanity check that the table is of a sensible width. If not then we are going to get
3227               * misalignment - try to prevent this by not allowing the table to shrink below its min width
3228               */
3229              if ( $(o.nTable).outerWidth() < iSanityWidth )
3230              {
3231                  /* The min width depends upon if we have a vertical scrollbar visible or not */
3232                  var iCorrection = ((nScrollBody.scrollHeight > nScrollBody.offsetHeight || 
3233                      $(nScrollBody).css('overflow-y') == "scroll")) ?
3234                          iSanityWidth+o.oScroll.iBarWidth : iSanityWidth;
3235                  
3236                  /* IE6/7 are a law unto themselves... */
3237                  if ( ie67 && (nScrollBody.scrollHeight > 
3238                      nScrollBody.offsetHeight || $(nScrollBody).css('overflow-y') == "scroll")  )
3239                  {
3240                      o.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iCorrection-o.oScroll.iBarWidth );
3241                  }
3242                  
3243                  /* Apply the calculated minimum width to the table wrappers */
3244                  nScrollBody.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iCorrection );
3245                  nScrollHeadInner.parentNode.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iCorrection );
3246                  
3247                  if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3248                  {
3249                      nScrollFootInner.parentNode.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iCorrection );
3250                  }
3251                  
3252                  /* And give the user a warning that we've stopped the table getting too small */
3253                  if ( o.oScroll.sX === "" )
3254                  {
3255                      _fnLog( o, 1, "The table cannot fit into the current element which will cause column"+
3256                          " misalignment. The table has been drawn at its minimum possible width." );
3257                  }
3258                  else if ( o.oScroll.sXInner !== "" )
3259                  {
3260                      _fnLog( o, 1, "The table cannot fit into the current element which will cause column"+
3261                          " misalignment. Increase the sScrollXInner value or remove it to allow automatic"+
3262                          " calculation" );
3263                  }
3264              }
3265              else
3266              {
3267                  nScrollBody.style.width = _fnStringToCss( '100%' );
3268                  nScrollHeadInner.parentNode.style.width = _fnStringToCss( '100%' );
3269                  
3270                  if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3271                  {
3272                      nScrollFootInner.parentNode.style.width = _fnStringToCss( '100%' );
3273                  }
3274              }
3275              
3276              
3277              /*
3278               * 4. Clean up
3279               */
3280              if ( o.oScroll.sY === "" )
3281              {
3282                  /* IE7< puts a vertical scrollbar in place (when it shouldn't be) due to subtracting
3283                   * the scrollbar height from the visible display, rather than adding it on. We need to
3284                   * set the height in order to sort this. Don't want to do it in any other browsers.
3285                   */
3286                  if ( ie67 )
3287                  {
3288                      nScrollBody.style.height = _fnStringToCss( o.nTable.offsetHeight+o.oScroll.iBarWidth );
3289                  }
3290              }
3291              
3292              if ( o.oScroll.sY !== "" && o.oScroll.bCollapse )
3293              {
3294                  nScrollBody.style.height = _fnStringToCss( o.oScroll.sY );
3295                  
3296                  var iExtra = (o.oScroll.sX !== "" && o.nTable.offsetWidth > nScrollBody.offsetWidth) ?
3297                       o.oScroll.iBarWidth : 0;
3298                  if ( o.nTable.offsetHeight < nScrollBody.offsetHeight )
3299                  {
3300                      nScrollBody.style.height = _fnStringToCss( $(o.nTable).height()+iExtra );
3301                  }
3302              }
3303              
3304              /* Finally set the width's of the header and footer tables */
3305              var iOuterWidth = $(o.nTable).outerWidth();
3306              nScrollHeadTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iOuterWidth );
3307              nScrollHeadInner.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iOuterWidth );
3308              
3309              if ( o.nTFoot !== null )
3310              {
3311                  nScrollFootInner.style.width = _fnStringToCss( o.nTable.offsetWidth );
3312                  nScrollFootTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( o.nTable.offsetWidth );
3313              }
3314              
3315              /* If sorting or filtering has occurred, jump the scrolling back to the top */
3316              if ( o.bSorted || o.bFiltered )
3317              {
3318                  nScrollBody.scrollTop = 0;
3319              }
3320          }
3321          
3322          
3323          /**
3324           * Apply a given function to the display child nodes of an element array (typically
3325           * TD children of TR rows
3326           *  @param {function} fn Method to apply to the objects
3327           *  @param array {nodes} an1 List of elements to look through for display children
3328           *  @param array {nodes} an2 Another list (identical structure to the first) - optional
3329           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3330           */
3331  		function _fnApplyToChildren( fn, an1, an2 )
3332          {
3333              for ( var i=0, iLen=an1.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
3334              {
3335                  for ( var j=0, jLen=an1[i].childNodes.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
3336                  {
3337                      if ( an1[i].childNodes[j].nodeType == 1 )
3338                      {
3339                          if ( an2 )
3340                          {
3341                              fn( an1[i].childNodes[j], an2[i].childNodes[j] );
3342                          }
3343                          else
3344                          {
3345                              fn( an1[i].childNodes[j] );
3346                          }
3347                      }
3348                  }
3349              }
3350          }
3351          
3352          
3353          
3354          /**
3355           * Convert a CSS unit width to pixels (e.g. 2em)
3356           *  @param {string} sWidth width to be converted
3357           *  @param {node} nParent parent to get the with for (required for relative widths) - optional
3358           *  @returns {int} iWidth width in pixels
3359           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3360           */
3361  		function _fnConvertToWidth ( sWidth, nParent )
3362          {
3363              if ( !sWidth || sWidth === null || sWidth === '' )
3364              {
3365                  return 0;
3366              }
3367              
3368              if ( !nParent )
3369              {
3370                  nParent = document.getElementsByTagName('body')[0];
3371              }
3372              
3373              var iWidth;
3374              var nTmp = document.createElement( "div" );
3375              nTmp.style.width = _fnStringToCss( sWidth );
3376              
3377              nParent.appendChild( nTmp );
3378              iWidth = nTmp.offsetWidth;
3379              nParent.removeChild( nTmp );
3380              
3381              return ( iWidth );
3382          }
3383          
3384          
3385          /**
3386           * Calculate the width of columns for the table
3387           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
3388           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3389           */
3390  		function _fnCalculateColumnWidths ( oSettings )
3391          {
3392              var iTableWidth = oSettings.nTable.offsetWidth;
3393              var iUserInputs = 0;
3394              var iTmpWidth;
3395              var iVisibleColumns = 0;
3396              var iColums = oSettings.aoColumns.length;
3397              var i, iIndex, iCorrector, iWidth;
3398              var oHeaders = $('th', oSettings.nTHead);
3399              var widthAttr = oSettings.nTable.getAttribute('width');
3400              
3401              /* Convert any user input sizes into pixel sizes */
3402              for ( i=0 ; i<iColums ; i++ )
3403              {
3404                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bVisible )
3405                  {
3406                      iVisibleColumns++;
3407                      
3408                      if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth !== null )
3409                      {
3410                          iTmpWidth = _fnConvertToWidth( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidthOrig, 
3411                              oSettings.nTable.parentNode );
3412                          if ( iTmpWidth !== null )
3413                          {
3414                              oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth = _fnStringToCss( iTmpWidth );
3415                          }
3416                              
3417                          iUserInputs++;
3418                      }
3419                  }
