3420              }
3421              
3422              /* If the number of columns in the DOM equals the number that we have to process in 
3423               * DataTables, then we can use the offsets that are created by the web-browser. No custom 
3424               * sizes can be set in order for this to happen, nor scrolling used
3425               */
3426              if ( iColums == oHeaders.length && iUserInputs === 0 && iVisibleColumns == iColums &&
3427                  oSettings.oScroll.sX === "" && oSettings.oScroll.sY === "" )
3428              {
3429                  for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i++ )
3430                  {
3431                      iTmpWidth = $(oHeaders[i]).width();
3432                      if ( iTmpWidth !== null )
3433                      {
3434                          oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth = _fnStringToCss( iTmpWidth );
3435                      }
3436                  }
3437              }
3438              else
3439              {
3440                  /* Otherwise we are going to have to do some calculations to get the width of each column.
3441                   * Construct a 1 row table with the widest node in the data, and any user defined widths,
3442                   * then insert it into the DOM and allow the browser to do all the hard work of
3443                   * calculating table widths.
3444                   */
3445                  var
3446                      nCalcTmp = oSettings.nTable.cloneNode( false ),
3447                      nTheadClone = oSettings.nTHead.cloneNode(true),
3448                      nBody = document.createElement( 'tbody' ),
3449                      nTr = document.createElement( 'tr' ),
3450                      nDivSizing;
3451                  
3452                  nCalcTmp.removeAttribute( "id" );
3453                  nCalcTmp.appendChild( nTheadClone );
3454                  if ( oSettings.nTFoot !== null )
3455                  {
3456                      nCalcTmp.appendChild( oSettings.nTFoot.cloneNode(true) );
3457                      _fnApplyToChildren( function(n) {
3458                          n.style.width = "";
3459                      }, nCalcTmp.getElementsByTagName('tr') );
3460                  }
3461                  
3462                  nCalcTmp.appendChild( nBody );
3463                  nBody.appendChild( nTr );
3464                  
3465                  /* Remove any sizing that was previously applied by the styles */
3466                  var jqColSizing = $('thead th', nCalcTmp);
3467                  if ( jqColSizing.length === 0 )
3468                  {
3469                      jqColSizing = $('tbody tr:eq(0)>td', nCalcTmp);
3470                  }
3471          
3472                  /* Apply custom sizing to the cloned header */
3473                  var nThs = _fnGetUniqueThs( oSettings, nTheadClone );
3474                  iCorrector = 0;
3475                  for ( i=0 ; i<iColums ; i++ )
3476                  {
3477                      var oColumn = oSettings.aoColumns[i];
3478                      if ( oColumn.bVisible && oColumn.sWidthOrig !== null && oColumn.sWidthOrig !== "" )
3479                      {
3480                          nThs[i-iCorrector].style.width = _fnStringToCss( oColumn.sWidthOrig );
3481                      }
3482                      else if ( oColumn.bVisible )
3483                      {
3484                          nThs[i-iCorrector].style.width = "";
3485                      }
3486                      else
3487                      {
3488                          iCorrector++;
3489                      }
3490                  }
3491          
3492                  /* Find the biggest td for each column and put it into the table */
3493                  for ( i=0 ; i<iColums ; i++ )
3494                  {
3495                      if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bVisible )
3496                      {
3497                          var nTd = _fnGetWidestNode( oSettings, i );
3498                          if ( nTd !== null )
3499                          {
3500                              nTd = nTd.cloneNode(true);
3501                              if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sContentPadding !== "" )
3502                              {
3503                                  nTd.innerHTML += oSettings.aoColumns[i].sContentPadding;
3504                              }
3505                              nTr.appendChild( nTd );
3506                          }
3507                      }
3508                  }
3509                  
3510                  /* Build the table and 'display' it */
3511                  var nWrapper = oSettings.nTable.parentNode;
3512                  nWrapper.appendChild( nCalcTmp );
3513                  
3514                  /* When scrolling (X or Y) we want to set the width of the table as appropriate. However,
3515                   * when not scrolling leave the table width as it is. This results in slightly different,
3516                   * but I think correct behaviour
3517                   */
3518                  if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" && oSettings.oScroll.sXInner !== "" )
3519                  {
3520                      nCalcTmp.style.width = _fnStringToCss(oSettings.oScroll.sXInner);
3521                  }
3522                  else if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" )
3523                  {
3524                      nCalcTmp.style.width = "";
3525                      if ( $(nCalcTmp).width() < nWrapper.offsetWidth )
3526                      {
3527                          nCalcTmp.style.width = _fnStringToCss( nWrapper.offsetWidth );
3528                      }
3529                  }
3530                  else if ( oSettings.oScroll.sY !== "" )
3531                  {
3532                      nCalcTmp.style.width = _fnStringToCss( nWrapper.offsetWidth );
3533                  }
3534                  else if ( widthAttr )
3535                  {
3536                      nCalcTmp.style.width = _fnStringToCss( widthAttr );
3537                  }
3538                  nCalcTmp.style.visibility = "hidden";
3539                  
3540                  /* Scrolling considerations */
3541                  _fnScrollingWidthAdjust( oSettings, nCalcTmp );
3542                  
3543                  /* Read the width's calculated by the browser and store them for use by the caller. We
3544                   * first of all try to use the elements in the body, but it is possible that there are
3545                   * no elements there, under which circumstances we use the header elements
3546                   */
3547                  var oNodes = $("tbody tr:eq(0)", nCalcTmp).children();
3548                  if ( oNodes.length === 0 )
3549                  {
3550                      oNodes = _fnGetUniqueThs( oSettings, $('thead', nCalcTmp)[0] );
3551                  }
3552          
3553                  /* Browsers need a bit of a hand when a width is assigned to any columns when 
3554                   * x-scrolling as they tend to collapse the table to the min-width, even if
3555                   * we sent the column widths. So we need to keep track of what the table width
3556                   * should be by summing the user given values, and the automatic values
3557                   */
3558                  if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" )
3559                  {
3560                      var iTotal = 0;
3561                      iCorrector = 0;
3562                      for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i++ )
3563                      {
3564                          if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bVisible )
3565                          {
3566                              if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidthOrig === null )
3567                              {
3568                                  iTotal += $(oNodes[iCorrector]).outerWidth();
3569                              }
3570                              else
3571                              {
3572                                  iTotal += parseInt(oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth.replace('px',''), 10) +
3573                                      ($(oNodes[iCorrector]).outerWidth() - $(oNodes[iCorrector]).width());
3574                              }
3575                              iCorrector++;
3576                          }
3577                      }
3578                      
3579                      nCalcTmp.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iTotal );
3580                      oSettings.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( iTotal );
3581                  }
3582          
3583                  iCorrector = 0;
3584                  for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i++ )
3585                  {
3586                      if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bVisible )
3587                      {
3588                          iWidth = $(oNodes[iCorrector]).width();
3589                          if ( iWidth !== null && iWidth > 0 )
3590                          {
3591                              oSettings.aoColumns[i].sWidth = _fnStringToCss( iWidth );
3592                          }
3593                          iCorrector++;
3594                      }
3595                  }
3596          
3597                  var cssWidth = $(nCalcTmp).css('width');
3598                  oSettings.nTable.style.width = (cssWidth.indexOf('%') !== -1) ?
3599                      cssWidth : _fnStringToCss( $(nCalcTmp).outerWidth() );
3600                  nCalcTmp.parentNode.removeChild( nCalcTmp );
3601              }
3602          
3603              if ( widthAttr )
3604              {
3605                  oSettings.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss( widthAttr );
3606              }
3607          }
3608          
3609          
3610          /**
3611           * Adjust a table's width to take account of scrolling
3612           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
3613           *  @param {node} n table node
3614           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3615           */
3616  		function _fnScrollingWidthAdjust ( oSettings, n )
3617          {
3618              if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX === "" && oSettings.oScroll.sY !== "" )
3619              {
3620                  /* When y-scrolling only, we want to remove the width of the scroll bar so the table
3621                   * + scroll bar will fit into the area avaialble.
3622                   */
3623                  var iOrigWidth = $(n).width();
3624                  n.style.width = _fnStringToCss( $(n).outerWidth()-oSettings.oScroll.iBarWidth );
3625              }
3626              else if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" )
3627              {
3628                  /* When x-scrolling both ways, fix the table at it's current size, without adjusting */
3629                  n.style.width = _fnStringToCss( $(n).outerWidth() );
3630              }
3631          }
3632          
3633          
3634          /**
3635           * Get the widest node
3636           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
3637           *  @param {int} iCol column of interest
3638           *  @returns {string} max strlens for each column
3639           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3640           */
3641  		function _fnGetWidestNode( oSettings, iCol )
3642          {
3643              var iMaxIndex = _fnGetMaxLenString( oSettings, iCol );
3644              if ( iMaxIndex < 0 )
3645              {
3646                  return null;
3647              }
3648          
3649              if ( oSettings.aoData[iMaxIndex].nTr === null )
3650              {
3651                  var n = document.createElement('td');
3652                  n.innerHTML = _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iMaxIndex, iCol, '' );
3653                  return n;
3654              }
3655              return _fnGetTdNodes(oSettings, iMaxIndex)[iCol];
3656          }
3657          
3658          
3659          /**
3660           * Get the maximum strlen for each data column
3661           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
3662           *  @param {int} iCol column of interest
3663           *  @returns {string} max strlens for each column
3664           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3665           */
3666  		function _fnGetMaxLenString( oSettings, iCol )
3667          {
3668              var iMax = -1;
3669              var iMaxIndex = -1;
3670              
3671              for ( var i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoData.length ; i++ )
3672              {
3673                  var s = _fnGetCellData( oSettings, i, iCol, 'display' )+"";
3674                  s = s.replace( /<.*?>/g, "" );
3675                  if ( s.length > iMax )
3676                  {
3677                      iMax = s.length;
3678                      iMaxIndex = i;
3679                  }
3680              }
3681              
3682              return iMaxIndex;
3683          }
3684          
3685          
3686          /**
3687           * Append a CSS unit (only if required) to a string
3688           *  @param {array} aArray1 first array
3689           *  @param {array} aArray2 second array
3690           *  @returns {int} 0 if match, 1 if length is different, 2 if no match
3691           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3692           */
3693  		function _fnStringToCss( s )
3694          {
3695              if ( s === null )
3696              {
3697                  return "0px";
3698              }
3699              
3700              if ( typeof s == 'number' )
3701              {
3702                  if ( s < 0 )
3703                  {
3704                      return "0px";
3705                  }
3706                  return s+"px";
3707              }
3708              
3709              /* Check if the last character is not 0-9 */
3710              var c = s.charCodeAt( s.length-1 );
3711              if (c < 0x30 || c > 0x39)
3712              {
3713                  return s;
3714              }
3715              return s+"px";
3716          }
3717          
3718          
3719          /**
3720           * Get the width of a scroll bar in this browser being used
3721           *  @returns {int} width in pixels
3722           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3723           */
3724  		function _fnScrollBarWidth ()
3725          {  
3726              var inner = document.createElement('p');
3727              var style = inner.style;
3728              style.width = "100%";
3729              style.height = "200px";
3730              style.padding = "0px";
3731              
3732              var outer = document.createElement('div');
3733              style = outer.style;
3734              style.position = "absolute";
3735              style.top = "0px";
3736              style.left = "0px";
3737              style.visibility = "hidden";
3738              style.width = "200px";
3739              style.height = "150px";
3740              style.padding = "0px";
3741              style.overflow = "hidden";
3742              outer.appendChild(inner);
3743              
3744              document.body.appendChild(outer);
3745              var w1 = inner.offsetWidth;
3746              outer.style.overflow = 'scroll';
3747              var w2 = inner.offsetWidth;
3748              if ( w1 == w2 )
3749              {
3750                  w2 = outer.clientWidth;
3751              }
3752              
3753              document.body.removeChild(outer);
3754              return (w1 - w2);  
3755          }
3756          
3757          
3758          
3759          /**
3760           * Change the order of the table
3761           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
3762           *  @param {bool} bApplyClasses optional - should we apply classes or not
3763           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3764           */
3765  		function _fnSort ( oSettings, bApplyClasses )
3766          {
3767              var
3768                  i, iLen, j, jLen, k, kLen,
3769                  sDataType, nTh,
3770                  aaSort = [],
3771                   aiOrig = [],
3772                  oSort = DataTable.ext.oSort,
3773                  aoData = oSettings.aoData,
3774                  aoColumns = oSettings.aoColumns,
3775                  oAria = oSettings.oLanguage.oAria;
3776              
3777              /* No sorting required if server-side or no sorting array */
3778              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide && 
3779                  (oSettings.aaSorting.length !== 0 || oSettings.aaSortingFixed !== null) )
3780              {
3781                  if ( oSettings.aaSortingFixed !== null )
3782                  {
3783                      aaSort = oSettings.aaSortingFixed.concat( oSettings.aaSorting );
3784                  }
3785                  else
3786                  {
3787                      aaSort = oSettings.aaSorting.slice();
3788                  }
3789                  
3790                  /* If there is a sorting data type, and a fuction belonging to it, then we need to
3791                   * get the data from the developer's function and apply it for this column
3792                   */
3793                  for ( i=0 ; i<aaSort.length ; i++ )
3794                  {
3795                      var iColumn = aaSort[i][0];
3796                      var iVisColumn = _fnColumnIndexToVisible( oSettings, iColumn );
3797                      sDataType = oSettings.aoColumns[ iColumn ].sSortDataType;
3798                      if ( DataTable.ext.afnSortData[sDataType] )
3799                      {
3800                          var aData = DataTable.ext.afnSortData[sDataType]( oSettings, iColumn, iVisColumn );
3801                          for ( j=0, jLen=aoData.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
3802                          {
3803                              _fnSetCellData( oSettings, j, iColumn, aData[j] );
3804                          }
3805                      }
3806                  }
3807                  
3808                  /* Create a value - key array of the current row positions such that we can use their
3809                   * current position during the sort, if values match, in order to perform stable sorting
3810                   */
3811                  for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
3812                  {
3813                      aiOrig[ oSettings.aiDisplayMaster[i] ] = i;
3814                  }
3815          
3816                  /* Build an internal data array which is specific to the sort, so we can get and prep
3817                   * the data to be sorted only once, rather than needing to do it every time the sorting
3818                   * function runs. This make the sorting function a very simple comparison
3819                   */
3820                  var iSortLen = aaSort.length;
3821                  var fnSortFormat, aDataSort;
3822                  for ( i=0, iLen=aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
3823                  {
3824                      for ( j=0 ; j<iSortLen ; j++ )
3825                      {
3826                          aDataSort = aoColumns[ aaSort[j][0] ].aDataSort;
3827          
3828                          for ( k=0, kLen=aDataSort.length ; k<kLen ; k++ )
3829                          {
3830                              sDataType = aoColumns[ aDataSort[k] ].sType;
3831                              fnSortFormat = oSort[ (sDataType ? sDataType : 'string')+"-pre" ];
3832                              
3833                              aoData[i]._aSortData[ aDataSort[k] ] = fnSortFormat ?
3834                                  fnSortFormat( _fnGetCellData( oSettings, i, aDataSort[k], 'sort' ) ) :
3835                                  _fnGetCellData( oSettings, i, aDataSort[k], 'sort' );
3836                          }
3837                      }
3838                  }
3839                  
3840                  /* Do the sort - here we want multi-column sorting based on a given data source (column)
3841                   * and sorting function (from oSort) in a certain direction. It's reasonably complex to
3842                   * follow on it's own, but this is what we want (example two column sorting):
3843                   *  fnLocalSorting = function(a,b){
3844                   *      var iTest;
3845                   *      iTest = oSort['string-asc']('data11', 'data12');
3846                   *      if (iTest !== 0)
3847                   *          return iTest;
3848                   *    iTest = oSort['numeric-desc']('data21', 'data22');
3849                   *    if (iTest !== 0)
3850                   *          return iTest;
3851                   *      return oSort['numeric-asc']( aiOrig[a], aiOrig[b] );
3852                   *  }
3853                   * Basically we have a test for each sorting column, if the data in that column is equal,
3854                   * test the next column. If all columns match, then we use a numeric sort on the row 
3855                   * positions in the original data array to provide a stable sort.
3856                   */
3857                  oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.sort( function ( a, b ) {
3858                      var k, l, lLen, iTest, aDataSort, sDataType;
3859                      for ( k=0 ; k<iSortLen ; k++ )
3860                      {
3861                          aDataSort = aoColumns[ aaSort[k][0] ].aDataSort;
3862          
3863                          for ( l=0, lLen=aDataSort.length ; l<lLen ; l++ )
3864                          {
3865                              sDataType = aoColumns[ aDataSort[l] ].sType;
3866                              
3867                              iTest = oSort[ (sDataType ? sDataType : 'string')+"-"+aaSort[k][1] ](
3868                                  aoData[a]._aSortData[ aDataSort[l] ],
3869                                  aoData[b]._aSortData[ aDataSort[l] ]
3870                              );
3871                          
3872                              if ( iTest !== 0 )
3873                              {
3874                                  return iTest;
3875                              }
3876                          }
3877                      }
3878                      
3879                      return oSort['numeric-asc']( aiOrig[a], aiOrig[b] );
3880                  } );
3881              }
3882              
3883              /* Alter the sorting classes to take account of the changes */
3884              if ( (bApplyClasses === undefined || bApplyClasses) && !oSettings.oFeatures.bDeferRender )
3885              {
3886                  _fnSortingClasses( oSettings );
3887              }
3888          
3889              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
3890              {
3891                  nTh = aoColumns[i].nTh;
3892                  nTh.removeAttribute('aria-sort');
3893                  nTh.removeAttribute('aria-label');
3894                  
3895                  /* In ARIA only the first sorting column can be marked as sorting - no multi-sort option */
3896                  if ( aoColumns[i].bSortable )
3897                  {
3898                      if ( aaSort.length > 0 && aaSort[0][0] == i )
3899                      {
3900                          nTh.setAttribute('aria-sort', aaSort[0][1]=="asc" ? "ascending" : "descending" );
3901                          
3902                          var nextSort = (aoColumns[i].asSorting[ aaSort[0][2]+1 ]) ? 
3903                              aoColumns[i].asSorting[ aaSort[0][2]+1 ] : aoColumns[i].asSorting[0];
3904                          nTh.setAttribute('aria-label', aoColumns[i].sTitle+
3905                              (nextSort=="asc" ? oAria.sSortAscending : oAria.sSortDescending) );
3906                      }
3907                      else
3908                      {
3909                          nTh.setAttribute('aria-label', aoColumns[i].sTitle+
3910                              (aoColumns[i].asSorting[0]=="asc" ? oAria.sSortAscending : oAria.sSortDescending) );
3911                      }
3912                  }
3913                  else
3914                  {
3915                      nTh.setAttribute('aria-label', aoColumns[i].sTitle);
3916                  }
3917              }
3918              
3919              /* Tell the draw function that we have sorted the data */
3920              oSettings.bSorted = true;
3921              $(oSettings.oInstance).trigger('sort', oSettings);
3922              
3923              /* Copy the master data into the draw array and re-draw */
3924              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bFilter )
3925              {
3926                  /* _fnFilter() will redraw the table for us */
3927                  _fnFilterComplete( oSettings, oSettings.oPreviousSearch, 1 );
3928              }
3929              else
3930              {
3931                  oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
3932                  oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0; /* reset display back to page 0 */
3933                  _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
3934                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
3935              }
3936          }
3937          
3938          
3939          /**
3940           * Attach a sort handler (click) to a node
3941           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
3942           *  @param {node} nNode node to attach the handler to
3943           *  @param {int} iDataIndex column sorting index
3944           *  @param {function} [fnCallback] callback function
3945           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
3946           */
3947  		function _fnSortAttachListener ( oSettings, nNode, iDataIndex, fnCallback )
3948          {
3949              _fnBindAction( nNode, {}, function (e) {
3950                  /* If the column is not sortable - don't to anything */
3951                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[iDataIndex].bSortable === false )
3952                  {
3953                      return;
3954                  }
3955                  
3956                  /*
3957                   * This is a little bit odd I admit... I declare a temporary function inside the scope of
3958                   * _fnBuildHead and the click handler in order that the code presented here can be used 
3959                   * twice - once for when bProcessing is enabled, and another time for when it is 
3960                   * disabled, as we need to perform slightly different actions.
3961                   *   Basically the issue here is that the Javascript engine in modern browsers don't 
3962                   * appear to allow the rendering engine to update the display while it is still excuting
3963                   * it's thread (well - it does but only after long intervals). This means that the 
3964                   * 'processing' display doesn't appear for a table sort. To break the js thread up a bit
3965                   * I force an execution break by using setTimeout - but this breaks the expected 
3966                   * thread continuation for the end-developer's point of view (their code would execute
3967                   * too early), so we on;y do it when we absolutely have to.
3968                   */
3969                  var fnInnerSorting = function () {
3970                      var iColumn, iNextSort;
3971                      
3972                      /* If the shift key is pressed then we are multipe column sorting */
3973                      if ( e.shiftKey )
3974                      {
3975                          /* Are we already doing some kind of sort on this column? */
3976                          var bFound = false;
3977                          for ( var i=0 ; i<oSettings.aaSorting.length ; i++ )
3978                          {
3979                              if ( oSettings.aaSorting[i][0] == iDataIndex )
3980                              {
3981                                  bFound = true;
3982                                  iColumn = oSettings.aaSorting[i][0];
3983                                  iNextSort = oSettings.aaSorting[i][2]+1;
3984                                  
3985                                  if ( !oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn].asSorting[iNextSort] )
3986                                  {
3987                                      /* Reached the end of the sorting options, remove from multi-col sort */
3988                                      oSettings.aaSorting.splice( i, 1 );
3989                                  }
3990                                  else
3991                                  {
3992                                      /* Move onto next sorting direction */
3993                                      oSettings.aaSorting[i][1] = oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn].asSorting[iNextSort];
3994                                      oSettings.aaSorting[i][2] = iNextSort;
3995                                  }
3996                                  break;
3997                              }
3998                          }
3999                          
4000                          /* No sort yet - add it in */
4001                          if ( bFound === false )
4002                          {
4003                              oSettings.aaSorting.push( [ iDataIndex, 
4004                                  oSettings.aoColumns[iDataIndex].asSorting[0], 0 ] );
4005                          }
4006                      }
4007                      else
4008                      {
4009                          /* If no shift key then single column sort */
4010                          if ( oSettings.aaSorting.length == 1 && oSettings.aaSorting[0][0] == iDataIndex )
4011                          {
4012                              iColumn = oSettings.aaSorting[0][0];
4013                              iNextSort = oSettings.aaSorting[0][2]+1;
4014                              if ( !oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn].asSorting[iNextSort] )
4015                              {
4016                                  iNextSort = 0;
4017                              }
4018                              oSettings.aaSorting[0][1] = oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn].asSorting[iNextSort];
4019                              oSettings.aaSorting[0][2] = iNextSort;
4020                          }
4021                          else
4022                          {
4023                              oSettings.aaSorting.splice( 0, oSettings.aaSorting.length );
4024                              oSettings.aaSorting.push( [ iDataIndex, 
4025                                  oSettings.aoColumns[iDataIndex].asSorting[0], 0 ] );
4026                          }
4027                      }
4028                      
4029                      /* Run the sort */
4030                      _fnSort( oSettings );
4031                  }; /* /fnInnerSorting */
4032                  
4033                  if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bProcessing )
4034                  {
4035                      fnInnerSorting();
4036                  }
4037                  else
4038                  {
4039                      _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, true );
4040                      setTimeout( function() {
4041                          fnInnerSorting();
4042                          if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide )
4043                          {
4044                              _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, false );
4045                          }
4046                      }, 0 );
4047                  }
4048                  
4049                  /* Call the user specified callback function - used for async user interaction */
4050                  if ( typeof fnCallback == 'function' )
4051                  {
4052                      fnCallback( oSettings );
4053                  }
4054              } );
4055          }
4056          
4057          
4058          /**
4059           * Set the sorting classes on the header, Note: it is safe to call this function 
4060           * when bSort and bSortClasses are false
4061           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4062           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4063           */
4064  		function _fnSortingClasses( oSettings )
4065          {
4066              var i, iLen, j, jLen, iFound;
4067              var aaSort, sClass;
4068              var iColumns = oSettings.aoColumns.length;
4069              var oClasses = oSettings.oClasses;
4070              
4071              for ( i=0 ; i<iColumns ; i++ )
4072              {
4073                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bSortable )
4074                  {
4075                      $(oSettings.aoColumns[i].nTh).removeClass( oClasses.sSortAsc +" "+ oClasses.sSortDesc +
4076                          " "+ oSettings.aoColumns[i].sSortingClass );
4077                  }
4078              }
4079              
4080              if ( oSettings.aaSortingFixed !== null )
4081              {
4082                  aaSort = oSettings.aaSortingFixed.concat( oSettings.aaSorting );
4083              }
4084              else
4085              {
4086                  aaSort = oSettings.aaSorting.slice();
4087              }
4088              
4089              /* Apply the required classes to the header */
4090              for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i++ )
4091              {
4092                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bSortable )
4093                  {
4094                      sClass = oSettings.aoColumns[i].sSortingClass;
4095                      iFound = -1;
4096                      for ( j=0 ; j<aaSort.length ; j++ )
4097                      {
4098                          if ( aaSort[j][0] == i )
4099                          {
4100                              sClass = ( aaSort[j][1] == "asc" ) ?
4101                                  oClasses.sSortAsc : oClasses.sSortDesc;
4102                              iFound = j;
4103                              break;
4104                          }
4105                      }
4106                      $(oSettings.aoColumns[i].nTh).addClass( sClass );
4107                      
4108                      if ( oSettings.bJUI )
4109                      {
4110                          /* jQuery UI uses extra markup */
4111                          var jqSpan = $("span."+oClasses.sSortIcon,  oSettings.aoColumns[i].nTh);
4112                          jqSpan.removeClass(oClasses.sSortJUIAsc +" "+ oClasses.sSortJUIDesc +" "+ 
4113                              oClasses.sSortJUI +" "+ oClasses.sSortJUIAscAllowed +" "+ oClasses.sSortJUIDescAllowed );
4114                          
4115                          var sSpanClass;
4116                          if ( iFound == -1 )
4117                          {
4118                               sSpanClass = oSettings.aoColumns[i].sSortingClassJUI;
4119                          }
4120                          else if ( aaSort[iFound][1] == "asc" )
4121                          {
4122                              sSpanClass = oClasses.sSortJUIAsc;
4123                          }
4124                          else
4125                          {
4126                              sSpanClass = oClasses.sSortJUIDesc;
4127                          }
4128                          
4129                          jqSpan.addClass( sSpanClass );
4130                      }
4131                  }
4132                  else
4133                  {
4134                      /* No sorting on this column, so add the base class. This will have been assigned by
4135                       * _fnAddColumn
4136                       */
4137                      $(oSettings.aoColumns[i].nTh).addClass( oSettings.aoColumns[i].sSortingClass );
4138                  }
4139              }
4140              
4141              /* 
4142               * Apply the required classes to the table body
4143               * Note that this is given as a feature switch since it can significantly slow down a sort
4144               * on large data sets (adding and removing of classes is always slow at the best of times..)
4145               * Further to this, note that this code is admitadly fairly ugly. It could be made a lot 
4146               * simpiler using jQuery selectors and add/removeClass, but that is significantly slower
4147               * (on the order of 5 times slower) - hence the direct DOM manipulation here.
4148               * Note that for defered drawing we do use jQuery - the reason being that taking the first
4149               * row found to see if the whole column needs processed can miss classes since the first
4150               * column might be new.
4151               */
4152              sClass = oClasses.sSortColumn;
4153              
4154              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bSort && oSettings.oFeatures.bSortClasses )
4155              {
4156                  var nTds = _fnGetTdNodes( oSettings );
4157          
4158                  /* Remove the old classes */
4159                  if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bDeferRender )
4160                  {
4161                      $(nTds).removeClass(sClass+'1 '+sClass+'2 '+sClass+'3');
4162                  }
4163                  else if ( nTds.length >= iColumns )
4164                  {
4165                      for ( i=0 ; i<iColumns ; i++ )
4166                      {
4167                          if ( nTds[i].className.indexOf(sClass+"1") != -1 )
4168                          {
4169                              for ( j=0, jLen=(nTds.length/iColumns) ; j<jLen ; j++ )
4170                              {
4171                                  nTds[(iColumns*j)+i].className = 
4172                                      $.trim( nTds[(iColumns*j)+i].className.replace( sClass+"1", "" ) );
4173                              }
4174                          }
4175                          else if ( nTds[i].className.indexOf(sClass+"2") != -1 )
4176                          {
4177                              for ( j=0, jLen=(nTds.length/iColumns) ; j<jLen ; j++ )
4178                              {
4179                                  nTds[(iColumns*j)+i].className = 
4180                                      $.trim( nTds[(iColumns*j)+i].className.replace( sClass+"2", "" ) );
4181                              }
4182                          }
4183                          else if ( nTds[i].className.indexOf(sClass+"3") != -1 )
4184                          {
4185                              for ( j=0, jLen=(nTds.length/iColumns) ; j<jLen ; j++ )
4186                              {
4187                                  nTds[(iColumns*j)+i].className = 
4188                                      $.trim( nTds[(iColumns*j)+i].className.replace( " "+sClass+"3", "" ) );
4189                              }
4190                          }
4191                      }
4192                  }
4193                  
4194                  /* Add the new classes to the table */
4195                  var iClass = 1, iTargetCol;
4196                  for ( i=0 ; i<aaSort.length ; i++ )
4197                  {
4198                      iTargetCol = parseInt( aaSort[i][0], 10 );
4199                      for ( j=0, jLen=(nTds.length/iColumns) ; j<jLen ; j++ )
4200                      {
4201                          nTds[(iColumns*j)+iTargetCol].className += " "+sClass+iClass;
4202                      }
4203                      
4204                      if ( iClass < 3 )
4205                      {
4206                          iClass++;
4207                      }
4208                  }
4209              }
4210          }
4211          
4212          
4213          
4214          /**
4215           * Save the state of a table in a cookie such that the page can be reloaded
4216           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4217           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4218           */
4219  		function _fnSaveState ( oSettings )
4220          {
4221              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bStateSave || oSettings.bDestroying )
4222              {
4223                  return;
4224              }
4225          
4226              /* Store the interesting variables */
4227              var i, iLen, bInfinite=oSettings.oScroll.bInfinite;
4228              var oState = {
4229                  "iCreate":      new Date().getTime(),
4230                  "iStart":       (bInfinite ? 0 : oSettings._iDisplayStart),
4231                  "iEnd":         (bInfinite ? oSettings._iDisplayLength : oSettings._iDisplayEnd),
4232                  "iLength":      oSettings._iDisplayLength,
4233                  "aaSorting":    $.extend( true, [], oSettings.aaSorting ),
4234                  "oSearch":      $.extend( true, {}, oSettings.oPreviousSearch ),
4235                  "aoSearchCols": $.extend( true, [], oSettings.aoPreSearchCols ),
4236                  "abVisCols":    []
4237              };
4238          
4239              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4240              {
4241                  oState.abVisCols.push( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bVisible );
4242              }
4243          
4244              _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, "aoStateSaveParams", 'stateSaveParams', [oSettings, oState] );
4245              
4246              oSettings.fnStateSave.call( oSettings.oInstance, oSettings, oState );
4247          }
4248          
4249          
4250          /**
4251           * Attempt to load a saved table state from a cookie
4252           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4253           *  @param {object} oInit DataTables init object so we can override settings
4254           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4255           */
4256  		function _fnLoadState ( oSettings, oInit )
4257          {
4258              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bStateSave )
4259              {
4260                  return;
4261              }
4262          
4263              var oData = oSettings.fnStateLoad.call( oSettings.oInstance, oSettings );
4264              if ( !oData )
4265              {
4266                  return;
4267              }
4268              
4269              /* Allow custom and plug-in manipulation functions to alter the saved data set and
4270               * cancelling of loading by returning false
4271               */
4272              var abStateLoad = _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoStateLoadParams', 'stateLoadParams', [oSettings, oData] );
4273              if ( $.inArray( false, abStateLoad ) !== -1 )
4274              {
4275                  return;
4276              }
4277              
4278              /* Store the saved state so it might be accessed at any time */
4279              oSettings.oLoadedState = $.extend( true, {}, oData );
4280              
4281              /* Restore key features */
4282              oSettings._iDisplayStart    = oData.iStart;
4283              oSettings.iInitDisplayStart = oData.iStart;
4284              oSettings._iDisplayEnd      = oData.iEnd;
4285              oSettings._iDisplayLength   = oData.iLength;
4286              oSettings.aaSorting         = oData.aaSorting.slice();
4287              oSettings.saved_aaSorting   = oData.aaSorting.slice();
4288              
4289              /* Search filtering  */
4290              $.extend( oSettings.oPreviousSearch, oData.oSearch );
4291              $.extend( true, oSettings.aoPreSearchCols, oData.aoSearchCols );
4292              
4293              /* Column visibility state
4294               * Pass back visibiliy settings to the init handler, but to do not here override
4295               * the init object that the user might have passed in
4296               */
4297              oInit.saved_aoColumns = [];
4298              for ( var i=0 ; i<oData.abVisCols.length ; i++ )
4299              {
4300                  oInit.saved_aoColumns[i] = {};
4301                  oInit.saved_aoColumns[i].bVisible = oData.abVisCols[i];
4302              }
4303          
4304              _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoStateLoaded', 'stateLoaded', [oSettings, oData] );
4305          }
4306          
4307          
4308          /**
4309           * Create a new cookie with a value to store the state of a table
4310           *  @param {string} sName name of the cookie to create
4311           *  @param {string} sValue the value the cookie should take
4312           *  @param {int} iSecs duration of the cookie
4313           *  @param {string} sBaseName sName is made up of the base + file name - this is the base
4314           *  @param {function} fnCallback User definable function to modify the cookie
4315           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4316           */
4317  		function _fnCreateCookie ( sName, sValue, iSecs, sBaseName, fnCallback )
4318          {
4319              var date = new Date();
4320              date.setTime( date.getTime()+(iSecs*1000) );
4321              
4322              /* 
4323               * Shocking but true - it would appear IE has major issues with having the path not having
4324               * a trailing slash on it. We need the cookie to be available based on the path, so we
4325               * have to append the file name to the cookie name. Appalling. Thanks to vex for adding the
4326               * patch to use at least some of the path
4327               */
4328              var aParts = window.location.pathname.split('/');
4329              var sNameFile = sName + '_' + aParts.pop().replace(/[\/:]/g,"").toLowerCase();
4330              var sFullCookie, oData;
4331              
4332              if ( fnCallback !== null )
4333              {
4334                  oData = (typeof $.parseJSON === 'function') ? 
4335                      $.parseJSON( sValue ) : eval( '('+sValue+')' );
4336                  sFullCookie = fnCallback( sNameFile, oData, date.toGMTString(),
4337                      aParts.join('/')+"/" );
4338              }
4339              else
4340              {
4341                  sFullCookie = sNameFile + "=" + encodeURIComponent(sValue) +
4342                      "; expires=" + date.toGMTString() +"; path=" + aParts.join('/')+"/";
4343              }
4344              
4345              /* Are we going to go over the cookie limit of 4KiB? If so, try to delete a cookies
4346               * belonging to DataTables. This is FAR from bullet proof
4347               */
4348              var sOldName="", iOldTime=9999999999999;
4349              var iLength = _fnReadCookie( sNameFile )!==null ? document.cookie.length : 
4350                  sFullCookie.length + document.cookie.length;
4351              
4352              if ( iLength+10 > 4096 ) /* Magic 10 for padding */
4353              {
4354                  var aCookies =document.cookie.split(';');
4355                  for ( var i=0, iLen=aCookies.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4356                  {
4357                      if ( aCookies[i].indexOf( sBaseName ) != -1 )
4358                      {
4359                          /* It's a DataTables cookie, so eval it and check the time stamp */
4360                          var aSplitCookie = aCookies[i].split('=');
4361                          try { oData = eval( '('+decodeURIComponent(aSplitCookie[1])+')' ); }
4362                          catch( e ) { continue; }
4363                          
4364                          if ( oData.iCreate && oData.iCreate < iOldTime )
4365                          {
4366                              sOldName = aSplitCookie[0];
4367                              iOldTime = oData.iCreate;
4368                          }
4369                      }
4370                  }
4371                  
4372                  if ( sOldName !== "" )
4373                  {
4374                      document.cookie = sOldName+"=; expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path="+
4375                          aParts.join('/') + "/";
4376                  }
4377              }
4378              
4379              document.cookie = sFullCookie;
4380          }
4381          
4382          
4383          /**
4384           * Read an old cookie to get a cookie with an old table state
4385           *  @param {string} sName name of the cookie to read
4386           *  @returns {string} contents of the cookie - or null if no cookie with that name found
4387           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4388           */
4389  		function _fnReadCookie ( sName )
4390          {
4391              var
4392                  aParts = window.location.pathname.split('/'),
4393                  sNameEQ = sName + '_' + aParts[aParts.length-1].replace(/[\/:]/g,"").toLowerCase() + '=',
4394                   sCookieContents = document.cookie.split(';');
4395              
4396              for( var i=0 ; i<sCookieContents.length ; i++ )
4397              {
4398                  var c = sCookieContents[i];
4399                  
4400                  while (c.charAt(0)==' ')
4401                  {
4402                      c = c.substring(1,c.length);
4403                  }
4404                  
4405                  if (c.indexOf(sNameEQ) === 0)
4406                  {
4407                      return decodeURIComponent( c.substring(sNameEQ.length,c.length) );
4408                  }
4409              }
4410              return null;
4411          }
4412          
4413          
4414          
4415          /**
4416           * Return the settings object for a particular table
4417           *  @param {node} nTable table we are using as a dataTable
4418           *  @returns {object} Settings object - or null if not found
4419           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4420           */
4421  		function _fnSettingsFromNode ( nTable )
4422          {
4423              for ( var i=0 ; i<DataTable.settings.length ; i++ )
4424              {
4425                  if ( DataTable.settings[i].nTable === nTable )
4426                  {
4427                      return DataTable.settings[i];
4428                  }
4429              }
4430              
4431              return null;
4432          }
4433          
4434          
4435          /**
4436           * Return an array with the TR nodes for the table
4437           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4438           *  @returns {array} TR array
4439           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4440           */
4441  		function _fnGetTrNodes ( oSettings )
4442          {
4443              var aNodes = [];
4444              var aoData = oSettings.aoData;
4445              for ( var i=0, iLen=aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4446              {
4447                  if ( aoData[i].nTr !== null )
4448                  {
4449                      aNodes.push( aoData[i].nTr );
4450                  }
4451              }
4452              return aNodes;
4453          }
4454          
4455          
4456          /**
4457           * Return an flat array with all TD nodes for the table, or row
4458           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4459           *  @param {int} [iIndividualRow] aoData index to get the nodes for - optional 
4460           *    if not given then the return array will contain all nodes for the table
4461           *  @returns {array} TD array
4462           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4463           */
4464  		function _fnGetTdNodes ( oSettings, iIndividualRow )
4465          {
4466              var anReturn = [];
4467              var iCorrector;
4468              var anTds;
4469              var iRow, iRows=oSettings.aoData.length,
4470                  iColumn, iColumns, oData, sNodeName, iStart=0, iEnd=iRows;
4471              
4472              /* Allow the collection to be limited to just one row */
4473              if ( iIndividualRow !== undefined )
4474              {
4475                  iStart = iIndividualRow;
4476                  iEnd = iIndividualRow+1;
4477              }
4478          
4479              for ( iRow=iStart ; iRow<iEnd ; iRow++ )
4480              {
4481                  oData = oSettings.aoData[iRow];
4482                  if ( oData.nTr !== null )
4483                  {
4484                      /* get the TD child nodes - taking into account text etc nodes */
4485                      anTds = [];
4486                      for ( iColumn=0, iColumns=oData.nTr.childNodes.length ; iColumn<iColumns ; iColumn++ )
4487                      {
4488                          sNodeName = oData.nTr.childNodes[iColumn].nodeName.toLowerCase();
4489                          if ( sNodeName == 'td' || sNodeName == 'th' )
4490                          {
4491                              anTds.push( oData.nTr.childNodes[iColumn] );
4492                          }
4493                      }
4494          
4495                      iCorrector = 0;
4496                      for ( iColumn=0, iColumns=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; iColumn<iColumns ; iColumn++ )
4497                      {
4498                          if ( oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn].bVisible )
4499                          {
4500                              anReturn.push( anTds[iColumn-iCorrector] );
4501                          }
4502                          else
4503                          {
4504                              anReturn.push( oData._anHidden[iColumn] );
4505                              iCorrector++;
4506                          }
4507                      }
4508                  }
4509              }
4510          
4511              return anReturn;
4512          }
4513          
4514          
4515          /**
4516           * Log an error message
4517           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4518           *  @param {int} iLevel log error messages, or display them to the user
4519           *  @param {string} sMesg error message
4520           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4521           */
4522  		function _fnLog( oSettings, iLevel, sMesg )
4523          {
4524              var sAlert = (oSettings===null) ?
4525                  "DataTables warning: "+sMesg :
4526                  "DataTables warning (table id = '"+oSettings.sTableId+"'): "+sMesg;
4527              
4528              if ( iLevel === 0 )
4529              {
4530                  if ( DataTable.ext.sErrMode == 'alert' )
4531                  {
4532                      alert( sAlert );
4533                  }
4534                  else
4535                  {
4536                      throw sAlert;
4537                  }
4538                  return;
4539              }
4540              else if ( console !== undefined && console.log )
4541              {
4542                  console.log( sAlert );
4543              }
4544          }
4545          
4546          
4547          /**
4548           * See if a property is defined on one object, if so assign it to the other object
4549           *  @param {object} oRet target object
4550           *  @param {object} oSrc source object
4551           *  @param {string} sName property
4552           *  @param {string} [sMappedName] name to map too - optional, sName used if not given
4553           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4554           */
4555  		function _fnMap( oRet, oSrc, sName, sMappedName )
4556          {
4557              if ( sMappedName === undefined )
4558              {
4559                  sMappedName = sName;
4560              }
4561              if ( oSrc[sName] !== undefined )
4562              {
4563                  oRet[sMappedName] = oSrc[sName];
4564              }
4565          }
4566          
4567          
4568          /**
4569           * Extend objects - very similar to jQuery.extend, but deep copy objects, and shallow
4570           * copy arrays. The reason we need to do this, is that we don't want to deep copy array
4571           * init values (such as aaSorting) since the dev wouldn't be able to override them, but
4572           * we do want to deep copy arrays.
4573           *  @param {object} oOut Object to extend
4574           *  @param {object} oExtender Object from which the properties will be applied to oOut
4575           *  @returns {object} oOut Reference, just for convenience - oOut === the return.
4576           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4577           *  @todo This doesn't take account of arrays inside the deep copied objects.
4578           */
4579  		function _fnExtend( oOut, oExtender )
4580          {
4581              for ( var prop in oOut )
4582              {
4583                  if ( oOut.hasOwnProperty(prop) && oExtender[prop] !== undefined )
4584                  {
4585                      if ( typeof oInit[prop] === 'object' && $.isArray(oExtender[prop]) === false )
4586                      {
4587                          $.extend( true, oOut[prop], oExtender[prop] );
4588                      }
4589                      else
4590                      {
4591                          oOut[prop] = oExtender[prop];
4592                      }
4593                  }
4594              }
4595          
4596              return oOut;
4597          }
4598          
4599          
4600          /**
4601           * Bind an event handers to allow a click or return key to activate the callback.
4602           * This is good for accessability since a return on the keyboard will have the
4603           * same effect as a click, if the element has focus.
4604           *  @param {element} n Element to bind the action to
4605           *  @param {object} oData Data object to pass to the triggered function
4606           *  @param {function) fn Callback function for when the event is triggered
4607           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4608           */
4609  		function _fnBindAction( n, oData, fn )
4610          {
4611              $(n)
4612                  .bind( 'click.DT', oData, function (e) {
4613                          fn(e);
4614                          n.blur(); // Remove focus outline for mouse users
4615                      } )
4616                  .bind( 'keypress.DT', oData, function (e){
4617                      if ( e.which === 13 ) {
4618                          fn(e);
4619                      } } )
4620                  .bind( 'selectstart.DT', function () {
4621                      /* Take the brutal approach to cancelling text selection */
4622                      return false;
4623                      } );
4624          }
4625          
4626          
4627          /**
4628           * Register a callback function. Easily allows a callback function to be added to
4629           * an array store of callback functions that can then all be called together.
4630           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4631           *  @param {string} sStore Name of the array storeage for the callbacks in oSettings
4632           *  @param {function} fn Function to be called back
4633           *  @param {string) sName Identifying name for the callback (i.e. a label)
4634           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4635           */
4636  		function _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, sStore, fn, sName )
4637          {
4638              if ( fn )
4639              {
4640                  oSettings[sStore].push( {
4641                      "fn": fn,
4642                      "sName": sName
4643                  } );
4644              }
4645          }
4646          
4647          
4648          /**
4649           * Fire callback functions and trigger events. Note that the loop over the callback
4650           * array store is done backwards! Further note that you do not want to fire off triggers
4651           * in time sensitive applications (for example cell creation) as its slow.
4652           *  @param {object} oSettings dataTables settings object
4653           *  @param {string} sStore Name of the array storeage for the callbacks in oSettings
4654           *  @param {string} sTrigger Name of the jQuery custom event to trigger. If null no trigger
4655           *    is fired
4656           *  @param {array) aArgs Array of arguments to pass to the callback function / trigger
4657           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4658           */
4659  		function _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, sStore, sTrigger, aArgs )
4660          {
4661              var aoStore = oSettings[sStore];
4662              var aRet =[];
4663          
4664              for ( var i=aoStore.length-1 ; i>=0 ; i-- )
4665              {
4666                  aRet.push( aoStore[i].fn.apply( oSettings.oInstance, aArgs ) );
4667              }
4668          
4669              if ( sTrigger !== null )
4670              {
4671                  $(oSettings.oInstance).trigger(sTrigger, aArgs);
4672              }
4673          
4674              return aRet;
4675          }
4676          
4677          
4678          /**
4679           * JSON stringify. If JSON.stringify it provided by the browser, json2.js or any other
4680           * library, then we use that as it is fast, safe and accurate. If the function isn't 
4681           * available then we need to built it ourselves - the insperation for this function comes
4682           * from Craig Buckler ( http://www.sitepoint.com/javascript-json-serialization/ ). It is
4683           * not perfect and absolutely should not be used as a replacement to json2.js - but it does
4684           * do what we need, without requiring a dependency for DataTables.
4685           *  @param {object} o JSON object to be converted
4686           *  @returns {string} JSON string
4687           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
4688           */
4689          var _fnJsonString = (window.JSON) ? JSON.stringify : function( o )
4690          {
4691              /* Not an object or array */
4692              var sType = typeof o;
4693              if (sType !== "object" || o === null)
4694              {
4695                  // simple data type
4696                  if (sType === "string")
4697                  {
4698                      o = '"'+o+'"';
4699                  }
4700                  return o+"";
4701              }
4702          
4703              /* If object or array, need to recurse over it */
4704              var
4705                  sProp, mValue,
4706                  json = [],
4707                  bArr = $.isArray(o);
4708              
4709              for (sProp in o)
4710              {
4711                  mValue = o[sProp];
4712                  sType = typeof mValue;
4713          
4714                  if (sType === "string")
4715                  {
4716                      mValue = '"'+mValue+'"';
4717                  }
4718                  else if (sType === "object" && mValue !== null)
4719                  {
4720                      mValue = _fnJsonString(mValue);
4721                  }
4722          
4723                  json.push((bArr ? "" : '"'+sProp+'":') + mValue);
4724              }
4725          
4726              return (bArr ? "[" : "{") + json + (bArr ? "]" : "}");
4727          };
4728          
4729  
4730          
4731          
4732          /**
4733           * Perform a jQuery selector action on the table's TR elements (from the tbody) and
4734           * return the resulting jQuery object.
4735           *  @param {string|node|jQuery} sSelector jQuery selector or node collection to act on
4736           *  @param {object} [oOpts] Optional parameters for modifying the rows to be included
4737           *  @param {string} [oOpts.filter=none] Select TR elements that meet the current filter
4738           *    criterion ("applied") or all TR elements (i.e. no filter).
4739           *  @param {string} [oOpts.order=current] Order of the TR elements in the processed array.
4740           *    Can be either 'current', whereby the current sorting of the table is used, or
4741           *    'original' whereby the original order the data was read into the table is used.
4742           *  @param {string} [oOpts.page=all] Limit the selection to the currently displayed page
4743           *    ("current") or not ("all"). If 'current' is given, then order is assumed to be 
4744           *    'current' and filter is 'applied', regardless of what they might be given as.
4745           *  @returns {object} jQuery object, filtered by the given selector.
4746           *  @dtopt API
4747           *
4748           *  @example
4749           *    $(document).ready(function() {
4750           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
4751           *
4752           *      // Highlight every second row
4753           *      oTable.$('tr:odd').css('backgroundColor', 'blue');
4754           *    } );
4755           *
4756           *  @example
4757           *    $(document).ready(function() {
4758           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
4759           *
4760           *      // Filter to rows with 'Webkit' in them, add a background colour and then
4761           *      // remove the filter, thus highlighting the 'Webkit' rows only.
4762           *      oTable.fnFilter('Webkit');
4763           *      oTable.$('tr', {"filter": "applied"}).css('backgroundColor', 'blue');
4764           *      oTable.fnFilter('');
4765           *    } );
4766           */
4767          this.$ = function ( sSelector, oOpts )
4768          {
4769              var i, iLen, a = [];
4770              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
4771          
4772              if ( !oOpts )
4773              {
4774                  oOpts = {};
4775              }
4776          
4777              oOpts = $.extend( {}, {
4778                  "filter": "none", // applied
4779                  "order": "current", // "original"
4780                  "page": "all" // current
4781              }, oOpts );
4782          
4783              // Current page implies that order=current and fitler=applied, since it is fairly
4784              // senseless otherwise
4785              if ( oOpts.page == 'current' )
4786              {
4787                  for ( i=oSettings._iDisplayStart, iLen=oSettings.fnDisplayEnd() ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4788                  {
4789                      a.push( oSettings.aoData[ oSettings.aiDisplay[i] ].nTr );
4790                  }
4791              }
4792              else if ( oOpts.order == "current" && oOpts.filter == "none" )
4793              {
4794                  for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4795                  {
4796                      a.push( oSettings.aoData[ oSettings.aiDisplayMaster[i] ].nTr );
4797                  }
4798              }
4799              else if ( oOpts.order == "current" && oOpts.filter == "applied" )
4800              {
4801                  for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aiDisplay.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4802                  {
4803                      a.push( oSettings.aoData[ oSettings.aiDisplay[i] ].nTr );
4804                  }
4805              }
4806              else if ( oOpts.order == "original" && oOpts.filter == "none" )
4807              {
4808                  for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4809                  {
4810                      a.push( oSettings.aoData[ i ].nTr );
4811                  }
4812              }
4813              else if ( oOpts.order == "original" && oOpts.filter == "applied" )
4814              {
4815                  for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4816                  {
4817                      if ( $.inArray( i, oSettings.aiDisplay ) !== -1 )
4818                      {
4819                          a.push( oSettings.aoData[ i ].nTr );
4820                      }
4821                  }
4822              }
4823              else
4824              {
4825                  _fnLog( oSettings, 1, "Unknown selection options" );
4826              }
4827          
4828              /* We need to filter on the TR elements and also 'find' in their descendants
4829               * to make the selector act like it would in a full table - so we need
4830               * to build both results and then combine them together
4831               */
4832              var jqA = $(a);
4833              var jqTRs = jqA.filter( sSelector );
4834              var jqDescendants = jqA.find( sSelector );
4835          
4836              return $( [].concat($.makeArray(jqTRs), $.makeArray(jqDescendants)) );
4837          };
4838          
4839          
4840          /**
4841           * Almost identical to $ in operation, but in this case returns the data for the matched
4842           * rows - as such, the jQuery selector used should match TR row nodes or TD/TH cell nodes
4843           * rather than any decendents, so the data can be obtained for the row/cell. If matching
4844           * rows are found, the data returned is the original data array/object that was used to  
4845           * create the row (or a generated array if from a DOM source).
4846           *
4847           * This method is often useful incombination with $ where both functions are given the
4848           * same parameters and the array indexes will match identically.
4849           *  @param {string|node|jQuery} sSelector jQuery selector or node collection to act on
4850           *  @param {object} [oOpts] Optional parameters for modifying the rows to be included
4851           *  @param {string} [oOpts.filter=none] Select elements that meet the current filter
4852           *    criterion ("applied") or all elements (i.e. no filter).
4853           *  @param {string} [oOpts.order=current] Order of the data in the processed array.
4854           *    Can be either 'current', whereby the current sorting of the table is used, or
4855           *    'original' whereby the original order the data was read into the table is used.
4856           *  @param {string} [oOpts.page=all] Limit the selection to the currently displayed page
4857           *    ("current") or not ("all"). If 'current' is given, then order is assumed to be 
4858           *    'current' and filter is 'applied', regardless of what they might be given as.
4859           *  @returns {array} Data for the matched elements. If any elements, as a result of the
4860           *    selector, were not TR, TD or TH elements in the DataTable, they will have a null 
4861           *    entry in the array.
4862           *  @dtopt API
4863           *
4864           *  @example
4865           *    $(document).ready(function() {
4866           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
4867           *
4868           *      // Get the data from the first row in the table
4869           *      var data = oTable._('tr:first');
4870           *
4871           *      // Do something useful with the data
4872           *      alert( "First cell is: "+data[0] );
4873           *    } );
4874           *
4875           *  @example
4876           *    $(document).ready(function() {
4877           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
4878           *
4879           *      // Filter to 'Webkit' and get all data for 
4880           *      oTable.fnFilter('Webkit');
4881           *      var data = oTable._('tr', {"filter": "applied"});
4882           *      
4883           *      // Do something with the data
4884           *      alert( data.length+" rows matched the filter" );
4885           *    } );
4886           */
4887          this._ = function ( sSelector, oOpts )
4888          {
4889              var aOut = [];
4890              var i, iLen, iIndex;
4891              var aTrs = this.$( sSelector, oOpts );
4892          
4893              for ( i=0, iLen=aTrs.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4894              {
4895                  aOut.push( this.fnGetData(aTrs[i]) );
4896              }
4897          
4898              return aOut;
4899          };
4900          
4901          
4902          /**
4903           * Add a single new row or multiple rows of data to the table. Please note
4904           * that this is suitable for client-side processing only - if you are using 
4905           * server-side processing (i.e. "bServerSide": true), then to add data, you
4906           * must add it to the data source, i.e. the server-side, through an Ajax call.
4907           *  @param {array|object} mData The data to be added to the table. This can be:
4908           *    <ul>
4909           *      <li>1D array of data - add a single row with the data provided</li>
4910           *      <li>2D array of arrays - add multiple rows in a single call</li>
4911           *      <li>object - data object when using <i>mDataProp</i></li>
4912           *      <li>array of objects - multiple data objects when using <i>mDataProp</i></li>
4913           *    </ul>
4914           *  @param {bool} [bRedraw=true] redraw the table or not
4915           *  @returns {array} An array of integers, representing the list of indexes in 
4916           *    <i>aoData</i> ({@link DataTable.models.oSettings}) that have been added to 
4917           *    the table.
4918           *  @dtopt API
4919           *
4920           *  @example
4921           *    // Global var for counter
4922           *    var giCount = 2;
4923           *    
4924           *    $(document).ready(function() {
4925           *      $('#example').dataTable();
4926           *    } );
4927           *    
4928           *    function fnClickAddRow() {
4929           *      $('#example').dataTable().fnAddData( [
4930           *        giCount+".1",
4931           *        giCount+".2",
4932           *        giCount+".3",
4933           *        giCount+".4" ]
4934           *      );
4935           *        
4936           *      giCount++;
4937           *    }
4938           */
4939          this.fnAddData = function( mData, bRedraw )
4940          {
4941              if ( mData.length === 0 )
4942              {
4943                  return [];
4944              }
4945              
4946              var aiReturn = [];
4947              var iTest;
4948              
4949              /* Find settings from table node */
4950              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
4951              
4952              /* Check if we want to add multiple rows or not */
4953              if ( typeof mData[0] === "object" && mData[0] !== null )
4954              {
4955                  for ( var i=0 ; i<mData.length ; i++ )
4956                  {
4957                      iTest = _fnAddData( oSettings, mData[i] );
4958                      if ( iTest == -1 )
4959                      {
4960                          return aiReturn;
4961                      }
4962                      aiReturn.push( iTest );
4963                  }
4964              }
4965              else
4966              {
4967                  iTest = _fnAddData( oSettings, mData );
4968                  if ( iTest == -1 )
4969                  {
4970                      return aiReturn;
4971                  }
4972                  aiReturn.push( iTest );
4973              }
4974              
4975              oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
4976              
4977              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
4978              {
4979                  _fnReDraw( oSettings );
4980              }
4981              return aiReturn;
4982          };
4983          
4984          
4985          /**
4986           * This function will make DataTables recalculate the column sizes, based on the data 
4987           * contained in the table and the sizes applied to the columns (in the DOM, CSS or 
4988           * through the sWidth parameter). This can be useful when the width of the table's 
4989           * parent element changes (for example a window resize).
4990           *  @param {boolean} [bRedraw=true] Redraw the table or not, you will typically want to
4991           *  @dtopt API
4992           *
4993           *  @example
4994           *    $(document).ready(function() {
4995           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable( {
4996           *        "sScrollY": "200px",
4997           *        "bPaginate": false
4998           *      } );
4999           *      
5000           *      $(window).bind('resize', function () {
5001           *        oTable.fnAdjustColumnSizing();
5002           *      } );
5003           *    } );
5004           */
5005          this.fnAdjustColumnSizing = function ( bRedraw )
5006          {
5007              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode(this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex]);
5008              _fnAdjustColumnSizing( oSettings );
5009              
5010              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
5011              {
5012                  this.fnDraw( false );
5013              }
5014              else if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" || oSettings.oScroll.sY !== "" )
5015              {
5016                  /* If not redrawing, but scrolling, we want to apply the new column sizes anyway */
5017                  this.oApi._fnScrollDraw(oSettings);
5018              }
5019          };
5020          
5021          
5022          /**
5023           * Quickly and simply clear a table
5024           *  @param {bool} [bRedraw=true] redraw the table or not
5025           *  @dtopt API
5026           *
5027           *  @example
5028           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5029           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5030           *      
5031           *      // Immediately 'nuke' the current rows (perhaps waiting for an Ajax callback...)
5032           *      oTable.fnClearTable();
5033           *    } );
5034           */
5035          this.fnClearTable = function( bRedraw )
5036          {
5037              /* Find settings from table node */
5038              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5039              _fnClearTable( oSettings );
5040              
5041              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
5042              {
5043                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
5044              }
5045          };
5046          
5047          
5048          /**
5049           * The exact opposite of 'opening' a row, this function will close any rows which 
5050           * are currently 'open'.
5051           *  @param {node} nTr the table row to 'close'
5052           *  @returns {int} 0 on success, or 1 if failed (can't find the row)
5053           *  @dtopt API
5054           *
5055           *  @example
5056           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5057           *      var oTable;
5058           *      
5059           *      // 'open' an information row when a row is clicked on
5060           *      $('#example tbody tr').click( function () {
5061           *        if ( oTable.fnIsOpen(this) ) {
5062           *          oTable.fnClose( this );
5063           *        } else {
5064           *          oTable.fnOpen( this, "Temporary row opened", "info_row" );
5065           *        }
5066           *      } );
5067           *      
5068           *      oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5069           *    } );
5070           */
5071          this.fnClose = function( nTr )
5072          {
5073              /* Find settings from table node */
5074              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5075              
5076              for ( var i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoOpenRows.length ; i++ )
5077              {
5078                  if ( oSettings.aoOpenRows[i].nParent == nTr )
5079                  {
5080                      var nTrParent = oSettings.aoOpenRows[i].nTr.parentNode;
5081                      if ( nTrParent )
5082                      {
5083                          /* Remove it if it is currently on display */
5084                          nTrParent.removeChild( oSettings.aoOpenRows[i].nTr );
5085                      }
5086                      oSettings.aoOpenRows.splice( i, 1 );
5087                      return 0;
5088                  }
5089              }
