5090              return 1;
5091          };
5092          
5093          
5094          /**
5095           * Remove a row for the table
5096           *  @param {mixed} mTarget The index of the row from aoData to be deleted, or
5097           *    the TR element you want to delete
5098           *  @param {function|null} [fnCallBack] Callback function
5099           *  @param {bool} [bRedraw=true] Redraw the table or not
5100           *  @returns {array} The row that was deleted
5101           *  @dtopt API
5102           *
5103           *  @example
5104           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5105           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5106           *      
5107           *      // Immediately remove the first row
5108           *      oTable.fnDeleteRow( 0 );
5109           *    } );
5110           */
5111          this.fnDeleteRow = function( mTarget, fnCallBack, bRedraw )
5112          {
5113              /* Find settings from table node */
5114              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5115              var i, iLen, iAODataIndex;
5116              
5117              iAODataIndex = (typeof mTarget === 'object') ? 
5118                  _fnNodeToDataIndex(oSettings, mTarget) : mTarget;
5119              
5120              /* Return the data array from this row */
5121              var oData = oSettings.aoData.splice( iAODataIndex, 1 );
5122          
5123              /* Update the _DT_RowIndex parameter */
5124              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5125              {
5126                  if ( oSettings.aoData[i].nTr !== null )
5127                  {
5128                      oSettings.aoData[i].nTr._DT_RowIndex = i;
5129                  }
5130              }
5131              
5132              /* Remove the target row from the search array */
5133              var iDisplayIndex = $.inArray( iAODataIndex, oSettings.aiDisplay );
5134              oSettings.asDataSearch.splice( iDisplayIndex, 1 );
5135              
5136              /* Delete from the display arrays */
5137              _fnDeleteIndex( oSettings.aiDisplayMaster, iAODataIndex );
5138              _fnDeleteIndex( oSettings.aiDisplay, iAODataIndex );
5139              
5140              /* If there is a user callback function - call it */
5141              if ( typeof fnCallBack === "function" )
5142              {
5143                  fnCallBack.call( this, oSettings, oData );
5144              }
5145              
5146              /* Check for an 'overflow' they case for dislaying the table */
5147              if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart >= oSettings.aiDisplay.length )
5148              {
5149                  oSettings._iDisplayStart -= oSettings._iDisplayLength;
5150                  if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart < 0 )
5151                  {
5152                      oSettings._iDisplayStart = 0;
5153                  }
5154              }
5155              
5156              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
5157              {
5158                  _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
5159                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
5160              }
5161              
5162              return oData;
5163          };
5164          
5165          
5166          /**
5167           * Restore the table to it's original state in the DOM by removing all of DataTables 
5168           * enhancements, alterations to the DOM structure of the table and event listeners.
5169           *  @param {boolean} [bRemove=false] Completely remove the table from the DOM
5170           *  @dtopt API
5171           *
5172           *  @example
5173           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5174           *      // This example is fairly pointless in reality, but shows how fnDestroy can be used
5175           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5176           *      oTable.fnDestroy();
5177           *    } );
5178           */
5179          this.fnDestroy = function ( bRemove )
5180          {
5181              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5182              var nOrig = oSettings.nTableWrapper.parentNode;
5183              var nBody = oSettings.nTBody;
5184              var i, iLen;
5185          
5186              bRemove = (bRemove===undefined) ? false : true;
5187              
5188              /* Flag to note that the table is currently being destroyed - no action should be taken */
5189              oSettings.bDestroying = true;
5190              
5191              /* Restore hidden columns */
5192              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoDestroyCallback.length ; i<iLen ; i++ ) {
5193                  oSettings.aoDestroyCallback[i].fn();
5194              }
5195              
5196              /* Restore hidden columns */
5197              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5198              {
5199                  if ( oSettings.aoColumns[i].bVisible === false )
5200                  {
5201                      this.fnSetColumnVis( i, true );
5202                  }
5203              }
5204              
5205              /* Blitz all DT events */
5206              $(oSettings.nTableWrapper).find('*').andSelf().unbind('.DT');
5207              
5208              /* If there is an 'empty' indicator row, remove it */
5209              $('tbody>tr>td.'+oSettings.oClasses.sRowEmpty, oSettings.nTable).parent().remove();
5210              
5211              /* When scrolling we had to break the table up - restore it */
5212              if ( oSettings.nTable != oSettings.nTHead.parentNode )
5213              {
5214                  $(oSettings.nTable).children('thead').remove();
5215                  oSettings.nTable.appendChild( oSettings.nTHead );
5216              }
5217              
5218              if ( oSettings.nTFoot && oSettings.nTable != oSettings.nTFoot.parentNode )
5219              {
5220                  $(oSettings.nTable).children('tfoot').remove();
5221                  oSettings.nTable.appendChild( oSettings.nTFoot );
5222              }
5223              
5224              /* Remove the DataTables generated nodes, events and classes */
5225              oSettings.nTable.parentNode.removeChild( oSettings.nTable );
5226              $(oSettings.nTableWrapper).remove();
5227              
5228              oSettings.aaSorting = [];
5229              oSettings.aaSortingFixed = [];
5230              _fnSortingClasses( oSettings );
5231              
5232              $(_fnGetTrNodes( oSettings )).removeClass( oSettings.asStripeClasses.join(' ') );
5233              
5234              $('th, td', oSettings.nTHead).removeClass( [
5235                  oSettings.oClasses.sSortable,
5236                  oSettings.oClasses.sSortableAsc,
5237                  oSettings.oClasses.sSortableDesc,
5238                  oSettings.oClasses.sSortableNone ].join(' ')
5239              );
5240              if ( oSettings.bJUI )
5241              {
5242                  $('th span.'+oSettings.oClasses.sSortIcon
5243                      + ', td span.'+oSettings.oClasses.sSortIcon, oSettings.nTHead).remove();
5244          
5245                  $('th, td', oSettings.nTHead).each( function () {
5246                      var jqWrapper = $('div.'+oSettings.oClasses.sSortJUIWrapper, this);
5247                      var kids = jqWrapper.contents();
5248                      $(this).append( kids );
5249                      jqWrapper.remove();
5250                  } );
5251              }
5252              
5253              /* Add the TR elements back into the table in their original order */
5254              if ( !bRemove && oSettings.nTableReinsertBefore )
5255              {
5256                  nOrig.insertBefore( oSettings.nTable, oSettings.nTableReinsertBefore );
5257              }
5258              else if ( !bRemove )
5259              {
5260                  nOrig.appendChild( oSettings.nTable );
5261              }
5262          
5263              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5264              {
5265                  if ( oSettings.aoData[i].nTr !== null )
5266                  {
5267                      nBody.appendChild( oSettings.aoData[i].nTr );
5268                  }
5269              }
5270              
5271              /* Restore the width of the original table */
5272              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bAutoWidth === true )
5273              {
5274                oSettings.nTable.style.width = _fnStringToCss(oSettings.sDestroyWidth);
5275              }
5276              
5277              /* If the were originally odd/even type classes - then we add them back here. Note
5278               * this is not fool proof (for example if not all rows as odd/even classes - but 
5279               * it's a good effort without getting carried away
5280               */
5281              $(nBody).children('tr:even').addClass( oSettings.asDestroyStripes[0] );
5282              $(nBody).children('tr:odd').addClass( oSettings.asDestroyStripes[1] );
5283              
5284              /* Remove the settings object from the settings array */
5285              for ( i=0, iLen=DataTable.settings.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5286              {
5287                  if ( DataTable.settings[i] == oSettings )
5288                  {
5289                      DataTable.settings.splice( i, 1 );
5290                  }
5291              }
5292              
5293              /* End it all */
5294              oSettings = null;
5295          };
5296          
5297          
5298          /**
5299           * Redraw the table
5300           *  @param {bool} [bComplete=true] Re-filter and resort (if enabled) the table before the draw.
5301           *  @dtopt API
5302           *
5303           *  @example
5304           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5305           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5306           *      
5307           *      // Re-draw the table - you wouldn't want to do it here, but it's an example :-)
5308           *      oTable.fnDraw();
5309           *    } );
5310           */
5311          this.fnDraw = function( bComplete )
5312          {
5313              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5314              if ( bComplete )
5315              {
5316                  _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
5317                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
5318              }
5319              else
5320              {
5321                  _fnReDraw( oSettings );
5322              }
5323          };
5324          
5325          
5326          /**
5327           * Filter the input based on data
5328           *  @param {string} sInput String to filter the table on
5329           *  @param {int|null} [iColumn] Column to limit filtering to
5330           *  @param {bool} [bRegex=false] Treat as regular expression or not
5331           *  @param {bool} [bSmart=true] Perform smart filtering or not
5332           *  @param {bool} [bShowGlobal=true] Show the input global filter in it's input box(es)
5333           *  @param {bool} [bCaseInsensitive=true] Do case-insensitive matching (true) or not (false)
5334           *  @dtopt API
5335           *
5336           *  @example
5337           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5338           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5339           *      
5340           *      // Sometime later - filter...
5341           *      oTable.fnFilter( 'test string' );
5342           *    } );
5343           */
5344          this.fnFilter = function( sInput, iColumn, bRegex, bSmart, bShowGlobal, bCaseInsensitive )
5345          {
5346              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5347              
5348              if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bFilter )
5349              {
5350                  return;
5351              }
5352              
5353              if ( bRegex === undefined || bRegex === null )
5354              {
5355                  bRegex = false;
5356              }
5357              
5358              if ( bSmart === undefined || bSmart === null )
5359              {
5360                  bSmart = true;
5361              }
5362              
5363              if ( bShowGlobal === undefined || bShowGlobal === null )
5364              {
5365                  bShowGlobal = true;
5366              }
5367              
5368              if ( bCaseInsensitive === undefined || bCaseInsensitive === null )
5369              {
5370                  bCaseInsensitive = true;
5371              }
5372              
5373              if ( iColumn === undefined || iColumn === null )
5374              {
5375                  /* Global filter */
5376                  _fnFilterComplete( oSettings, {
5377                      "sSearch":sInput+"",
5378                      "bRegex": bRegex,
5379                      "bSmart": bSmart,
5380                      "bCaseInsensitive": bCaseInsensitive
5381                  }, 1 );
5382                  
5383                  if ( bShowGlobal && oSettings.aanFeatures.f )
5384                  {
5385                      var n = oSettings.aanFeatures.f;
5386                      for ( var i=0, iLen=n.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5387                      {
5388                          $('input', n[i]).val( sInput );
5389                      }
5390                  }
5391              }
5392              else
5393              {
5394                  /* Single column filter */
5395                  $.extend( oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[ iColumn ], {
5396                      "sSearch": sInput+"",
5397                      "bRegex": bRegex,
5398                      "bSmart": bSmart,
5399                      "bCaseInsensitive": bCaseInsensitive
5400                  } );
5401                  _fnFilterComplete( oSettings, oSettings.oPreviousSearch, 1 );
5402              }
5403          };
5404          
5405          
5406          /**
5407           * Get the data for the whole table, an individual row or an individual cell based on the 
5408           * provided parameters.
5409           *  @param {int|node} [mRow] A TR row node, TD/TH cell node or an integer. If given as
5410           *    a TR node then the data source for the whole row will be returned. If given as a
5411           *    TD/TH cell node then iCol will be automatically calculated and the data for the
5412           *    cell returned. If given as an integer, then this is treated as the aoData internal
5413           *    data index for the row (see fnGetPosition) and the data for that row used.
5414           *  @param {int} [iCol] Optional column index that you want the data of.
5415           *  @returns {array|object|string} If mRow is undefined, then the data for all rows is
5416           *    returned. If mRow is defined, just data for that row, and is iCol is
5417           *    defined, only data for the designated cell is returned.
5418           *  @dtopt API
5419           *
5420           *  @example
5421           *    // Row data
5422           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5423           *      oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5424           *
5425           *      oTable.$('tr').click( function () {
5426           *        var data = oTable.fnGetData( this );
5427           *        // ... do something with the array / object of data for the row
5428           *      } );
5429           *    } );
5430           *
5431           *  @example
5432           *    // Individual cell data
5433           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5434           *      oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5435           *
5436           *      oTable.$('td').click( function () {
5437           *        var sData = oTable.fnGetData( this );
5438           *        alert( 'The cell clicked on had the value of '+sData );
5439           *      } );
5440           *    } );
5441           */
5442          this.fnGetData = function( mRow, iCol )
5443          {
5444              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5445              
5446              if ( mRow !== undefined )
5447              {
5448                  var iRow = mRow;
5449                  if ( typeof mRow === 'object' )
5450                  {
5451                      var sNode = mRow.nodeName.toLowerCase();
5452                      if (sNode === "tr" )
5453                      {
5454                          iRow = _fnNodeToDataIndex(oSettings, mRow);
5455                      }
5456                      else if ( sNode === "td" )
5457                      {
5458                          iRow = _fnNodeToDataIndex(oSettings, mRow.parentNode);
5459                          iCol = _fnNodeToColumnIndex( oSettings, iRow, mRow );
5460                      }
5461                  }
5462          
5463                  if ( iCol !== undefined )
5464                  {
5465                      return _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, iCol, '' );
5466                  }
5467                  return (oSettings.aoData[iRow]!==undefined) ?
5468                      oSettings.aoData[iRow]._aData : null;
5469              }
5470              return _fnGetDataMaster( oSettings );
5471          };
5472          
5473          
5474          /**
5475           * Get an array of the TR nodes that are used in the table's body. Note that you will 
5476           * typically want to use the '$' API method in preference to this as it is more 
5477           * flexible.
5478           *  @param {int} [iRow] Optional row index for the TR element you want
5479           *  @returns {array|node} If iRow is undefined, returns an array of all TR elements
5480           *    in the table's body, or iRow is defined, just the TR element requested.
5481           *  @dtopt API
5482           *
5483           *  @example
5484           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5485           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5486           *      
5487           *      // Get the nodes from the table
5488           *      var nNodes = oTable.fnGetNodes( );
5489           *    } );
5490           */
5491          this.fnGetNodes = function( iRow )
5492          {
5493              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5494              
5495              if ( iRow !== undefined ) {
5496                  return (oSettings.aoData[iRow]!==undefined) ?
5497                      oSettings.aoData[iRow].nTr : null;
5498              }
5499              return _fnGetTrNodes( oSettings );
5500          };
5501          
5502          
5503          /**
5504           * Get the array indexes of a particular cell from it's DOM element
5505           * and column index including hidden columns
5506           *  @param {node} nNode this can either be a TR, TD or TH in the table's body
5507           *  @returns {int} If nNode is given as a TR, then a single index is returned, or
5508           *    if given as a cell, an array of [row index, column index (visible)] is given.
5509           *  @dtopt API
5510           *
5511           *  @example
5512           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5513           *      $('#example tbody td').click( function () {
5514           *        // Get the position of the current data from the node
5515           *        var aPos = oTable.fnGetPosition( this );
5516           *        
5517           *        // Get the data array for this row
5518           *        var aData = oTable.fnGetData( aPos[0] );
5519           *        
5520           *        // Update the data array and return the value
5521           *        aData[ aPos[1] ] = 'clicked';
5522           *        this.innerHTML = 'clicked';
5523           *      } );
5524           *      
5525           *      // Init DataTables
5526           *      oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5527           *    } );
5528           */
5529          this.fnGetPosition = function( nNode )
5530          {
5531              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5532              var sNodeName = nNode.nodeName.toUpperCase();
5533              
5534              if ( sNodeName == "TR" )
5535              {
5536                  return _fnNodeToDataIndex(oSettings, nNode);
5537              }
5538              else if ( sNodeName == "TD" || sNodeName == "TH" )
5539              {
5540                  var iDataIndex = _fnNodeToDataIndex( oSettings, nNode.parentNode );
5541                  var iColumnIndex = _fnNodeToColumnIndex( oSettings, iDataIndex, nNode );
5542                  return [ iDataIndex, _fnColumnIndexToVisible(oSettings, iColumnIndex ), iColumnIndex ];
5543              }
5544              return null;
5545          };
5546          
5547          
5548          /**
5549           * Check to see if a row is 'open' or not.
5550           *  @param {node} nTr the table row to check
5551           *  @returns {boolean} true if the row is currently open, false otherwise
5552           *  @dtopt API
5553           *
5554           *  @example
5555           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5556           *      var oTable;
5557           *      
5558           *      // 'open' an information row when a row is clicked on
5559           *      $('#example tbody tr').click( function () {
5560           *        if ( oTable.fnIsOpen(this) ) {
5561           *          oTable.fnClose( this );
5562           *        } else {
5563           *          oTable.fnOpen( this, "Temporary row opened", "info_row" );
5564           *        }
5565           *      } );
5566           *      
5567           *      oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5568           *    } );
5569           */
5570          this.fnIsOpen = function( nTr )
5571          {
5572              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5573              var aoOpenRows = oSettings.aoOpenRows;
5574              
5575              for ( var i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoOpenRows.length ; i++ )
5576              {
5577                  if ( oSettings.aoOpenRows[i].nParent == nTr )
5578                  {
5579                      return true;
5580                  }
5581              }
5582              return false;
5583          };
5584          
5585          
5586          /**
5587           * This function will place a new row directly after a row which is currently 
5588           * on display on the page, with the HTML contents that is passed into the 
5589           * function. This can be used, for example, to ask for confirmation that a 
5590           * particular record should be deleted.
5591           *  @param {node} nTr The table row to 'open'
5592           *  @param {string|node|jQuery} mHtml The HTML to put into the row
5593           *  @param {string} sClass Class to give the new TD cell
5594           *  @returns {node} The row opened. Note that if the table row passed in as the
5595           *    first parameter, is not found in the table, this method will silently
5596           *    return.
5597           *  @dtopt API
5598           *
5599           *  @example
5600           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5601           *      var oTable;
5602           *      
5603           *      // 'open' an information row when a row is clicked on
5604           *      $('#example tbody tr').click( function () {
5605           *        if ( oTable.fnIsOpen(this) ) {
5606           *          oTable.fnClose( this );
5607           *        } else {
5608           *          oTable.fnOpen( this, "Temporary row opened", "info_row" );
5609           *        }
5610           *      } );
5611           *      
5612           *      oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5613           *    } );
5614           */
5615          this.fnOpen = function( nTr, mHtml, sClass )
5616          {
5617              /* Find settings from table node */
5618              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5619          
5620              /* Check that the row given is in the table */
5621              var nTableRows = _fnGetTrNodes( oSettings );
5622              if ( $.inArray(nTr, nTableRows) === -1 )
5623              {
5624                  return;
5625              }
5626              
5627              /* the old open one if there is one */
5628              this.fnClose( nTr );
5629              
5630              var nNewRow = document.createElement("tr");
5631              var nNewCell = document.createElement("td");
5632              nNewRow.appendChild( nNewCell );
5633              nNewCell.className = sClass;
5634              nNewCell.colSpan = _fnVisbleColumns( oSettings );
5635          
5636              if (typeof mHtml === "string")
5637              {
5638                  nNewCell.innerHTML = mHtml;
5639              }
5640              else
5641              {
5642                  $(nNewCell).html( mHtml );
5643              }
5644          
5645              /* If the nTr isn't on the page at the moment - then we don't insert at the moment */
5646              var nTrs = $('tr', oSettings.nTBody);
5647              if ( $.inArray(nTr, nTrs) != -1  )
5648              {
5649                  $(nNewRow).insertAfter(nTr);
5650              }
5651              
5652              oSettings.aoOpenRows.push( {
5653                  "nTr": nNewRow,
5654                  "nParent": nTr
5655              } );
5656              
5657              return nNewRow;
5658          };
5659          
5660          
5661          /**
5662           * Change the pagination - provides the internal logic for pagination in a simple API 
5663           * function. With this function you can have a DataTables table go to the next, 
5664           * previous, first or last pages.
5665           *  @param {string|int} mAction Paging action to take: "first", "previous", "next" or "last"
5666           *    or page number to jump to (integer), note that page 0 is the first page.
5667           *  @param {bool} [bRedraw=true] Redraw the table or not
5668           *  @dtopt API
5669           *
5670           *  @example
5671           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5672           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5673           *      oTable.fnPageChange( 'next' );
5674           *    } );
5675           */
5676          this.fnPageChange = function ( mAction, bRedraw )
5677          {
5678              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5679              _fnPageChange( oSettings, mAction );
5680              _fnCalculateEnd( oSettings );
5681              
5682              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
5683              {
5684                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
5685              }
5686          };
5687          
5688          
5689          /**
5690           * Show a particular column
5691           *  @param {int} iCol The column whose display should be changed
5692           *  @param {bool} bShow Show (true) or hide (false) the column
5693           *  @param {bool} [bRedraw=true] Redraw the table or not
5694           *  @dtopt API
5695           *
5696           *  @example
5697           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5698           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5699           *      
5700           *      // Hide the second column after initialisation
5701           *      oTable.fnSetColumnVis( 1, false );
5702           *    } );
5703           */
5704          this.fnSetColumnVis = function ( iCol, bShow, bRedraw )
5705          {
5706              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5707              var i, iLen;
5708              var aoColumns = oSettings.aoColumns;
5709              var aoData = oSettings.aoData;
5710              var nTd, nCell, anTrs, jqChildren, bAppend, iBefore;
5711              
5712              /* No point in doing anything if we are requesting what is already true */
5713              if ( aoColumns[iCol].bVisible == bShow )
5714              {
5715                  return;
5716              }
5717              
5718              /* Show the column */
5719              if ( bShow )
5720              {
5721                  var iInsert = 0;
5722                  for ( i=0 ; i<iCol ; i++ )
5723                  {
5724                      if ( aoColumns[i].bVisible )
5725                      {
5726                          iInsert++;
5727                      }
5728                  }
5729                  
5730                  /* Need to decide if we should use appendChild or insertBefore */
5731                  bAppend = (iInsert >= _fnVisbleColumns( oSettings ));
5732          
5733                  /* Which coloumn should we be inserting before? */
5734                  if ( !bAppend )
5735                  {
5736                      for ( i=iCol ; i<aoColumns.length ; i++ )
5737                      {
5738                          if ( aoColumns[i].bVisible )
5739                          {
5740                              iBefore = i;
5741                              break;
5742                          }
5743                      }
5744                  }
5745          
5746                  for ( i=0, iLen=aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5747                  {
5748                      if ( aoData[i].nTr !== null )
5749                      {
5750                          if ( bAppend )
5751                          {
5752                              aoData[i].nTr.appendChild( 
5753                                  aoData[i]._anHidden[iCol]
5754                              );
5755                          }
5756                          else
5757                          {
5758                              aoData[i].nTr.insertBefore(
5759                                  aoData[i]._anHidden[iCol], 
5760                                  _fnGetTdNodes( oSettings, i )[iBefore] );
5761                          }
5762                      }
5763                  }
5764              }
5765              else
5766              {
5767                  /* Remove a column from display */
5768                  for ( i=0, iLen=aoData.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5769                  {
5770                      if ( aoData[i].nTr !== null )
5771                      {
5772                          nTd = _fnGetTdNodes( oSettings, i )[iCol];
5773                          aoData[i]._anHidden[iCol] = nTd;
5774                          nTd.parentNode.removeChild( nTd );
5775                      }
5776                  }
5777              }
5778          
5779              /* Clear to set the visible flag */
5780              aoColumns[iCol].bVisible = bShow;
5781          
5782              /* Redraw the header and footer based on the new column visibility */
5783              _fnDrawHead( oSettings, oSettings.aoHeader );
5784              if ( oSettings.nTFoot )
5785              {
5786                  _fnDrawHead( oSettings, oSettings.aoFooter );
5787              }
5788              
5789              /* If there are any 'open' rows, then we need to alter the colspan for this col change */
5790              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aoOpenRows.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
5791              {
5792                  oSettings.aoOpenRows[i].nTr.colSpan = _fnVisbleColumns( oSettings );
5793              }
5794              
5795              /* Do a redraw incase anything depending on the table columns needs it 
5796               * (built-in: scrolling) 
5797               */
5798              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
5799              {
5800                  _fnAdjustColumnSizing( oSettings );
5801                  _fnDraw( oSettings );
5802              }
5803              
5804              _fnSaveState( oSettings );
5805          };
5806          
5807          
5808          /**
5809           * Get the settings for a particular table for external manipulation
5810           *  @returns {object} DataTables settings object. See 
5811           *    {@link DataTable.models.oSettings}
5812           *  @dtopt API
5813           *
5814           *  @example
5815           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5816           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5817           *      var oSettings = oTable.fnSettings();
5818           *      
5819           *      // Show an example parameter from the settings
5820           *      alert( oSettings._iDisplayStart );
5821           *    } );
5822           */
5823          this.fnSettings = function()
5824          {
5825              return _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5826          };
5827          
5828          
5829          /**
5830           * Sort the table by a particular row
5831           *  @param {int} iCol the data index to sort on. Note that this will not match the 
5832           *    'display index' if you have hidden data entries
5833           *  @dtopt API
5834           *
5835           *  @example
5836           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5837           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5838           *      
5839           *      // Sort immediately with columns 0 and 1
5840           *      oTable.fnSort( [ [0,'asc'], [1,'asc'] ] );
5841           *    } );
5842           */
5843          this.fnSort = function( aaSort )
5844          {
5845              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5846              oSettings.aaSorting = aaSort;
5847              _fnSort( oSettings );
5848          };
5849          
5850          
5851          /**
5852           * Attach a sort listener to an element for a given column
5853           *  @param {node} nNode the element to attach the sort listener to
5854           *  @param {int} iColumn the column that a click on this node will sort on
5855           *  @param {function} [fnCallback] callback function when sort is run
5856           *  @dtopt API
5857           *
5858           *  @example
5859           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5860           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5861           *      
5862           *      // Sort on column 1, when 'sorter' is clicked on
5863           *      oTable.fnSortListener( document.getElementById('sorter'), 1 );
5864           *    } );
5865           */
5866          this.fnSortListener = function( nNode, iColumn, fnCallback )
5867          {
5868              _fnSortAttachListener( _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] ), nNode, iColumn,
5869                   fnCallback );
5870          };
5871          
5872          
5873          /**
5874           * Update a table cell or row - this method will accept either a single value to
5875           * update the cell with, an array of values with one element for each column or
5876           * an object in the same format as the original data source. The function is
5877           * self-referencing in order to make the multi column updates easier.
5878           *  @param {object|array|string} mData Data to update the cell/row with
5879           *  @param {node|int} mRow TR element you want to update or the aoData index
5880           *  @param {int} [iColumn] The column to update (not used of mData is an array or object)
5881           *  @param {bool} [bRedraw=true] Redraw the table or not
5882           *  @param {bool} [bAction=true] Perform predraw actions or not
5883           *  @returns {int} 0 on success, 1 on error
5884           *  @dtopt API
5885           *
5886           *  @example
5887           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5888           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5889           *      oTable.fnUpdate( 'Example update', 0, 0 ); // Single cell
5890           *      oTable.fnUpdate( ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e'], 1, 0 ); // Row
5891           *    } );
5892           */
5893          this.fnUpdate = function( mData, mRow, iColumn, bRedraw, bAction )
5894          {
5895              var oSettings = _fnSettingsFromNode( this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex] );
5896              var iVisibleColumn, i, iLen, sDisplay;
5897              var iRow = (typeof mRow === 'object') ? 
5898                  _fnNodeToDataIndex(oSettings, mRow) : mRow;
5899              
5900              if ( oSettings.__fnUpdateDeep === undefined && $.isArray(mData) && typeof mData === 'object' )
5901              {
5902                  /* Array update - update the whole row */
5903                  oSettings.aoData[iRow]._aData = mData.slice();
5904                  
5905                  /* Flag to the function that we are recursing */
5906                  oSettings.__fnUpdateDeep = true;
5907                  for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i++ )
5908                  {
5909                      this.fnUpdate( _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, i ), iRow, i, false, false );
5910                  }
5911                  oSettings.__fnUpdateDeep = undefined;
5912              }
5913              else if ( oSettings.__fnUpdateDeep === undefined && mData !== null && typeof mData === 'object' )
5914              {
5915                  /* Object update - update the whole row - assume the developer gets the object right */
5916                  oSettings.aoData[iRow]._aData = $.extend( true, {}, mData );
5917          
5918                  oSettings.__fnUpdateDeep = true;
5919                  for ( i=0 ; i<oSettings.aoColumns.length ; i++ )
5920                  {
5921                      this.fnUpdate( _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, i ), iRow, i, false, false );
5922                  }
5923                  oSettings.__fnUpdateDeep = undefined;
5924              }
5925              else
5926              {
5927                  /* Individual cell update */
5928                  _fnSetCellData( oSettings, iRow, iColumn, mData );
5929                  sDisplay = _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, iColumn, 'display' );
5930                  
5931                  var oCol = oSettings.aoColumns[iColumn];
5932                  if ( oCol.fnRender !== null )
5933                  {
5934                      sDisplay = _fnRender( oSettings, iRow, iColumn );
5935                      if ( oCol.bUseRendered )
5936                      {
5937                          _fnSetCellData( oSettings, iRow, iColumn, sDisplay );
5938                      }
5939                  }
5940                  
5941                  if ( oSettings.aoData[iRow].nTr !== null )
5942                  {
5943                      /* Do the actual HTML update */
5944                      _fnGetTdNodes( oSettings, iRow )[iColumn].innerHTML = sDisplay;
5945                  }
5946              }
5947              
5948              /* Modify the search index for this row (strictly this is likely not needed, since fnReDraw
5949               * will rebuild the search array - however, the redraw might be disabled by the user)
5950               */
5951              var iDisplayIndex = $.inArray( iRow, oSettings.aiDisplay );
5952              oSettings.asDataSearch[iDisplayIndex] = _fnBuildSearchRow( oSettings, 
5953                  _fnGetRowData( oSettings, iRow, 'filter' ) );
5954              
5955              /* Perform pre-draw actions */
5956              if ( bAction === undefined || bAction )
5957              {
5958                  _fnAdjustColumnSizing( oSettings );
5959              }
5960              
5961              /* Redraw the table */
5962              if ( bRedraw === undefined || bRedraw )
5963              {
5964                  _fnReDraw( oSettings );
5965              }
5966              return 0;
5967          };
5968          
5969          
5970          /**
5971           * Provide a common method for plug-ins to check the version of DataTables being used, in order
5972           * to ensure compatibility.
5973           *  @param {string} sVersion Version string to check for, in the format "X.Y.Z". Note that the
5974           *    formats "X" and "X.Y" are also acceptable.
5975           *  @returns {boolean} true if this version of DataTables is greater or equal to the required
5976           *    version, or false if this version of DataTales is not suitable
5977           *  @method
5978           *  @dtopt API
5979           *
5980           *  @example
5981           *    $(document).ready(function() {
5982           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
5983           *      alert( oTable.fnVersionCheck( '1.9.0' ) );
5984           *    } );
5985           */
5986          this.fnVersionCheck = DataTable.ext.fnVersionCheck;
5987          
5988          
5989          /*
5990           * This is really a good bit rubbish this method of exposing the internal methods
5991           * publically... - To be fixed in 2.0 using methods on the prototype
5992           */
5993          
5994          
5995          /**
5996           * Create a wrapper function for exporting an internal functions to an external API.
5997           *  @param {string} sFunc API function name
5998           *  @returns {function} wrapped function
5999           *  @memberof DataTable#oApi
6000           */
6001  		function _fnExternApiFunc (sFunc)
6002          {
6003              return function() {
6004                  var aArgs = [_fnSettingsFromNode(this[DataTable.ext.iApiIndex])].concat( 
6005                      Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments) );
6006                  return DataTable.ext.oApi[sFunc].apply( this, aArgs );
6007              };
6008          }
6009          
6010          
6011          /**
6012           * Reference to internal functions for use by plug-in developers. Note that these
6013           * methods are references to internal functions and are considered to be private.
6014           * If you use these methods, be aware that they are liable to change between versions
6015           * (check the upgrade notes).
6016           *  @namespace
6017           */
6018          this.oApi = {
6019              "_fnExternApiFunc": _fnExternApiFunc,
6020              "_fnInitialise": _fnInitialise,
6021              "_fnInitComplete": _fnInitComplete,
6022              "_fnLanguageCompat": _fnLanguageCompat,
6023              "_fnAddColumn": _fnAddColumn,
6024              "_fnColumnOptions": _fnColumnOptions,
6025              "_fnAddData": _fnAddData,
6026              "_fnCreateTr": _fnCreateTr,
6027              "_fnGatherData": _fnGatherData,
6028              "_fnBuildHead": _fnBuildHead,
6029              "_fnDrawHead": _fnDrawHead,
6030              "_fnDraw": _fnDraw,
6031              "_fnReDraw": _fnReDraw,
6032              "_fnAjaxUpdate": _fnAjaxUpdate,
6033              "_fnAjaxParameters": _fnAjaxParameters,
6034              "_fnAjaxUpdateDraw": _fnAjaxUpdateDraw,
6035              "_fnServerParams": _fnServerParams,
6036              "_fnAddOptionsHtml": _fnAddOptionsHtml,
6037              "_fnFeatureHtmlTable": _fnFeatureHtmlTable,
6038              "_fnScrollDraw": _fnScrollDraw,
6039              "_fnAdjustColumnSizing": _fnAdjustColumnSizing,
6040              "_fnFeatureHtmlFilter": _fnFeatureHtmlFilter,
6041              "_fnFilterComplete": _fnFilterComplete,
6042              "_fnFilterCustom": _fnFilterCustom,
6043              "_fnFilterColumn": _fnFilterColumn,
6044              "_fnFilter": _fnFilter,
6045              "_fnBuildSearchArray": _fnBuildSearchArray,
6046              "_fnBuildSearchRow": _fnBuildSearchRow,
6047              "_fnFilterCreateSearch": _fnFilterCreateSearch,
6048              "_fnDataToSearch": _fnDataToSearch,
6049              "_fnSort": _fnSort,
6050              "_fnSortAttachListener": _fnSortAttachListener,
6051              "_fnSortingClasses": _fnSortingClasses,
6052              "_fnFeatureHtmlPaginate": _fnFeatureHtmlPaginate,
6053              "_fnPageChange": _fnPageChange,
6054              "_fnFeatureHtmlInfo": _fnFeatureHtmlInfo,
6055              "_fnUpdateInfo": _fnUpdateInfo,
6056              "_fnFeatureHtmlLength": _fnFeatureHtmlLength,
6057              "_fnFeatureHtmlProcessing": _fnFeatureHtmlProcessing,
6058              "_fnProcessingDisplay": _fnProcessingDisplay,
6059              "_fnVisibleToColumnIndex": _fnVisibleToColumnIndex,
6060              "_fnColumnIndexToVisible": _fnColumnIndexToVisible,
6061              "_fnNodeToDataIndex": _fnNodeToDataIndex,
6062              "_fnVisbleColumns": _fnVisbleColumns,
6063              "_fnCalculateEnd": _fnCalculateEnd,
6064              "_fnConvertToWidth": _fnConvertToWidth,
6065              "_fnCalculateColumnWidths": _fnCalculateColumnWidths,
6066              "_fnScrollingWidthAdjust": _fnScrollingWidthAdjust,
6067              "_fnGetWidestNode": _fnGetWidestNode,
6068              "_fnGetMaxLenString": _fnGetMaxLenString,
6069              "_fnStringToCss": _fnStringToCss,
6070              "_fnDetectType": _fnDetectType,
6071              "_fnSettingsFromNode": _fnSettingsFromNode,
6072              "_fnGetDataMaster": _fnGetDataMaster,
6073              "_fnGetTrNodes": _fnGetTrNodes,
6074              "_fnGetTdNodes": _fnGetTdNodes,
6075              "_fnEscapeRegex": _fnEscapeRegex,
6076              "_fnDeleteIndex": _fnDeleteIndex,
6077              "_fnReOrderIndex": _fnReOrderIndex,
6078              "_fnColumnOrdering": _fnColumnOrdering,
6079              "_fnLog": _fnLog,
6080              "_fnClearTable": _fnClearTable,
6081              "_fnSaveState": _fnSaveState,
6082              "_fnLoadState": _fnLoadState,
6083              "_fnCreateCookie": _fnCreateCookie,
6084              "_fnReadCookie": _fnReadCookie,
6085              "_fnDetectHeader": _fnDetectHeader,
6086              "_fnGetUniqueThs": _fnGetUniqueThs,
6087              "_fnScrollBarWidth": _fnScrollBarWidth,
6088              "_fnApplyToChildren": _fnApplyToChildren,
6089              "_fnMap": _fnMap,
6090              "_fnGetRowData": _fnGetRowData,
6091              "_fnGetCellData": _fnGetCellData,
6092              "_fnSetCellData": _fnSetCellData,
6093              "_fnGetObjectDataFn": _fnGetObjectDataFn,
6094              "_fnSetObjectDataFn": _fnSetObjectDataFn,
6095              "_fnApplyColumnDefs": _fnApplyColumnDefs,
6096              "_fnBindAction": _fnBindAction,
6097              "_fnExtend": _fnExtend,
6098              "_fnCallbackReg": _fnCallbackReg,
6099              "_fnCallbackFire": _fnCallbackFire,
6100              "_fnJsonString": _fnJsonString,
6101              "_fnRender": _fnRender,
6102              "_fnNodeToColumnIndex": _fnNodeToColumnIndex
6103          };
6104          
6105          $.extend( DataTable.ext.oApi, this.oApi );
6106          
6107          for ( var sFunc in DataTable.ext.oApi )
6108          {
6109              if ( sFunc )
6110              {
6111                  this[sFunc] = _fnExternApiFunc(sFunc);
6112              }
6113          }
6114          
6115          
6116          var _that = this;
6117          return this.each(function() {
6118              
6119              var i=0, iLen, j, jLen, k, kLen;
6120              var sId = this.getAttribute( 'id' );
6121              var bInitHandedOff = false;
6122              var bUsePassedData = false;
6123              
6124              
6125              /* Sanity check */
6126              if ( this.nodeName.toLowerCase() != 'table' )
6127              {
6128                  _fnLog( null, 0, "Attempted to initialise DataTables on a node which is not a "+
6129                      "table: "+this.nodeName );
6130                  return;
6131              }
6132              
6133              /* Check to see if we are re-initialising a table */
6134              for ( i=0, iLen=DataTable.settings.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
6135              {
6136                  /* Base check on table node */
6137                  if ( DataTable.settings[i].nTable == this )
6138                  {
6139                      if ( oInit === undefined || oInit.bRetrieve )
6140                      {
6141                          return DataTable.settings[i].oInstance;
6142                      }
6143                      else if ( oInit.bDestroy )
6144                      {
6145                          DataTable.settings[i].oInstance.fnDestroy();
6146                          break;
6147                      }
6148                      else
6149                      {
6150                          _fnLog( DataTable.settings[i], 0, "Cannot reinitialise DataTable.\n\n"+
6151                              "To retrieve the DataTables object for this table, pass no arguments or see "+
6152                              "the docs for bRetrieve and bDestroy" );
6153                          return;
6154                      }
6155                  }
6156                  
6157                  /* If the element we are initialising has the same ID as a table which was previously
6158                   * initialised, but the table nodes don't match (from before) then we destroy the old
6159                   * instance by simply deleting it. This is under the assumption that the table has been
6160                   * destroyed by other methods. Anyone using non-id selectors will need to do this manually
6161                   */
6162                  if ( DataTable.settings[i].sTableId == this.id )
6163                  {
6164                      DataTable.settings.splice( i, 1 );
6165                      break;
6166                  }
6167              }
6168              
6169              /* Ensure the table has an ID - required for accessibility */
6170              if ( sId === null )
6171              {
6172                  sId = "DataTables_Table_"+(DataTable.ext._oExternConfig.iNextUnique++);
6173                  this.id = sId;
6174              }
6175              
6176              /* Create the settings object for this table and set some of the default parameters */
6177              var oSettings = $.extend( true, {}, DataTable.models.oSettings, {
6178                  "nTable":        this,
6179                  "oApi":          _that.oApi,
6180                  "oInit":         oInit,
6181                  "sDestroyWidth": $(this).width(),
6182                  "sInstance":     sId,
6183                  "sTableId":      sId
6184              } );
6185              DataTable.settings.push( oSettings );
6186              
6187              // Need to add the instance after the instance after the settings object has been added
6188              // to the settings array, so we can self reference the table instance if more than one
6189              oSettings.oInstance = (_that.length===1) ? _that : $(this).dataTable();
6190              
6191              /* Setting up the initialisation object */
6192              if ( !oInit )
6193              {
6194                  oInit = {};
6195              }
6196              
6197              // Backwards compatibility, before we apply all the defaults
6198              if ( oInit.oLanguage )
6199              {
6200                  _fnLanguageCompat( oInit.oLanguage );
6201              }
6202              
6203              oInit = _fnExtend( $.extend(true, {}, DataTable.defaults), oInit );
6204              
6205              // Map the initialisation options onto the settings object
6206              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bPaginate" );
6207              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bLengthChange" );
6208              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bFilter" );
6209              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bSort" );
6210              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bInfo" );
6211              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bProcessing" );
6212              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bAutoWidth" );
6213              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bSortClasses" );
6214              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bServerSide" );
6215              _fnMap( oSettings.oFeatures, oInit, "bDeferRender" );
6216              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "sScrollX", "sX" );
6217              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "sScrollXInner", "sXInner" );
6218              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "sScrollY", "sY" );
6219              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "bScrollCollapse", "bCollapse" );
6220              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "bScrollInfinite", "bInfinite" );
6221              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "iScrollLoadGap", "iLoadGap" );
6222              _fnMap( oSettings.oScroll, oInit, "bScrollAutoCss", "bAutoCss" );
6223              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "asStripClasses", "asStripeClasses" ); // legacy
6224              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "asStripeClasses" );
6225              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "fnServerData" );
6226              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "fnFormatNumber" );
6227              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "sServerMethod" );
6228              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "aaSorting" );
6229              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "aaSortingFixed" );
6230              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "aLengthMenu" );
6231              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "sPaginationType" );
6232              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "sAjaxSource" );
6233              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "sAjaxDataProp" );
6234              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "iCookieDuration" );
6235              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "sCookiePrefix" );
6236              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "sDom" );
6237              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "bSortCellsTop" );
6238              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "iTabIndex" );
6239              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "oSearch", "oPreviousSearch" );
6240              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "aoSearchCols", "aoPreSearchCols" );
6241              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "iDisplayLength", "_iDisplayLength" );
6242              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "bJQueryUI", "bJUI" );
6243              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "fnCookieCallback" );
6244              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "fnStateLoad" );
6245              _fnMap( oSettings, oInit, "fnStateSave" );
6246              _fnMap( oSettings.oLanguage, oInit, "fnInfoCallback" );
6247              
6248              /* Callback functions which are array driven */
6249              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoDrawCallback',       oInit.fnDrawCallback,      'user' );
6250              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoServerParams',       oInit.fnServerParams,      'user' );
6251              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoStateSaveParams',    oInit.fnStateSaveParams,   'user' );
6252              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoStateLoadParams',    oInit.fnStateLoadParams,   'user' );
6253              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoStateLoaded',        oInit.fnStateLoaded,       'user' );
6254              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoRowCallback',        oInit.fnRowCallback,       'user' );
6255              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoRowCreatedCallback', oInit.fnCreatedRow,        'user' );
6256              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoHeaderCallback',     oInit.fnHeaderCallback,    'user' );
6257              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoFooterCallback',     oInit.fnFooterCallback,    'user' );
6258              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoInitComplete',       oInit.fnInitComplete,      'user' );
6259              _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoPreDrawCallback',    oInit.fnPreDrawCallback,   'user' );
6260              
6261              if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bServerSide && oSettings.oFeatures.bSort &&
6262                     oSettings.oFeatures.bSortClasses )
6263              {
6264                  /* Enable sort classes for server-side processing. Safe to do it here, since server-side
6265                   * processing must be enabled by the developer
6266                   */
6267                  _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoDrawCallback', _fnSortingClasses, 'server_side_sort_classes' );
6268              }
6269              else if ( oSettings.oFeatures.bDeferRender )
6270              {
6271                  _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoDrawCallback', _fnSortingClasses, 'defer_sort_classes' );
6272              }
6273              
6274              if ( oInit.bJQueryUI )
6275              {
6276                  /* Use the JUI classes object for display. You could clone the oStdClasses object if 
6277                   * you want to have multiple tables with multiple independent classes 
6278                   */
6279                  $.extend( oSettings.oClasses, DataTable.ext.oJUIClasses );
6280                  
6281                  if ( oInit.sDom === DataTable.defaults.sDom && DataTable.defaults.sDom === "lfrtip" )
6282                  {
6283                      /* Set the DOM to use a layout suitable for jQuery UI's theming */
6284                      oSettings.sDom = '<"H"lfr>t<"F"ip>';
6285                  }
6286              }
6287              else
6288              {
6289                  $.extend( oSettings.oClasses, DataTable.ext.oStdClasses );
6290              }
6291              $(this).addClass( oSettings.oClasses.sTable );
6292              
6293              /* Calculate the scroll bar width and cache it for use later on */
6294              if ( oSettings.oScroll.sX !== "" || oSettings.oScroll.sY !== "" )
6295              {
6296                  oSettings.oScroll.iBarWidth = _fnScrollBarWidth();
6297              }
6298              
6299              if ( oSettings.iInitDisplayStart === undefined )
6300              {
6301                  /* Display start point, taking into account the save saving */
6302                  oSettings.iInitDisplayStart = oInit.iDisplayStart;
6303                  oSettings._iDisplayStart = oInit.iDisplayStart;
6304              }
6305              
6306              /* Must be done after everything which can be overridden by a cookie! */
6307              if ( oInit.bStateSave )
6308              {
6309                  oSettings.oFeatures.bStateSave = true;
6310                  _fnLoadState( oSettings, oInit );
6311                  _fnCallbackReg( oSettings, 'aoDrawCallback', _fnSaveState, 'state_save' );
6312              }
6313              
6314              if ( oInit.iDeferLoading !== null )
6315              {
6316                  oSettings.bDeferLoading = true;
6317                  oSettings._iRecordsTotal = oInit.iDeferLoading;
6318                  oSettings._iRecordsDisplay = oInit.iDeferLoading;
6319              }
6320              
6321              if ( oInit.aaData !== null )
6322              {
6323                  bUsePassedData = true;
6324              }
6325              
6326              /* Language definitions */
6327              if ( oInit.oLanguage.sUrl !== "" )
6328              {
6329                  /* Get the language definitions from a file - because this Ajax call makes the language
6330                   * get async to the remainder of this function we use bInitHandedOff to indicate that 
6331                   * _fnInitialise will be fired by the returned Ajax handler, rather than the constructor
6332                   */
6333                  oSettings.oLanguage.sUrl = oInit.oLanguage.sUrl;
6334                  $.getJSON( oSettings.oLanguage.sUrl, null, function( json ) {
6335                      _fnLanguageCompat( json );
6336                      $.extend( true, oSettings.oLanguage, oInit.oLanguage, json );
6337                      _fnInitialise( oSettings );
6338                  } );
6339                  bInitHandedOff = true;
6340              }
6341              else
6342              {
6343                  $.extend( true, oSettings.oLanguage, oInit.oLanguage );
6344              }
6345              
6346              
6347              /*
6348               * Stripes
6349               */
6350              
6351              /* Remove row stripe classes if they are already on the table row */
6352              var bStripeRemove = false;
6353              var anRows = $(this).children('tbody').children('tr');
6354              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.asStripeClasses.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
6355              {
6356                  if ( anRows.filter(":lt(2)").hasClass( oSettings.asStripeClasses[i]) )
6357                  {
6358                      bStripeRemove = true;
6359                      break;
6360                  }
6361              }
6362                      
6363              if ( bStripeRemove )
6364              {
6365                  /* Store the classes which we are about to remove so they can be readded on destroy */
6366                  oSettings.asDestroyStripes = [ '', '' ];
6367                  if ( $(anRows[0]).hasClass(oSettings.oClasses.sStripeOdd) )
6368                  {
6369                      oSettings.asDestroyStripes[0] += oSettings.oClasses.sStripeOdd+" ";
6370                  }
6371                  if ( $(anRows[0]).hasClass(oSettings.oClasses.sStripeEven) )
6372                  {
6373                      oSettings.asDestroyStripes[0] += oSettings.oClasses.sStripeEven;
6374                  }
6375                  if ( $(anRows[1]).hasClass(oSettings.oClasses.sStripeOdd) )
6376                  {
6377                      oSettings.asDestroyStripes[1] += oSettings.oClasses.sStripeOdd+" ";
6378                  }
6379                  if ( $(anRows[1]).hasClass(oSettings.oClasses.sStripeEven) )
6380                  {
6381                      oSettings.asDestroyStripes[1] += oSettings.oClasses.sStripeEven;
6382                  }
6383                  
6384                  anRows.removeClass( oSettings.asStripeClasses.join(' ') );
6385              }
6386              
6387              
6388              /*
6389               * Columns
6390               * See if we should load columns automatically or use defined ones
6391               */
6392              var anThs = [];
6393              var aoColumnsInit;
6394              var nThead = this.getElementsByTagName('thead');
6395              if ( nThead.length !== 0 )
6396              {
6397                  _fnDetectHeader( oSettings.aoHeader, nThead[0] );
6398                  anThs = _fnGetUniqueThs( oSettings );
6399              }
6400              
6401              /* If not given a column array, generate one with nulls */
6402              if ( oInit.aoColumns === null )
6403              {
6404                  aoColumnsInit = [];
6405                  for ( i=0, iLen=anThs.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
6406                  {
6407                      aoColumnsInit.push( null );
6408                  }
6409              }
6410              else
6411              {
6412                  aoColumnsInit = oInit.aoColumns;
6413              }
6414              
6415              /* Add the columns */
6416              for ( i=0, iLen=aoColumnsInit.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
6417              {
6418                  /* Short cut - use the loop to check if we have column visibility state to restore */
6419                  if ( oInit.saved_aoColumns !== undefined && oInit.saved_aoColumns.length == iLen )
6420                  {
6421                      if ( aoColumnsInit[i] === null )
6422                      {
6423                          aoColumnsInit[i] = {};
6424                      }
6425                      aoColumnsInit[i].bVisible = oInit.saved_aoColumns[i].bVisible;
6426                  }
6427                  
6428                  _fnAddColumn( oSettings, anThs ? anThs[i] : null );
6429              }
6430              
6431              /* Apply the column definitions */
6432              _fnApplyColumnDefs( oSettings, oInit.aoColumnDefs, aoColumnsInit, function (iCol, oDef) {
6433                  _fnColumnOptions( oSettings, iCol, oDef );
6434              } );
6435              
6436              
6437              /*
6438               * Sorting
6439               * Check the aaSorting array
6440               */
6441              for ( i=0, iLen=oSettings.aaSorting.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
6442              {
6443                  if ( oSettings.aaSorting[i][0] >= oSettings.aoColumns.length )
6444                  {
6445                      oSettings.aaSorting[i][0] = 0;
6446                  }
6447                  var oColumn = oSettings.aoColumns[ oSettings.aaSorting[i][0] ];
6448                  
6449                  /* Add a default sorting index */
6450                  if ( oSettings.aaSorting[i][2] === undefined )
6451                  {
6452                      oSettings.aaSorting[i][2] = 0;
6453                  }
6454                  
6455                  /* If aaSorting is not defined, then we use the first indicator in asSorting */
6456                  if ( oInit.aaSorting === undefined && oSettings.saved_aaSorting === undefined )
6457                  {
6458                      oSettings.aaSorting[i][1] = oColumn.asSorting[0];
6459                  }
6460                  
6461                  /* Set the current sorting index based on aoColumns.asSorting */
6462                  for ( j=0, jLen=oColumn.asSorting.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
6463                  {
6464                      if ( oSettings.aaSorting[i][1] == oColumn.asSorting[j] )
6465                      {
6466                          oSettings.aaSorting[i][2] = j;
6467                          break;
6468                      }
6469                  }
6470              }
6471                  
6472              /* Do a first pass on the sorting classes (allows any size changes to be taken into
6473               * account, and also will apply sorting disabled classes if disabled
6474               */
6475              _fnSortingClasses( oSettings );
6476              
6477              
6478              /*
6479               * Final init
6480               * Cache the header, body and footer as required, creating them if needed
6481               */
6482              var thead = $(this).children('thead');
6483              if ( thead.length === 0 )
6484              {
6485                  thead = [ document.createElement( 'thead' ) ];
6486                  this.appendChild( thead[0] );
6487              }
6488              oSettings.nTHead = thead[0];
6489              
6490              var tbody = $(this).children('tbody');
6491              if ( tbody.length === 0 )
6492              {
6493                  tbody = [ document.createElement( 'tbody' ) ];
6494                  this.appendChild( tbody[0] );
6495              }
6496              oSettings.nTBody = tbody[0];
6497              oSettings.nTBody.setAttribute( "role", "alert" );
6498              oSettings.nTBody.setAttribute( "aria-live", "polite" );
6499              oSettings.nTBody.setAttribute( "aria-relevant", "all" );
6500              
6501              var tfoot = $(this).children('tfoot');
6502              if ( tfoot.length > 0 )
6503              {
6504                  oSettings.nTFoot = tfoot[0];
6505                  _fnDetectHeader( oSettings.aoFooter, oSettings.nTFoot );
6506              }
6507              
6508              /* Check if there is data passing into the constructor */
6509              if ( bUsePassedData )
6510              {
6511                  for ( i=0 ; i<oInit.aaData.length ; i++ )
6512                  {
6513                      _fnAddData( oSettings, oInit.aaData[ i ] );
6514                  }
6515              }
6516              else
6517              {
6518                  /* Grab the data from the page */
6519                  _fnGatherData( oSettings );
6520              }
6521              
6522              /* Copy the data index array */
6523              oSettings.aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
6524              
6525              /* Initialisation complete - table can be drawn */
6526              oSettings.bInitialised = true;
6527              
6528              /* Check if we need to initialise the table (it might not have been handed off to the
6529               * language processor)
6530               */
6531              if ( bInitHandedOff === false )
6532              {
6533                  _fnInitialise( oSettings );
6534              }
6535          } );
6536      };
6537  
6538      /**
6539       * Version string for plug-ins to check compatibility. Allowed format is
6540       * a.b.c.d.e where: a:int, b:int, c:int, d:string(dev|beta), e:int. d and
6541       * e are optional
6542       *  @member
6543       *  @type string
6544       *  @default Version number
6545       */
6546      DataTable.version = "1.9.0";
6547  
6548      /**
6549       * Private data store, containing all of the settings objects that are created for the
6550       * tables on a given page.
6551       * 
6552       * Note that the <i>DataTable.settings</i> object is aliased to <i>jQuery.fn.dataTableExt</i> 
6553       * through which it may be accessed and manipulated, or <i>jQuery.fn.dataTable.settings</i>.
6554       *  @member
6555       *  @type array
6556       *  @default []
6557       *  @private
6558       */
6559      DataTable.settings = [];
6560  
6561      /**
6562       * Object models container, for the various models that DataTables has available
6563       * to it. These models define the objects that are used to hold the active state 
6564       * and configuration of the table.
6565       *  @namespace
6566       */
6567      DataTable.models = {};
6568      
6569      
6570      /**
6571       * DataTables extension options and plug-ins. This namespace acts as a collection "area"
6572       * for plug-ins that can be used to extend the default DataTables behaviour - indeed many
6573       * of the build in methods use this method to provide their own capabilities (sorting methods
6574       * for example).
6575       * 
6576       * Note that this namespace is aliased to jQuery.fn.dataTableExt so it can be readily accessed
6577       * and modified by plug-ins.
6578       *  @namespace
6579       */
6580      DataTable.models.ext = {
6581          /**
6582           * Plug-in filtering functions - this method of filtering is complimentary to the default
6583           * type based filtering, and a lot more comprehensive as it allows you complete control
6584           * over the filtering logic. Each element in this array is a function (parameters
6585           * described below) that is called for every row in the table, and your logic decides if
6586           * it should be included in the filtered data set or not.
6587           *   <ul>
6588           *     <li>
6589           *       Function input parameters:
6590           *       <ul>
6591           *         <li>{object} DataTables settings object: see {@link DataTable.models.oSettings}.</li>
6592           *         <li>{array|object} Data for the row to be processed (same as the original format
6593           *           that was passed in as the data source, or an array from a DOM data source</li>
6594           *         <li>{int} Row index in aoData ({@link DataTable.models.oSettings.aoData}), which can
6595           *           be useful to retrieve the TR element if you need DOM interaction.</li>
6596           *       </ul>
6597           *     </li>
6598           *     <li>
6599           *       Function return:
6600           *       <ul>
6601           *         <li>{boolean} Include the row in the filtered result set (true) or not (false)</li>
6602           *       </ul>
6603           *     </il>
6604           *   </ul>
6605           *  @type array
6606           *  @default []
6607           *
6608           *  @example
6609           *    // The following example shows custom filtering being applied to the fourth column (i.e.
6610           *    // the aData[3] index) based on two input values from the end-user, matching the data in 
6611           *    // a certain range.
6612           *    $.fn.dataTableExt.afnFiltering.push(
6613           *      function( oSettings, aData, iDataIndex ) {
6614           *        var iMin = document.getElementById('min').value * 1;
6615           *        var iMax = document.getElementById('max').value * 1;
6616           *        var iVersion = aData[3] == "-" ? 0 : aData[3]*1;
6617           *        if ( iMin == "" && iMax == "" ) {
6618           *          return true;
6619           *        }
6620           *        else if ( iMin == "" && iVersion < iMax ) {
6621           *          return true;
6622           *        }
6623           *        else if ( iMin < iVersion && "" == iMax ) {
6624           *          return true;
6625           *        }
6626           *        else if ( iMin < iVersion && iVersion < iMax ) {
6627           *          return true;
6628           *        }
6629           *        return false;
6630           *      }
6631           *    );
6632           */
6633          "afnFiltering": [],
6634      
6635      
6636          /**
6637           * Plug-in sorting functions - this method of sorting is complimentary to the default type
6638           * based sorting that DataTables does automatically, allowing much greater control over the
6639           * the data that is being used to sort a column. This is useful if you want to do sorting
6640           * based on live data (for example the contents of an 'input' element) rather than just the
6641           * static string that DataTables knows of. The way these plug-ins work is that you create
6642           * an array of the values you wish to be sorted for the column in question and then return
6643           * that array. Which pre-sorting function is run here depends on the sSortDataType parameter
6644           * that is used for the column (if any). This is the corollary of <i>ofnSearch</i> for sort 
6645           * data.
6646           *   <ul>
6647           *     <li>
6648           *       Function input parameters:
6649           *       <ul>
6650           *         <li>{object} DataTables settings object: see {@link DataTable.models.oSettings}.</li>
6651           *         <li>{int} Target column index</li>
6652           *       </ul>
6653           *     </li>
6654           *     <li>
6655           *       Function return:
6656           *       <ul>
6657           *         <li>{array} Data for the column to be sorted upon</li>
6658           *       </ul>
6659           *     </il>
6660           *   </ul>
6661           *  
6662           * Note that as of v1.9, it is typically preferable to use <i>mDataProp</i> to prepare data for
6663           * the different uses that DataTables can put the data to. Specifically <i>mDataProp</i> when
6664           * used as a function will give you a 'type' (sorting, filtering etc) that you can use to 
6665           * prepare the data as required for the different types. As such, this method is deprecated.
6666           *  @type array
6667           *  @default []
6668           *  @deprecated
6669           *
6670           *  @example
6671           *    // Updating the cached sorting information with user entered values in HTML input elements
6672           *    jQuery.fn.dataTableExt.afnSortData['dom-text'] = function ( oSettings, iColumn )
6673           *    {
6674           *      var aData = [];
6675           *      $( 'td:eq('+iColumn+') input', oSettings.oApi._fnGetTrNodes(oSettings) ).each( function () {
6676           *        aData.push( this.value );
6677           *      } );
6678           *      return aData;
6679           *    }
6680           */
6681          "afnSortData": [],
6682      
6683      
6684          /**
6685           * Feature plug-ins - This is an array of objects which describe the feature plug-ins that are
6686           * available to DataTables. These feature plug-ins are accessible through the sDom initialisation
6687           * option. As such, each feature plug-in must describe a function that is used to initialise
6688           * itself (fnInit), a character so the feature can be enabled by sDom (cFeature) and the name
6689           * of the feature (sFeature). Thus the objects attached to this method must provide:
6690           *   <ul>
6691           *     <li>{function} fnInit Initialisation of the plug-in
6692           *       <ul>
6693           *         <li>
6694           *           Function input parameters:
6695           *           <ul>
6696           *             <li>{object} DataTables settings object: see {@link DataTable.models.oSettings}.</li>
6697           *           </ul>
6698           *         </li>
6699           *         <li>
6700           *           Function return:
6701           *           <ul>
6702           *             <li>{node|null} The element which contains your feature. Note that the return
6703           *                may also be void if your plug-in does not require to inject any DOM elements 
6704           *                into DataTables control (sDom) - for example this might be useful when 
6705           *                developing a plug-in which allows table control via keyboard entry.</li>
6706           *           </ul>
6707           *         </il>
6708           *       </ul>
6709           *     </li>
6710           *     <li>{character} cFeature Character that will be matched in sDom - case sensitive</li>
6711           *     <li>{string} sFeature Feature name</li>
6712           *   </ul>
6713           *  @type array
6714           *  @default []
6715           * 
6716           *  @example
6717           *    // How TableTools initialises itself.
6718           *    $.fn.dataTableExt.aoFeatures.push( {
6719           *      "fnInit": function( oSettings ) {
6720           *        return new TableTools( { "oDTSettings": oSettings } );
6721           *      },
6722           *      "cFeature": "T",
6723           *      "sFeature": "TableTools"
6724           *    } );
6725           */
6726          "aoFeatures": [],
6727      
6728      
6729          /**
6730           * Type detection plug-in functions - DataTables utilises types to define how sorting and
6731           * filtering behave, and types can be either  be defined by the developer (sType for the
6732           * column) or they can be automatically detected by the methods in this array. The functions
6733           * defined in the array are quite simple, taking a single parameter (the data to analyse) 
6734           * and returning the type if it is a known type, or null otherwise.
6735           *   <ul>
6736           *     <li>
6737           *       Function input parameters:
6738           *       <ul>
6739           *         <li>{*} Data from the column cell to be analysed</li>
6740           *       </ul>
6741           *     </li>
6742           *     <li>
6743           *       Function return:
6744           *       <ul>
6745           *         <li>{string|null} Data type detected, or null if unknown (and thus pass it
6746           *           on to the other type detection functions.</li>
6747           *       </ul>
6748           *     </il>
6749           *   </ul>
6750           *  @type array
6751           *  @default []
6752           *  
6753           *  @example
6754           *    // Currency type detection plug-in:
6755           *    jQuery.fn.dataTableExt.aTypes.push(
6756           *      function ( sData ) {
6757           *        var sValidChars = "0123456789.-";
6758           *        var Char;
6759           *        
6760           *        // Check the numeric part
6761           *        for ( i=1 ; i<sData.length ; i++ ) {
6762           *          Char = sData.charAt(i); 
6763           *          if (sValidChars.indexOf(Char) == -1) {
6764           *            return null;
6765           *          }
6766           *        }
6767           *
