6768           *        // Check prefixed by currency
6769           *        if ( sData.charAt(0) == '$' || sData.charAt(0) == '&pound;' ) {
6770           *          return 'currency';
6771           *        }
6772           *        return null;
6773           *      }
6774           *    );
6775           */
6776          "aTypes": [],
6777      
6778      
6779          /**
6780           * Provide a common method for plug-ins to check the version of DataTables being used, 
6781           * in order to ensure compatibility.
6782           *  @type function
6783           *  @param {string} sVersion Version string to check for, in the format "X.Y.Z". Note 
6784           *    that the formats "X" and "X.Y" are also acceptable.
6785           *  @returns {boolean} true if this version of DataTables is greater or equal to the 
6786           *    required version, or false if this version of DataTales is not suitable
6787           *
6788           *  @example
6789           *    $(document).ready(function() {
6790           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable();
6791           *      alert( oTable.fnVersionCheck( '1.9.0' ) );
6792           *    } );
6793           */
6794          "fnVersionCheck": function( sVersion )
6795          {
6796              /* This is cheap, but very effective */
6797              var fnZPad = function (Zpad, count)
6798              {
6799                  while(Zpad.length < count) {
6800                      Zpad += '0';
6801                  }
6802                  return Zpad;
6803              };
6804              var aThis = DataTable.ext.sVersion.split('.');
6805              var aThat = sVersion.split('.');
6806              var sThis = '', sThat = '';
6807              
6808              for ( var i=0, iLen=aThat.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
6809              {
6810                  sThis += fnZPad( aThis[i], 3 );
6811                  sThat += fnZPad( aThat[i], 3 );
6812              }
6813              
6814              return parseInt(sThis, 10) >= parseInt(sThat, 10);
6815          },
6816      
6817      
6818          /**
6819           * Index for what 'this' index API functions should use
6820           *  @type int
6821           *  @default 0
6822           */
6823          "iApiIndex": 0,
6824      
6825      
6826          /**
6827           * Pre-processing of filtering data plug-ins - When you assign the sType for a column
6828           * (or have it automatically detected for you by DataTables or a type detection plug-in), 
6829           * you will typically be using this for custom sorting, but it can also be used to provide 
6830           * custom filtering by allowing you to pre-processing the data and returning the data in
6831           * the format that should be filtered upon. This is done by adding functions this object 
6832           * with a parameter name which matches the sType for that target column. This is the
6833           * corollary of <i>afnSortData</i> for filtering data.
6834           *   <ul>
6835           *     <li>
6836           *       Function input parameters:
6837           *       <ul>
6838           *         <li>{*} Data from the column cell to be prepared for filtering</li>
6839           *       </ul>
6840           *     </li>
6841           *     <li>
6842           *       Function return:
6843           *       <ul>
6844           *         <li>{string|null} Formatted string that will be used for the filtering.</li>
6845           *       </ul>
6846           *     </il>
6847           *   </ul>
6848           * 
6849           * Note that as of v1.9, it is typically preferable to use <i>mDataProp</i> to prepare data for
6850           * the different uses that DataTables can put the data to. Specifically <i>mDataProp</i> when
6851           * used as a function will give you a 'type' (sorting, filtering etc) that you can use to 
6852           * prepare the data as required for the different types. As such, this method is deprecated.
6853           *  @type object
6854           *  @default {}
6855           *  @deprecated
6856           *
6857           *  @example
6858           *    $.fn.dataTableExt.ofnSearch['title-numeric'] = function ( sData ) {
6859           *      return sData.replace(/\n/g," ").replace( /<.*?>/g, "" );
6860           *    }
6861           */
6862          "ofnSearch": {},
6863      
6864      
6865          /**
6866           * Container for all private functions in DataTables so they can be exposed externally
6867           *  @type object
6868           *  @default {}
6869           */
6870          "oApi": {},
6871      
6872      
6873          /**
6874           * Storage for the various classes that DataTables uses
6875           *  @type object
6876           *  @default {}
6877           */
6878          "oStdClasses": {},
6879          
6880      
6881          /**
6882           * Storage for the various classes that DataTables uses - jQuery UI suitable
6883           *  @type object
6884           *  @default {}
6885           */
6886          "oJUIClasses": {},
6887      
6888      
6889          /**
6890           * Pagination plug-in methods - The style and controls of the pagination can significantly 
6891           * impact on how the end user interacts with the data in your table, and DataTables allows 
6892           * the addition of pagination controls by extending this object, which can then be enabled
6893           * through the <i>sPaginationType</i> initialisation parameter. Each pagination type that
6894           * is added is an object (the property name of which is what <i>sPaginationType</i> refers
6895           * to) that has two properties, both methods that are used by DataTables to update the
6896           * control's state.
6897           *   <ul>
6898           *     <li>
6899           *       fnInit -  Initialisation of the paging controls. Called only during initialisation 
6900           *         of the table. It is expected that this function will add the required DOM elements 
6901           *         to the page for the paging controls to work. The element pointer 
6902           *         'oSettings.aanFeatures.p' array is provided by DataTables to contain the paging 
6903           *         controls (note that this is a 2D array to allow for multiple instances of each 
6904           *         DataTables DOM element). It is suggested that you add the controls to this element 
6905           *         as children
6906           *       <ul>
6907           *         <li>
6908           *           Function input parameters:
6909           *           <ul>
6910           *             <li>{object} DataTables settings object: see {@link DataTable.models.oSettings}.</li>
6911           *             <li>{node} Container into which the pagination controls must be inserted</li>
6912           *             <li>{function} Draw callback function - whenever the controls cause a page
6913           *               change, this method must be called to redraw the table.</li>
6914           *           </ul>
6915           *         </li>
6916           *         <li>
6917           *           Function return:
6918           *           <ul>
6919           *             <li>No return required</li>
6920           *           </ul>
6921           *         </il>
6922           *       </ul>
6923           *     </il>
6924           *     <li>
6925           *       fnInit -  This function is called whenever the paging status of the table changes and is
6926           *         typically used to update classes and/or text of the paging controls to reflex the new 
6927           *         status.
6928           *       <ul>
6929           *         <li>
6930           *           Function input parameters:
6931           *           <ul>
6932           *             <li>{object} DataTables settings object: see {@link DataTable.models.oSettings}.</li>
6933           *             <li>{function} Draw callback function - in case you need to redraw the table again
6934           *               or attach new event listeners</li>
6935           *           </ul>
6936           *         </li>
6937           *         <li>
6938           *           Function return:
6939           *           <ul>
6940           *             <li>No return required</li>
6941           *           </ul>
6942           *         </il>
6943           *       </ul>
6944           *     </il>
6945           *   </ul>
6946           *  @type object
6947           *  @default {}
6948           *
6949           *  @example
6950           *    $.fn.dataTableExt.oPagination.four_button = {
6951           *      "fnInit": function ( oSettings, nPaging, fnCallbackDraw ) {
6952           *        nFirst = document.createElement( 'span' );
6953           *        nPrevious = document.createElement( 'span' );
6954           *        nNext = document.createElement( 'span' );
6955           *        nLast = document.createElement( 'span' );
6956           *        
6957           *        nFirst.appendChild( document.createTextNode( oSettings.oLanguage.oPaginate.sFirst ) );
6958           *        nPrevious.appendChild( document.createTextNode( oSettings.oLanguage.oPaginate.sPrevious ) );
6959           *        nNext.appendChild( document.createTextNode( oSettings.oLanguage.oPaginate.sNext ) );
6960           *        nLast.appendChild( document.createTextNode( oSettings.oLanguage.oPaginate.sLast ) );
6961           *        
6962           *        nFirst.className = "paginate_button first";
6963           *        nPrevious.className = "paginate_button previous";
6964           *        nNext.className="paginate_button next";
6965           *        nLast.className = "paginate_button last";
6966           *        
6967           *        nPaging.appendChild( nFirst );
6968           *        nPaging.appendChild( nPrevious );
6969           *        nPaging.appendChild( nNext );
6970           *        nPaging.appendChild( nLast );
6971           *        
6972           *        $(nFirst).click( function () {
6973           *          oSettings.oApi._fnPageChange( oSettings, "first" );
6974           *          fnCallbackDraw( oSettings );
6975           *        } );
6976           *        
6977           *        $(nPrevious).click( function() {
6978           *          oSettings.oApi._fnPageChange( oSettings, "previous" );
6979           *          fnCallbackDraw( oSettings );
6980           *        } );
6981           *        
6982           *        $(nNext).click( function() {
6983           *          oSettings.oApi._fnPageChange( oSettings, "next" );
6984           *          fnCallbackDraw( oSettings );
6985           *        } );
6986           *        
6987           *        $(nLast).click( function() {
6988           *          oSettings.oApi._fnPageChange( oSettings, "last" );
6989           *          fnCallbackDraw( oSettings );
6990           *        } );
6991           *        
6992           *        $(nFirst).bind( 'selectstart', function () { return false; } );
6993           *        $(nPrevious).bind( 'selectstart', function () { return false; } );
6994           *        $(nNext).bind( 'selectstart', function () { return false; } );
6995           *        $(nLast).bind( 'selectstart', function () { return false; } );
6996           *      },
6997           *      
6998           *      "fnUpdate": function ( oSettings, fnCallbackDraw ) {
6999           *        if ( !oSettings.aanFeatures.p ) {
7000           *          return;
7001           *        }
7002           *        
7003           *        // Loop over each instance of the pager
7004           *        var an = oSettings.aanFeatures.p;
7005           *        for ( var i=0, iLen=an.length ; i<iLen ; i++ ) {
7006           *          var buttons = an[i].getElementsByTagName('span');
7007           *          if ( oSettings._iDisplayStart === 0 ) {
7008           *            buttons[0].className = "paginate_disabled_previous";
7009           *            buttons[1].className = "paginate_disabled_previous";
7010           *          }
7011           *          else {
7012           *            buttons[0].className = "paginate_enabled_previous";
7013           *            buttons[1].className = "paginate_enabled_previous";
7014           *          }
7015           *          
7016           *          if ( oSettings.fnDisplayEnd() == oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() ) {
7017           *            buttons[2].className = "paginate_disabled_next";
7018           *            buttons[3].className = "paginate_disabled_next";
7019           *          }
7020           *          else {
7021           *            buttons[2].className = "paginate_enabled_next";
7022           *            buttons[3].className = "paginate_enabled_next";
7023           *          }
7024           *        }
7025           *      }
7026           *    };
7027           */
7028          "oPagination": {},
7029      
7030      
7031          /**
7032           * Sorting plug-in methods - Sorting in DataTables is based on the detected type of the
7033           * data column (you can add your own type detection functions, or override automatic 
7034           * detection using sType). With this specific type given to the column, DataTables will 
7035           * apply the required sort from the functions in the object. Each sort type must provide
7036           * two mandatory methods, one each for ascending and descending sorting, and can optionally
7037           * provide a pre-formatting method that will help speed up sorting by allowing DataTables
7038           * to pre-format the sort data only once (rather than every time the actual sort functions
7039           * are run). The two sorting functions are typical Javascript sort methods:
7040           *   <ul>
7041           *     <li>
7042           *       Function input parameters:
7043           *       <ul>
7044           *         <li>{*} Data to compare to the second parameter</li>
7045           *         <li>{*} Data to compare to the first parameter</li>
7046           *       </ul>
7047           *     </li>
7048           *     <li>
7049           *       Function return:
7050           *       <ul>
7051           *         <li>{int} Sorting match: <0 if first parameter should be sorted lower than
7052           *           the second parameter, ===0 if the two parameters are equal and >0 if
7053           *           the first parameter should be sorted height than the second parameter.</li>
7054           *       </ul>
7055           *     </il>
7056           *   </ul>
7057           *  @type object
7058           *  @default {}
7059           *
7060           *  @example
7061           *    // Case-sensitive string sorting, with no pre-formatting method
7062           *    $.extend( $.fn.dataTableExt.oSort, {
7063           *      "string-case-asc": function(x,y) {
7064           *        return ((x < y) ? -1 : ((x > y) ? 1 : 0));
7065           *      },
7066           *      "string-case-desc": function(x,y) {
7067           *        return ((x < y) ? 1 : ((x > y) ? -1 : 0));
7068           *      }
7069           *    } );
7070           *
7071           *  @example
7072           *    // Case-insensitive string sorting, with pre-formatting
7073           *    $.extend( $.fn.dataTableExt.oSort, {
7074           *      "string-pre": function(x) {
7075           *        return x.toLowerCase();
7076           *      },
7077           *      "string-asc": function(x,y) {
7078           *        return ((x < y) ? -1 : ((x > y) ? 1 : 0));
7079           *      },
7080           *      "string-desc": function(x,y) {
7081           *        return ((x < y) ? 1 : ((x > y) ? -1 : 0));
7082           *      }
7083           *    } );
7084           */
7085          "oSort": {},
7086      
7087      
7088          /**
7089           * Version string for plug-ins to check compatibility. Allowed format is
7090           * a.b.c.d.e where: a:int, b:int, c:int, d:string(dev|beta), e:int. d and
7091           * e are optional
7092           *  @type string
7093           *  @default Version number
7094           */
7095          "sVersion": DataTable.version,
7096      
7097      
7098          /**
7099           * How should DataTables report an error. Can take the value 'alert' or 'throw'
7100           *  @type string
7101           *  @default alert
7102           */
7103          "sErrMode": "alert",
7104      
7105      
7106          /**
7107           * Store information for DataTables to access globally about other instances
7108           *  @namespace
7109           *  @private
7110           */
7111          "_oExternConfig": {
7112              /* int:iNextUnique - next unique number for an instance */
7113              "iNextUnique": 0
7114          }
7115      };
7116      
7117      
7118      
7119      
7120      /**
7121       * Template object for the way in which DataTables holds information about
7122       * search information for the global filter and individual column filters.
7123       *  @namespace
7124       */
7125      DataTable.models.oSearch = {
7126          /**
7127           * Flag to indicate if the filtering should be case insensitive or not
7128           *  @type boolean
7129           *  @default true
7130           */
7131          "bCaseInsensitive": true,
7132      
7133          /**
7134           * Applied search term
7135           *  @type string
7136           *  @default <i>Empty string</i>
7137           */
7138          "sSearch": "",
7139      
7140          /**
7141           * Flag to indicate if the search term should be interpreted as a
7142           * regular expression (true) or not (false) and therefore and special
7143           * regex characters escaped.
7144           *  @type boolean
7145           *  @default false
7146           */
7147          "bRegex": false,
7148      
7149          /**
7150           * Flag to indicate if DataTables is to use its smart filtering or not.
7151           *  @type boolean
7152           *  @default true
7153           */
7154          "bSmart": true
7155      };
7156      
7157      
7158      
7159      
7160      /**
7161       * Template object for the way in which DataTables holds information about
7162       * each individual row. This is the object format used for the settings 
7163       * aoData array.
7164       *  @namespace
7165       */
7166      DataTable.models.oRow = {
7167          /**
7168           * TR element for the row
7169           *  @type node
7170           *  @default null
7171           */
7172          "nTr": null,
7173      
7174          /**
7175           * Data object from the original data source for the row. This is either
7176           * an array if using the traditional form of DataTables, or an object if
7177           * using mDataProp options. The exact type will depend on the passed in
7178           * data from the data source, or will be an array if using DOM a data 
7179           * source.
7180           *  @type array|object
7181           *  @default []
7182           */
7183          "_aData": [],
7184      
7185          /**
7186           * Sorting data cache - this array is ostensibly the same length as the
7187           * number of columns (although each index is generated only as it is 
7188           * needed), and holds the data that is used for sorting each column in the
7189           * row. We do this cache generation at the start of the sort in order that
7190           * the formatting of the sort data need be done only once for each cell
7191           * per sort. This array should not be read from or written to by anything
7192           * other than the master sorting methods.
7193           *  @type array
7194           *  @default []
7195           *  @private
7196           */
7197          "_aSortData": [],
7198      
7199          /**
7200           * Array of TD elements that are cached for hidden rows, so they can be
7201           * reinserted into the table if a column is made visible again (or to act
7202           * as a store if a column is made hidden). Only hidden columns have a 
7203           * reference in the array. For non-hidden columns the value is either
7204           * undefined or null.
7205           *  @type array nodes
7206           *  @default []
7207           *  @private
7208           */
7209          "_anHidden": [],
7210      
7211          /**
7212           * Cache of the class name that DataTables has applied to the row, so we
7213           * can quickly look at this variable rather than needing to do a DOM check
7214           * on className for the nTr property.
7215           *  @type string
7216           *  @default <i>Empty string</i>
7217           *  @private
7218           */
7219          "_sRowStripe": ""
7220      };
7221      
7222      
7223      
7224      /**
7225       * Template object for the column information object in DataTables. This object
7226       * is held in the settings aoColumns array and contains all the information that
7227       * DataTables needs about each individual column.
7228       * 
7229       * Note that this object is related to {@link DataTable.defaults.columns} 
7230       * but this one is the internal data store for DataTables's cache of columns.
7231       * It should NOT be manipulated outside of DataTables. Any configuration should
7232       * be done through the initialisation options.
7233       *  @namespace
7234       */
7235      DataTable.models.oColumn = {
7236          /**
7237           * A list of the columns that sorting should occur on when this column
7238           * is sorted. That this property is an array allows multi-column sorting
7239           * to be defined for a column (for example first name / last name columns
7240           * would benefit from this). The values are integers pointing to the
7241           * columns to be sorted on (typically it will be a single integer pointing
7242           * at itself, but that doesn't need to be the case).
7243           *  @type array
7244           */
7245          "aDataSort": null,
7246      
7247          /**
7248           * Define the sorting directions that are applied to the column, in sequence
7249           * as the column is repeatedly sorted upon - i.e. the first value is used
7250           * as the sorting direction when the column if first sorted (clicked on).
7251           * Sort it again (click again) and it will move on to the next index.
7252           * Repeat until loop.
7253           *  @type array
7254           */
7255          "asSorting": null,
7256          
7257          /**
7258           * Flag to indicate if the column is searchable, and thus should be included
7259           * in the filtering or not.
7260           *  @type boolean
7261           */
7262          "bSearchable": null,
7263          
7264          /**
7265           * Flag to indicate if the column is sortable or not.
7266           *  @type boolean
7267           */
7268          "bSortable": null,
7269          
7270          /**
7271           * When using fnRender, you have two options for what to do with the data,
7272           * and this property serves as the switch. Firstly, you can have the sorting
7273           * and filtering use the rendered value (true - default), or you can have
7274           * the sorting and filtering us the original value (false).
7275           * 
7276           * *NOTE* It is it is advisable now to use mDataProp as a function and make 
7277           * use of the 'type' that it gives, allowing (potentially) different data to
7278           * be used for sorting, filtering, display and type detection.
7279           *  @type boolean
7280           *  @deprecated
7281           */
7282          "bUseRendered": null,
7283          
7284          /**
7285           * Flag to indicate if the column is currently visible in the table or not
7286           *  @type boolean
7287           */
7288          "bVisible": null,
7289          
7290          /**
7291           * Flag to indicate to the type detection method if the automatic type
7292           * detection should be used, or if a column type (sType) has been specified
7293           *  @type boolean
7294           *  @default true
7295           *  @private
7296           */
7297          "_bAutoType": true,
7298          
7299          /**
7300           * Developer definable function that is called whenever a cell is created (Ajax source,
7301           * etc) or processed for input (DOM source). This can be used as a compliment to fnRender
7302           * allowing you to modify the DOM element (add background colour for example) when the
7303           * element is available (since it is not when fnRender is called).
7304           *  @type function
7305           *  @param {element} nTd The TD node that has been created
7306           *  @param {*} sData The Data for the cell
7307           *  @param {array|object} oData The data for the whole row
7308           *  @param {int} iRow The row index for the aoData data store
7309           *  @default null
7310           */
7311          "fnCreatedCell": null,
7312          
7313          /**
7314           * Function to get data from a cell in a column. You should <b>never</b>
7315           * access data directly through _aData internally in DataTables - always use
7316           * the method attached to this property. It allows mDataProp to function as
7317           * required. This function is automatically assigned by the column 
7318           * initialisation method
7319           *  @type function
7320           *  @param {array|object} oData The data array/object for the array 
7321           *    (i.e. aoData[]._aData)
7322           *  @param {string} sSpecific The specific data type you want to get - 
7323           *    'display', 'type' 'filter' 'sort'
7324           *  @returns {*} The data for the cell from the given row's data
7325           *  @default null
7326           */
7327          "fnGetData": null,
7328          
7329          /**
7330           * Custom display function that will be called for the display of each cell 
7331           * in this column.
7332           *  @type function
7333           *  @param {object} o Object with the following parameters:
7334           *  @param {int}    o.iDataRow The row in aoData
7335           *  @param {int}    o.iDataColumn The column in question
7336           *  @param {array   o.aData The data for the row in question
7337           *  @param {object} o.oSettings The settings object for this DataTables instance
7338           *  @returns {string} The string you which to use in the display
7339           *  @default null
7340           */
7341          "fnRender": null,
7342          
7343          /**
7344           * Function to set data for a cell in the column. You should <b>never</b> 
7345           * set the data directly to _aData internally in DataTables - always use
7346           * this method. It allows mDataProp to function as required. This function
7347           * is automatically assigned by the column initialisation method
7348           *  @type function
7349           *  @param {array|object} oData The data array/object for the array 
7350           *    (i.e. aoData[]._aData)
7351           *  @param {*} sValue Value to set
7352           *  @default null
7353           */
7354          "fnSetData": null,
7355          
7356          /**
7357           * Property to read the value for the cells in the column from the data 
7358           * source array / object. If null, then the default content is used, if a
7359           * function is given then the return from the function is used.
7360           *  @type function|int|string|null
7361           *  @default null
7362           */
7363          "mDataProp": null,
7364          
7365          /**
7366           * Unique header TH/TD element for this column - this is what the sorting
7367           * listener is attached to (if sorting is enabled.)
7368           *  @type node
7369           *  @default null
7370           */
7371          "nTh": null,
7372          
7373          /**
7374           * Unique footer TH/TD element for this column (if there is one). Not used 
7375           * in DataTables as such, but can be used for plug-ins to reference the 
7376           * footer for each column.
7377           *  @type node
7378           *  @default null
7379           */
7380          "nTf": null,
7381          
7382          /**
7383           * The class to apply to all TD elements in the table's TBODY for the column
7384           *  @type string
7385           *  @default null
7386           */
7387          "sClass": null,
7388          
7389          /**
7390           * When DataTables calculates the column widths to assign to each column,
7391           * it finds the longest string in each column and then constructs a
7392           * temporary table and reads the widths from that. The problem with this
7393           * is that "mmm" is much wider then "iiii", but the latter is a longer 
7394           * string - thus the calculation can go wrong (doing it properly and putting
7395           * it into an DOM object and measuring that is horribly(!) slow). Thus as
7396           * a "work around" we provide this option. It will append its value to the
7397           * text that is found to be the longest string for the column - i.e. padding.
7398           *  @type string
7399           */
7400          "sContentPadding": null,
7401          
7402          /**
7403           * Allows a default value to be given for a column's data, and will be used
7404           * whenever a null data source is encountered (this can be because mDataProp
7405           * is set to null, or because the data source itself is null).
7406           *  @type string
7407           *  @default null
7408           */
7409          "sDefaultContent": null,
7410          
7411          /**
7412           * Name for the column, allowing reference to the column by name as well as
7413           * by index (needs a lookup to work by name).
7414           *  @type string
7415           */
7416          "sName": null,
7417          
7418          /**
7419           * Custom sorting data type - defines which of the available plug-ins in
7420           * afnSortData the custom sorting will use - if any is defined.
7421           *  @type string
7422           *  @default std
7423           */
7424          "sSortDataType": 'std',
7425          
7426          /**
7427           * Class to be applied to the header element when sorting on this column
7428           *  @type string
7429           *  @default null
7430           */
7431          "sSortingClass": null,
7432          
7433          /**
7434           * Class to be applied to the header element when sorting on this column -
7435           * when jQuery UI theming is used.
7436           *  @type string
7437           *  @default null
7438           */
7439          "sSortingClassJUI": null,
7440          
7441          /**
7442           * Title of the column - what is seen in the TH element (nTh).
7443           *  @type string
7444           */
7445          "sTitle": null,
7446          
7447          /**
7448           * Column sorting and filtering type
7449           *  @type string
7450           *  @default null
7451           */
7452          "sType": null,
7453          
7454          /**
7455           * Width of the column
7456           *  @type string
7457           *  @default null
7458           */
7459          "sWidth": null,
7460          
7461          /**
7462           * Width of the column when it was first "encountered"
7463           *  @type string
7464           *  @default null
7465           */
7466          "sWidthOrig": null
7467      };
7468      
7469      
7470      
7471      /**
7472       * Initialisation options that can be given to DataTables at initialisation 
7473       * time.
7474       *  @namespace
7475       */
7476      DataTable.defaults = {
7477          /**
7478           * An array of data to use for the table, passed in at initialisation which 
7479           * will be used in preference to any data which is already in the DOM. This is
7480           * particularly useful for constructing tables purely in Javascript, for
7481           * example with a custom Ajax call.
7482           *  @type array
7483           *  @default null
7484           *  @dtopt Option
7485           * 
7486           *  @example
7487           *    // Using a 2D array data source
7488           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7489           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7490           *        "aaData": [
7491           *          ['Trident', 'Internet Explorer 4.0', 'Win 95+', 4, 'X'],
7492           *          ['Trident', 'Internet Explorer 5.0', 'Win 95+', 5, 'C'],
7493           *        ],
7494           *        "aoColumns": [
7495           *          { "sTitle": "Engine" },
7496           *          { "sTitle": "Browser" },
7497           *          { "sTitle": "Platform" },
7498           *          { "sTitle": "Version" },
7499           *          { "sTitle": "Grade" }
7500           *        ]
7501           *      } );
7502           *    } );
7503           *    
7504           *  @example
7505           *    // Using an array of objects as a data source (mDataProp)
7506           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7507           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7508           *        "aaData": [
7509           *          {
7510           *            "engine":   "Trident",
7511           *            "browser":  "Internet Explorer 4.0",
7512           *            "platform": "Win 95+",
7513           *            "version":  4,
7514           *            "grade":    "X"
7515           *          },
7516           *          {
7517           *            "engine":   "Trident",
7518           *            "browser":  "Internet Explorer 5.0",
7519           *            "platform": "Win 95+",
7520           *            "version":  5,
7521           *            "grade":    "C"
7522           *          }
7523           *        ],
7524           *        "aoColumns": [
7525           *          { "sTitle": "Engine",   "mDataProp": "engine" },
7526           *          { "sTitle": "Browser",  "mDataProp": "browser" },
7527           *          { "sTitle": "Platform", "mDataProp": "platform" },
7528           *          { "sTitle": "Version",  "mDataProp": "version" },
7529           *          { "sTitle": "Grade",    "mDataProp": "grade" }
7530           *        ]
7531           *      } );
7532           *    } );
7533           */
7534          "aaData": null,
7535      
7536      
7537          /**
7538           * If sorting is enabled, then DataTables will perform a first pass sort on 
7539           * initialisation. You can define which column(s) the sort is performed upon, 
7540           * and the sorting direction, with this variable. The aaSorting array should 
7541           * contain an array for each column to be sorted initially containing the 
7542           * column's index and a direction string ('asc' or 'desc').
7543           *  @type array
7544           *  @default [[0,'asc']]
7545           *  @dtopt Option
7546           * 
7547           *  @example
7548           *    // Sort by 3rd column first, and then 4th column
7549           *    $(document).ready( function() {
7550           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7551           *        "aaSorting": [[2,'asc'], [3,'desc']]
7552           *      } );
7553           *    } );
7554           *    
7555           *    // No initial sorting
7556           *    $(document).ready( function() {
7557           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7558           *        "aaSorting": []
7559           *      } );
7560           *    } );
7561           */
7562          "aaSorting": [[0,'asc']],
7563      
7564      
7565          /**
7566           * This parameter is basically identical to the aaSorting parameter, but 
7567           * cannot be overridden by user interaction with the table. What this means 
7568           * is that you could have a column (visible or hidden) which the sorting will 
7569           * always be forced on first - any sorting after that (from the user) will 
7570           * then be performed as required. This can be useful for grouping rows 
7571           * together.
7572           *  @type array
7573           *  @default null
7574           *  @dtopt Option
7575           * 
7576           *  @example
7577           *    $(document).ready( function() {
7578           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7579           *        "aaSortingFixed": [[0,'asc']]
7580           *      } );
7581           *    } )
7582           */
7583          "aaSortingFixed": null,
7584      
7585      
7586          /**
7587           * This parameter allows you to readily specify the entries in the length drop
7588           * down menu that DataTables shows when pagination is enabled. It can be 
7589           * either a 1D array of options which will be used for both the displayed 
7590           * option and the value, or a 2D array which will use the array in the first 
7591           * position as the value, and the array in the second position as the 
7592           * displayed options (useful for language strings such as 'All').
7593           *  @type array
7594           *  @default [ 10, 25, 50, 100 ]
7595           *  @dtopt Option
7596           * 
7597           *  @example
7598           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7599           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7600           *        "aLengthMenu": [[10, 25, 50, -1], [10, 25, 50, "All"]]
7601           *      } );
7602           *    } );
7603           *  
7604           *  @example
7605           *    // Setting the default display length as well as length menu
7606           *    // This is likely to be wanted if you remove the '10' option which
7607           *    // is the iDisplayLength default.
7608           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7609           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7610           *        "iDisplayLength": 25,
7611           *        "aLengthMenu": [[25, 50, 100, -1], [25, 50, 100, "All"]]
7612           *      } );
7613           *    } );
7614           */
7615          "aLengthMenu": [ 10, 25, 50, 100 ],
7616      
7617      
7618          /**
7619           * The aoColumns option in the initialisation parameter allows you to define
7620           * details about the way individual columns behave. For a full list of
7621           * column options that can be set, please see 
7622           * {@link DataTable.defaults.columns}. Note that if you use aoColumns to
7623           * define your columns, you must have an entry in the array for every single
7624           * column that you have in your table (these can be null if you don't which
7625           * to specify any options).
7626           *  @member
7627           */
7628          "aoColumns": null,
7629      
7630          /**
7631           * Very similar to aoColumns, aoColumnDefs allows you to target a specific 
7632           * column, multiple columns, or all columns, using the aTargets property of 
7633           * each object in the array. This allows great flexibility when creating 
7634           * tables, as the aoColumnDefs arrays can be of any length, targeting the 
7635           * columns you specifically want. aoColumnDefs may use any of the column 
7636           * options available: {@link DataTable.defaults.columns}, but it _must_
7637           * have aTargets defined in each object in the array. Values in the aTargets
7638           * array may be:
7639           *   <ul>
7640           *     <li>a string - class name will be matched on the TH for the column</li>
7641           *     <li>0 or a positive integer - column index counting from the left</li>
7642           *     <li>a negative integer - column index counting from the right</li>
7643           *     <li>the string "_all" - all columns (i.e. assign a default)</li>
7644           *   </ul>
7645           *  @member
7646           */
7647          "aoColumnDefs": null,
7648      
7649      
7650          /**
7651           * Basically the same as oSearch, this parameter defines the individual column
7652           * filtering state at initialisation time. The array must be of the same size 
7653           * as the number of columns, and each element be an object with the parameters
7654           * "sSearch" and "bEscapeRegex" (the latter is optional). 'null' is also
7655           * accepted and the default will be used.
7656           *  @type array
7657           *  @default []
7658           *  @dtopt Option
7659           * 
7660           *  @example
7661           *    $(document).ready( function() {
7662           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7663           *        "aoSearchCols": [
7664           *          null,
7665           *          { "sSearch": "My filter" },
7666           *          null,
7667           *          { "sSearch": "^[0-9]", "bEscapeRegex": false }
7668           *        ]
7669           *      } );
7670           *    } )
7671           */
7672          "aoSearchCols": [],
7673      
7674      
7675          /**
7676           * An array of CSS classes that should be applied to displayed rows. This 
7677           * array may be of any length, and DataTables will apply each class 
7678           * sequentially, looping when required.
7679           *  @type array
7680           *  @default [ 'odd', 'even' ]
7681           *  @dtopt Option
7682           * 
7683           *  @example
7684           *    $(document).ready( function() {
7685           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7686           *        "asStripeClasses": [ 'strip1', 'strip2', 'strip3' ]
7687           *      } );
7688           *    } )
7689           */
7690          "asStripeClasses": [ 'odd', 'even' ],
7691      
7692      
7693          /**
7694           * Enable or disable automatic column width calculation. This can be disabled
7695           * as an optimisation (it takes some time to calculate the widths) if the
7696           * tables widths are passed in using aoColumns.
7697           *  @type boolean
7698           *  @default true
7699           *  @dtopt Features
7700           * 
7701           *  @example
7702           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7703           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7704           *        "bAutoWidth": false
7705           *      } );
7706           *    } );
7707           */
7708          "bAutoWidth": true,
7709      
7710      
7711          /**
7712           * Deferred rendering can provide DataTables with a huge speed boost when you
7713           * are using an Ajax or JS data source for the table. This option, when set to
7714           * true, will cause DataTables to defer the creation of the table elements for
7715           * each row until they are needed for a draw - saving a significant amount of
7716           * time.
7717           *  @type boolean
7718           *  @default false
7719           *  @dtopt Features
7720           * 
7721           *  @example
7722           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7723           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable( {
7724           *        "sAjaxSource": "sources/arrays.txt",
7725           *        "bDeferRender": true
7726           *      } );
7727           *    } );
7728           */
7729          "bDeferRender": false,
7730      
7731      
7732          /**
7733           * Replace a DataTable which matches the given selector and replace it with 
7734           * one which has the properties of the new initialisation object passed. If no
7735           * table matches the selector, then the new DataTable will be constructed as
7736           * per normal.
7737           *  @type boolean
7738           *  @default false
7739           *  @dtopt Options
7740           * 
7741           *  @example
7742           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7743           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7744           *        "sScrollY": "200px",
7745           *        "bPaginate": false
7746           *      } );
7747           *      
7748           *      // Some time later....
7749           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7750           *        "bFilter": false,
7751           *        "bDestroy": true
7752           *      } );
7753           *    } );
7754           */
7755          "bDestroy": false,
7756      
7757      
7758          /**
7759           * Enable or disable filtering of data. Filtering in DataTables is "smart" in
7760           * that it allows the end user to input multiple words (space separated) and
7761           * will match a row containing those words, even if not in the order that was
7762           * specified (this allow matching across multiple columns). Note that if you
7763           * wish to use filtering in DataTables this must remain 'true' - to remove the
7764           * default filtering input box and retain filtering abilities, please use
7765           * @ref{sDom}.
7766           *  @type boolean
7767           *  @default true
7768           *  @dtopt Features
7769           * 
7770           *  @example
7771           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7772           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7773           *        "bFilter": false
7774           *      } );
7775           *    } );
7776           */
7777          "bFilter": true,
7778      
7779      
7780          /**
7781           * Enable or disable the table information display. This shows information 
7782           * about the data that is currently visible on the page, including information
7783           * about filtered data if that action is being performed.
7784           *  @type boolean
7785           *  @default true
7786           *  @dtopt Features
7787           * 
7788           *  @example
7789           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7790           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7791           *        "bInfo": false
7792           *      } );
7793           *    } );
7794           */
7795          "bInfo": true,
7796      
7797      
7798          /**
7799           * Enable jQuery UI ThemeRoller support (required as ThemeRoller requires some
7800           * slightly different and additional mark-up from what DataTables has
7801           * traditionally used).
7802           *  @type boolean
7803           *  @default false
7804           *  @dtopt Features
7805           * 
7806           *  @example
7807           *    $(document).ready( function() {
7808           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7809           *        "bJQueryUI": true
7810           *      } );
7811           *    } );
7812           */
7813          "bJQueryUI": false,
7814      
7815      
7816          /**
7817           * Allows the end user to select the size of a formatted page from a select
7818           * menu (sizes are 10, 25, 50 and 100). Requires pagination (bPaginate).
7819           *  @type boolean
7820           *  @default true
7821           *  @dtopt Features
7822           * 
7823           *  @example
7824           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7825           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7826           *        "bLengthChange": false
7827           *      } );
7828           *    } );
7829           */
7830          "bLengthChange": true,
7831      
7832      
7833          /**
7834           * Enable or disable pagination.
7835           *  @type boolean
7836           *  @default true
7837           *  @dtopt Features
7838           * 
7839           *  @example
7840           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7841           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7842           *        "bPaginate": false
7843           *      } );
7844           *    } );
7845           */
7846          "bPaginate": true,
7847      
7848      
7849          /**
7850           * Enable or disable the display of a 'processing' indicator when the table is
7851           * being processed (e.g. a sort). This is particularly useful for tables with
7852           * large amounts of data where it can take a noticeable amount of time to sort
7853           * the entries.
7854           *  @type boolean
7855           *  @default false
7856           *  @dtopt Features
7857           * 
7858           *  @example
7859           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7860           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7861           *        "bProcessing": true
7862           *      } );
7863           *    } );
7864           */
7865          "bProcessing": false,
7866      
7867      
7868          /**
7869           * Retrieve the DataTables object for the given selector. Note that if the
7870           * table has already been initialised, this parameter will cause DataTables
7871           * to simply return the object that has already been set up - it will not take
7872           * account of any changes you might have made to the initialisation object
7873           * passed to DataTables (setting this parameter to true is an acknowledgement
7874           * that you understand this). bDestroy can be used to reinitialise a table if
7875           * you need.
7876           *  @type boolean
7877           *  @default false
7878           *  @dtopt Options
7879           * 
7880           *  @example
7881           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7882           *      initTable();
7883           *      tableActions();
7884           *    } );
7885           *    
7886           *    function initTable ()
7887           *    {
7888           *      return $('#example').dataTable( {
7889           *        "sScrollY": "200px",
7890           *        "bPaginate": false,
7891           *        "bRetrieve": true
7892           *      } );
7893           *    }
7894           *    
7895           *    function tableActions ()
7896           *    {
7897           *      var oTable = initTable();
7898           *      // perform API operations with oTable 
7899           *    }
7900           */
7901          "bRetrieve": false,
7902      
7903      
7904          /**
7905           * Indicate if DataTables should be allowed to set the padding / margin
7906           * etc for the scrolling header elements or not. Typically you will want
7907           * this.
7908           *  @type boolean
7909           *  @default true
7910           *  @dtopt Options
7911           * 
7912           *  @example
7913           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7914           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7915           *        "bScrollAutoCss": false,
7916           *        "sScrollY": "200px"
7917           *      } );
7918           *    } );
7919           */
7920          "bScrollAutoCss": true,
7921      
7922      
7923          /**
7924           * When vertical (y) scrolling is enabled, DataTables will force the height of
7925           * the table's viewport to the given height at all times (useful for layout).
7926           * However, this can look odd when filtering data down to a small data set,
7927           * and the footer is left "floating" further down. This parameter (when
7928           * enabled) will cause DataTables to collapse the table's viewport down when
7929           * the result set will fit within the given Y height.
7930           *  @type boolean
7931           *  @default false
7932           *  @dtopt Options
7933           * 
7934           *  @example
7935           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7936           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7937           *        "sScrollY": "200",
7938           *        "bScrollCollapse": true
7939           *      } );
7940           *    } );
7941           */
7942          "bScrollCollapse": false,
7943      
7944      
7945          /**
7946           * Enable infinite scrolling for DataTables (to be used in combination with
7947           * sScrollY). Infinite scrolling means that DataTables will continually load
7948           * data as a user scrolls through a table, which is very useful for large
7949           * dataset. This cannot be used with pagination, which is automatically
7950           * disabled. Note - the Scroller extra for DataTables is recommended in
7951           * in preference to this option.
7952           *  @type boolean
7953           *  @default false
7954           *  @dtopt Features
7955           * 
7956           *  @example
7957           *    $(document).ready(function() {
7958           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7959           *        "bScrollInfinite": true,
7960           *        "bScrollCollapse": true,
7961           *        "sScrollY": "200px"
7962           *      } );
7963           *    } );
7964           */
7965          "bScrollInfinite": false,
7966      
7967      
7968          /**
7969           * Configure DataTables to use server-side processing. Note that the
7970           * sAjaxSource parameter must also be given in order to give DataTables a
7971           * source to obtain the required data for each draw.
7972           *  @type boolean
7973           *  @default false
7974           *  @dtopt Features
7975           *  @dtopt Server-side
7976           * 
7977           *  @example
7978           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7979           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7980           *        "bServerSide": true,
7981           *        "sAjaxSource": "xhr.php"
7982           *      } );
7983           *    } );
7984           */
7985          "bServerSide": false,
7986      
7987      
7988          /**
7989           * Enable or disable sorting of columns. Sorting of individual columns can be
7990           * disabled by the "bSortable" option for each column.
7991           *  @type boolean
7992           *  @default true
7993           *  @dtopt Features
7994           * 
7995           *  @example
7996           *    $(document).ready( function () {
7997           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
7998           *        "bSort": false
7999           *      } );
8000           *    } );
8001           */
8002          "bSort": true,
8003      
8004      
8005          /**
8006           * Allows control over whether DataTables should use the top (true) unique
8007           * cell that is found for a single column, or the bottom (false - default).
8008           * This is useful when using complex headers.
8009           *  @type boolean
8010           *  @default false
8011           *  @dtopt Options
8012           * 
8013           *  @example
8014           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8015           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8016           *        "bSortCellsTop": true
8017           *      } );
8018           *    } );
8019           */
8020          "bSortCellsTop": false,
8021      
8022      
8023          /**
8024           * Enable or disable the addition of the classes 'sorting_1', 'sorting_2' and
8025           * 'sorting_3' to the columns which are currently being sorted on. This is
8026           * presented as a feature switch as it can increase processing time (while
8027           * classes are removed and added) so for large data sets you might want to
8028           * turn this off.
8029           *  @type boolean
8030           *  @default true
8031           *  @dtopt Features
8032           * 
8033           *  @example
8034           *    $(document).ready( function () {
8035           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8036           *        "bSortClasses": false
8037           *      } );
8038           *    } );
8039           */
8040          "bSortClasses": true,
8041      
8042      
8043          /**
8044           * Enable or disable state saving. When enabled a cookie will be used to save
8045           * table display information such as pagination information, display length,
8046           * filtering and sorting. As such when the end user reloads the page the
8047           * display display will match what thy had previously set up.
8048           *  @type boolean
8049           *  @default false
8050           *  @dtopt Features
8051           * 
8052           *  @example
8053           *    $(document).ready( function () {
8054           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8055           *        "bStateSave": true
8056           *      } );
8057           *    } );
8058           */
8059          "bStateSave": false,
8060      
8061      
8062          /**
8063           * Customise the cookie and / or the parameters being stored when using
8064           * DataTables with state saving enabled. This function is called whenever
8065           * the cookie is modified, and it expects a fully formed cookie string to be
8066           * returned. Note that the data object passed in is a Javascript object which
8067           * must be converted to a string (JSON.stringify for example).
8068           *  @type function
8069           *  @param {string} sName Name of the cookie defined by DataTables
8070           *  @param {object} oData Data to be stored in the cookie
8071           *  @param {string} sExpires Cookie expires string
8072           *  @param {string} sPath Path of the cookie to set
8073           *  @returns {string} Cookie formatted string (which should be encoded by
8074           *    using encodeURIComponent())
8075           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8076           * 
8077           *  @example
8078           *    $(document).ready( function () {
8079           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8080           *        "fnCookieCallback": function (sName, oData, sExpires, sPath) {
8081           *          // Customise oData or sName or whatever else here
8082           *          return sName + "="+JSON.stringify(oData)+"; expires=" + sExpires +"; path=" + sPath;
8083           *        }
8084           *      } );
8085           *    } );
8086           */
8087          "fnCookieCallback": null,
8088      
8089      
8090          /**
8091           * This function is called when a TR element is created (and all TD child
8092           * elements have been inserted), or registered if using a DOM source, allowing
8093           * manipulation of the TR element (adding classes etc).
8094           *  @type function
8095           *  @param {node} nRow "TR" element for the current row
8096           *  @param {array} aData Raw data array for this row
8097           *  @param {int} iDataIndex The index of this row in aoData
8098           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8099           * 
8100           *  @example
8101           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8102           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8103           *        "fnCreatedRow": function( nRow, aData, iDataIndex ) {
8104           *          // Bold the grade for all 'A' grade browsers
8105           *          if ( aData[4] == "A" )
8106           *          {
8107           *            $('td:eq(4)', nRow).html( '<b>A</b>' );
8108           *          }
8109           *        }
8110           *      } );
8111           *    } );
8112           */
8113          "fnCreatedRow": null,
8114      
8115      
8116          /**
8117           * This function is called on every 'draw' event, and allows you to
8118           * dynamically modify any aspect you want about the created DOM.
8119           *  @type function
8120           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8121           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8122           * 
8123           *  @example
8124           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8125           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8126           *        "fnDrawCallback": function() {
8127           *          alert( 'DataTables has redrawn the table' );
8128           *        }
8129           *      } );
8130           *    } );
8131           */
8132          "fnDrawCallback": null,
8133      
8134      
8135          /**
8136           * Identical to fnHeaderCallback() but for the table footer this function
8137           * allows you to modify the table footer on every 'draw' even.
8138           *  @type function
8139           *  @param {node} nFoot "TR" element for the footer
8140           *  @param {array} aData Full table data (as derived from the original HTML)
8141           *  @param {int} iStart Index for the current display starting point in the 
8142           *    display array
8143           *  @param {int} iEnd Index for the current display ending point in the 
8144           *    display array
8145           *  @param {array int} aiDisplay Index array to translate the visual position
8146           *    to the full data array
8147           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8148           * 
8149           *  @example
8150           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8151           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8152           *        "fnFooterCallback": function( nFoot, aData, iStart, iEnd, aiDisplay ) {
8153           *          nFoot.getElementsByTagName('th')[0].innerHTML = "Starting index is "+iStart;
8154           *        }
8155           *      } );
8156           *    } )
8157           */
8158          "fnFooterCallback": null,
8159      
8160      
8161          /**
8162           * When rendering large numbers in the information element for the table
8163           * (i.e. "Showing 1 to 10 of 57 entries") DataTables will render large numbers
8164           * to have a comma separator for the 'thousands' units (e.g. 1 million is
8165           * rendered as "1,000,000") to help readability for the end user. This
8166           * function will override the default method DataTables uses.
8167           *  @type function
8168           *  @member
8169           *  @param {int} iIn number to be formatted
8170           *  @returns {string} formatted string for DataTables to show the number
8171           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8172           * 
8173           *  @example
8174           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8175           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8176           *        "fnFormatNumber": function ( iIn ) {
8177           *          if ( iIn &lt; 1000 ) {
8178           *            return iIn;
8179           *          } else {
8180           *            var 
8181           *              s=(iIn+""), 
8182           *              a=s.split(""), out="", 
8183           *              iLen=s.length;
8184           *            
8185           *            for ( var i=0 ; i&lt;iLen ; i++ ) {
8186           *              if ( i%3 === 0 &amp;&amp; i !== 0 ) {
8187           *                out = "'"+out;
8188           *              }
8189           *              out = a[iLen-i-1]+out;
8190           *            }
8191           *          }
8192           *          return out;
8193           *        };
8194           *      } );
8195           *    } );
8196           */
8197          "fnFormatNumber": function ( iIn ) {
8198              if ( iIn < 1000 )
8199              {
8200                  // A small optimisation for what is likely to be the majority of use cases
8201                  return iIn;
8202              }
8203      
8204              var s=(iIn+""), a=s.split(""), out="", iLen=s.length;
8205              
8206              for ( var i=0 ; i<iLen ; i++ )
8207              {
8208                  if ( i%3 === 0 && i !== 0 )
8209                  {
8210                      out = this.oLanguage.sInfoThousands+out;
8211                  }
8212                  out = a[iLen-i-1]+out;
8213              }
8214              return out;
8215          },
8216      
8217      
8218          /**
8219           * This function is called on every 'draw' event, and allows you to
8220           * dynamically modify the header row. This can be used to calculate and
8221           * display useful information about the table.
8222           *  @type function
8223           *  @param {node} nHead "TR" element for the header
8224           *  @param {array} aData Full table data (as derived from the original HTML)
8225           *  @param {int} iStart Index for the current display starting point in the
8226           *    display array
8227           *  @param {int} iEnd Index for the current display ending point in the
8228           *    display array
8229           *  @param {array int} aiDisplay Index array to translate the visual position
8230           *    to the full data array
8231           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8232           * 
8233           *  @example
8234           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8235           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8236           *        "fnHeaderCallback": function( nHead, aData, iStart, iEnd, aiDisplay ) {
8237           *          nHead.getElementsByTagName('th')[0].innerHTML = "Displaying "+(iEnd-iStart)+" records";
8238           *        }
8239           *      } );
8240           *    } )
8241           */
8242          "fnHeaderCallback": null,
8243      
8244      
8245          /**
8246           * The information element can be used to convey information about the current
8247           * state of the table. Although the internationalisation options presented by
8248           * DataTables are quite capable of dealing with most customisations, there may
8249           * be times where you wish to customise the string further. This callback
8250           * allows you to do exactly that.
8251           *  @type function
8252           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8253           *  @param {int} iStart Starting position in data for the draw
8254           *  @param {int} iEnd End position in data for the draw
8255           *  @param {int} iMax Total number of rows in the table (regardless of
8256           *    filtering)
8257           *  @param {int} iTotal Total number of rows in the data set, after filtering
8258           *  @param {string} sPre The string that DataTables has formatted using it's
8259           *    own rules
8260           *  @returns {string} The string to be displayed in the information element.
8261           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8262           * 
8263           *  @example
8264           *    $('#example').dataTable( {
8265           *      "fnInfoCallback": function( oSettings, iStart, iEnd, iMax, iTotal, sPre ) {
8266           *        return iStart +" to "+ iEnd;
8267           *      }
8268           *    } );
8269           */
8270          "fnInfoCallback": null,
8271      
8272      
8273          /**
8274           * Called when the table has been initialised. Normally DataTables will
8275           * initialise sequentially and there will be no need for this function,
8276           * however, this does not hold true when using external language information
8277           * since that is obtained using an async XHR call.
8278           *  @type function
8279           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8280           *  @param {object} json The JSON object request from the server - only
8281           *    present if client-side Ajax sourced data is used
8282           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8283           * 
8284           *  @example
8285           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8286           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8287           *        "fnInitComplete": function(oSettings, json) {
8288           *          alert( 'DataTables has finished its initialisation.' );
8289           *        }
8290           *      } );
8291           *    } )
8292           */
8293          "fnInitComplete": null,
8294      
8295      
8296          /**
8297           * Called at the very start of each table draw and can be used to cancel the
8298           * draw by returning false, any other return (including undefined) results in
8299           * the full draw occurring).
8300           *  @type function
8301           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8302           *  @returns {boolean} False will cancel the draw, anything else (including no
8303           *    return) will allow it to complete.
8304           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8305           * 
8306           *  @example
8307           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8308           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8309           *        "fnPreDrawCallback": function( oSettings ) {
8310           *          if ( $('#test').val() == 1 ) {
8311           *            return false;
8312           *          }
8313           *        }
8314           *      } );
8315           *    } );
8316           */
8317          "fnPreDrawCallback": null,
8318      
8319      
8320          /**
8321           * This function allows you to 'post process' each row after it have been
8322           * generated for each table draw, but before it is rendered on screen. This
8323           * function might be used for setting the row class name etc.
8324           *  @type function
8325           *  @param {node} nRow "TR" element for the current row
8326           *  @param {array} aData Raw data array for this row
8327           *  @param {int} iDisplayIndex The display index for the current table draw
8328           *  @param {int} iDisplayIndexFull The index of the data in the full list of
8329           *    rows (after filtering)
8330           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8331           * 
8332           *  @example
8333           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8334           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8335           *        "fnRowCallback": function( nRow, aData, iDisplayIndex, iDisplayIndexFull ) {
8336           *          // Bold the grade for all 'A' grade browsers
8337           *          if ( aData[4] == "A" )
8338           *          {
8339           *            $('td:eq(4)', nRow).html( '<b>A</b>' );
8340           *          }
8341           *        }
8342           *      } );
8343           *    } );
8344           */
8345          "fnRowCallback": null,
8346      
8347      
8348          /**
8349           * This parameter allows you to override the default function which obtains
8350           * the data from the server ($.getJSON) so something more suitable for your
8351           * application. For example you could use POST data, or pull information from
8352           * a Gears or AIR database.
8353           *  @type function
8354           *  @member
8355           *  @param {string} sSource HTTP source to obtain the data from (sAjaxSource)
8356           *  @param {array} aoData A key/value pair object containing the data to send
8357           *    to the server
8358           *  @param {function} fnCallback to be called on completion of the data get
8359           *    process that will draw the data on the page.
8360           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8361           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8362           *  @dtopt Server-side
8363           * 
8364           *  @example
8365           *    // POST data to server
8366           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8367           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8368           *        "bProcessing": true,
8369           *        "bServerSide": true,
8370           *        "sAjaxSource": "xhr.php",
8371           *        "fnServerData": function ( sSource, aoData, fnCallback ) {
8372           *          $.ajax( {
8373           *            "dataType": 'json', 
8374           *            "type": "POST", 
8375           *            "url": sSource, 
8376           *            "data": aoData, 
8377           *            "success": fnCallback
8378           *          } );
8379           *        }
8380           *      } );
8381           *    } );
8382           */
8383          "fnServerData": function ( sUrl, aoData, fnCallback, oSettings ) {
8384              oSettings.jqXHR = $.ajax( {
8385                  "url":  sUrl,
8386                  "data": aoData,
8387                  "success": function (json) {
8388                      $(oSettings.oInstance).trigger('xhr', oSettings);
8389                      fnCallback( json );
8390                  },
8391                  "dataType": "json",
8392                  "cache": false,
8393                  "type": oSettings.sServerMethod,
8394                  "error": function (xhr, error, thrown) {
8395                      if ( error == "parsererror" ) {
8396                          alert( "DataTables warning: JSON data from server could not be parsed. "+
8397                              "This is caused by a JSON formatting error." );
8398                      }
8399                  }
8400              } );
8401          },
8402      
8403      
8404          /**
8405           * It is often useful to send extra data to the server when making an Ajax
8406           * request - for example custom filtering information, and this callback
8407           * function makes it trivial to send extra information to the server. The
8408           * passed in parameter is the data set that has been constructed by
8409           * DataTables, and you can add to this or modify it as you require.
8410           *  @type function
8411           *  @param {array} aoData Data array (array of objects which are name/value
8412           *    pairs) that has been constructed by DataTables and will be sent to the
8413           *    server. In the case of Ajax sourced data with server-side processing
8414           *    this will be an empty array, for server-side processing there will be a
8415           *    significant number of parameters!
8416           *  @returns {undefined} Ensure that you modify the aoData array passed in,
8417           *    as this is passed by reference.
8418           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8419           *  @dtopt Server-side
8420           * 
8421           *  @example
8422           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8423           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8424           *        "bProcessing": true,
8425           *        "bServerSide": true,
8426           *        "sAjaxSource": "scripts/server_processing.php",
8427           *        "fnServerParams": function ( aoData ) {
8428           *          aoData.push( { "name": "more_data", "value": "my_value" } );
8429           *        }
8430           *      } );
8431           *    } );
8432           */
8433          "fnServerParams": null,
8434      
8435      
8436          /**
8437           * Load the table state. With this function you can define from where, and how, the
8438           * state of a table is loaded. By default DataTables will load from its state saving
8439           * cookie, but you might wish to use local storage (HTML5) or a server-side database.
8440           *  @type function
8441           *  @member
8442           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8443           *  @return {object} The DataTables state object to be loaded
8444           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8445           * 
8446           *  @example
8447           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8448           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8449           *        "bStateSave": true,
8450           *        "fnStateSave": function (oSettings, oData) {
8451           *          var o;
8452           *          
8453           *          // Send an Ajax request to the server to get the data. Note that
8454           *          // this is a synchronous request.
8455           *          $.ajax( {
8456           *            "url": "/state_load",
8457           *            "async": false,
8458           *            "dataType": "json",
8459           *            "success": function (json) {
8460           *              o = json;
8461           *            }
8462           *          } );
8463           *          
8464           *          return o;
8465           *        }
8466           *      } );
8467           *    } );
8468           */
8469          "fnStateLoad": function ( oSettings ) {
8470              var sData = this.oApi._fnReadCookie( oSettings.sCookiePrefix+oSettings.sInstance );
8471              var oData;
8472      
8473              try {
8474                  oData = (typeof $.parseJSON === 'function') ? 
8475                      $.parseJSON(sData) : eval( '('+sData+')' );
8476              } catch (e) {
8477                  oData = null;
8478              }
8479      
8480              return oData;
8481          },
8482      
8483      
8484          /**
8485           * Callback which allows modification of the saved state prior to loading that state.
8486           * This callback is called when the table is loading state from the stored data, but
8487           * prior to the settings object being modified by the saved state. Note that for 
8488           * plug-in authors, you should use the 'stateLoadParams' event to load parameters for 
8489           * a plug-in.
8490           *  @type function
8491           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8492           *  @param {object} oData The state object that is to be loaded
8493           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8494           * 
8495           *  @example
8496           *    // Remove a saved filter, so filtering is never loaded
8497           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8498           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8499           *        "bStateSave": true,
8500           *        "fnStateLoadParams": function (oSettings, oData) {
8501           *          oData.oFilter.sSearch = "";
8502           *      } );
8503           *    } );
8504           * 
8505           *  @example
8506           *    // Disallow state loading by returning false
8507           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8508           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8509           *        "bStateSave": true,
8510           *        "fnStateLoadParams": function (oSettings, oData) {
8511           *          return false;
8512           *      } );
8513           *    } );
8514           */
8515          "fnStateLoadParams": null,
8516      
8517      
8518          /**
8519           * Callback that is called when the state has been loaded from the state saving method
8520           * and the DataTables settings object has been modified as a result of the loaded state.
8521           *  @type function
8522           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8523           *  @param {object} oData The state object that was loaded
8524           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8525           * 
8526           *  @example
8527           *    // Show an alert with the filtering value that was saved
8528           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8529           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8530           *        "bStateSave": true,
8531           *        "fnStateLoaded": function (oSettings, oData) {
8532           *          alert( 'Saved filter was: '+oData.oFilter.sSearch );
8533           *      } );
8534           *    } );
8535           */
8536          "fnStateLoaded": null,
8537      
8538      
8539          /**
8540           * Save the table state. This function allows you to define where and how the state
8541           * information for the table is stored - by default it will use a cookie, but you
8542           * might want to use local storage (HTML5) or a server-side database.
8543           *  @type function
8544           *  @member
8545           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8546           *  @param {object} oData The state object to be saved
8547           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8548           * 
8549           *  @example
