8550           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8551           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8552           *        "bStateSave": true,
8553           *        "fnStateSave": function (oSettings, oData) {
8554           *          // Send an Ajax request to the server with the state object
8555           *          $.ajax( {
8556           *            "url": "/state_save",
8557           *            "data": oData,
8558           *            "dataType": "json",
8559           *            "method": "POST"
8560           *            "success": function () {}
8561           *          } );
8562           *        }
8563           *      } );
8564           *    } );
8565           */
8566          "fnStateSave": function ( oSettings, oData ) {
8567              this.oApi._fnCreateCookie( 
8568                  oSettings.sCookiePrefix+oSettings.sInstance, 
8569                  this.oApi._fnJsonString(oData), 
8570                  oSettings.iCookieDuration, 
8571                  oSettings.sCookiePrefix, 
8572                  oSettings.fnCookieCallback
8573              );
8574          },
8575      
8576      
8577          /**
8578           * Callback which allows modification of the state to be saved. Called when the table 
8579           * has changed state a new state save is required. This method allows modification of
8580           * the state saving object prior to actually doing the save, including addition or 
8581           * other state properties or modification. Note that for plug-in authors, you should 
8582           * use the 'stateSaveParams' event to save parameters for a plug-in.
8583           *  @type function
8584           *  @param {object} oSettings DataTables settings object
8585           *  @param {object} oData The state object to be saved
8586           *  @dtopt Callbacks
8587           * 
8588           *  @example
8589           *    // Remove a saved filter, so filtering is never saved
8590           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8591           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8592           *        "bStateSave": true,
8593           *        "fnStateLoadParams": function (oSettings, oData) {
8594           *          oData.oFilter.sSearch = "";
8595           *      } );
8596           *    } );
8597           */
8598          "fnStateSaveParams": null,
8599      
8600      
8601          /**
8602           * Duration of the cookie which is used for storing session information. This
8603           * value is given in seconds.
8604           *  @type int
8605           *  @default 7200 <i>(2 hours)</i>
8606           *  @dtopt Options
8607           * 
8608           *  @example
8609           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8610           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8611           *        "iCookieDuration": 60*60*24 // 1 day
8612           *      } );
8613           *    } )
8614           */
8615          "iCookieDuration": 7200,
8616      
8617      
8618          /**
8619           * When enabled DataTables will not make a request to the server for the first
8620           * page draw - rather it will use the data already on the page (no sorting etc
8621           * will be applied to it), thus saving on an XHR at load time. iDeferLoading
8622           * is used to indicate that deferred loading is required, but it is also used
8623           * to tell DataTables how many records there are in the full table (allowing
8624           * the information element and pagination to be displayed correctly).
8625           *  @type int
8626           *  @default null
8627           *  @dtopt Options
8628           * 
8629           *  @example
8630           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8631           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8632           *        "bServerSide": true,
8633           *        "sAjaxSource": "scripts/server_processing.php",
8634           *        "iDeferLoading": 57
8635           *      } );
8636           *    } );
8637           */
8638          "iDeferLoading": null,
8639      
8640      
8641          /**
8642           * Number of rows to display on a single page when using pagination. If
8643           * feature enabled (bLengthChange) then the end user will be able to override
8644           * this to a custom setting using a pop-up menu.
8645           *  @type int
8646           *  @default 10
8647           *  @dtopt Options
8648           * 
8649           *  @example
8650           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8651           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8652           *        "iDisplayLength": 50
8653           *      } );
8654           *    } )
8655           */
8656          "iDisplayLength": 10,
8657      
8658      
8659          /**
8660           * Define the starting point for data display when using DataTables with
8661           * pagination. Note that this parameter is the number of records, rather than
8662           * the page number, so if you have 10 records per page and want to start on
8663           * the third page, it should be "20".
8664           *  @type int
8665           *  @default 0
8666           *  @dtopt Options
8667           * 
8668           *  @example
8669           *    $(document).ready( function() {
8670           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8671           *        "iDisplayStart": 20
8672           *      } );
8673           *    } )
8674           */
8675          "iDisplayStart": 0,
8676      
8677      
8678          /**
8679           * The scroll gap is the amount of scrolling that is left to go before
8680           * DataTables will load the next 'page' of data automatically. You typically
8681           * want a gap which is big enough that the scrolling will be smooth for the
8682           * user, while not so large that it will load more data than need.
8683           *  @type int
8684           *  @default 100
8685           *  @dtopt Options
8686           * 
8687           *  @example
8688           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8689           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8690           *        "bScrollInfinite": true,
8691           *        "bScrollCollapse": true,
8692           *        "sScrollY": "200px",
8693           *        "iScrollLoadGap": 50
8694           *      } );
8695           *    } );
8696           */
8697          "iScrollLoadGap": 100,
8698      
8699      
8700          /**
8701           * By default DataTables allows keyboard navigation of the table (sorting, paging,
8702           * and filtering) by adding a tabindex attribute to the required elements. This
8703           * allows you to tab through the controls and press the enter key to activate them.
8704           * The tabindex is default 0, meaning that the tab follows the flow of the document.
8705           * You can overrule this using this parameter if you wish. Use a value of -1 to
8706           * disable built-in keyboard navigation.
8707           *  @type int
8708           *  @default 0
8709           *  @dtopt Options
8710           * 
8711           *  @example
8712           *    $(document).ready(function() {
8713           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8714           *        "iTabIndex": 1
8715           *      } );
8716           *    } );
8717           */
8718          "iTabIndex": 0,
8719      
8720      
8721          /**
8722           * All strings that DataTables uses in the user interface that it creates
8723           * are defined in this object, allowing you to modified them individually or
8724           * completely replace them all as required.
8725           *  @namespace
8726           */
8727          "oLanguage": {
8728              /**
8729               * Strings that are used for WAI-ARIA labels and controls only (these are not
8730               * actually visible on the page, but will be read by screenreaders, and thus
8731               * must be internationalised as well).
8732               *  @namespace
8733               */
8734              "oAria": {
8735                  /**
8736                   * ARIA label that is added to the table headers when the column may be
8737                   * sorted ascending by activing the column (click or return when focused).
8738                   * Note that the column header is prefixed to this string.
8739                   *  @type string
8740                   *  @default : activate to sort column ascending
8741                   *  @dtopt Language
8742                   * 
8743                   *  @example
8744                   *    $(document).ready(function() {
8745                   *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8746                   *        "oLanguage": {
8747                   *          "oAria": {
8748                   *            "sSortAscending": " - click/return to sort ascending"
8749                   *          }
8750                   *        }
8751                   *      } );
8752                   *    } );
8753                   */
8754                  "sSortAscending": ": activate to sort column ascending",
8755      
8756                  /**
8757                   * ARIA label that is added to the table headers when the column may be
8758                   * sorted descending by activing the column (click or return when focused).
8759                   * Note that the column header is prefixed to this string.
8760                   *  @type string
8761                   *  @default : activate to sort column ascending
8762                   *  @dtopt Language
8763                   * 
8764                   *  @example
8765                   *    $(document).ready(function() {
8766                   *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8767                   *        "oLanguage": {
8768                   *          "oAria": {
8769                   *            "sSortDescending": " - click/return to sort descending"
8770                   *          }
8771                   *        }
8772                   *      } );
8773                   *    } );
8774                   */
8775                  "sSortDescending": ": activate to sort column descending"
8776              },
8777      
8778              /**
8779               * Pagination string used by DataTables for the two built-in pagination
8780               * control types ("two_button" and "full_numbers")
8781               *  @namespace
8782               */
8783              "oPaginate": {
8784                  /**
8785                   * Text to use when using the 'full_numbers' type of pagination for the
8786                   * button to take the user to the first page.
8787                   *  @type string
8788                   *  @default First
8789                   *  @dtopt Language
8790                   * 
8791                   *  @example
8792                   *    $(document).ready(function() {
8793                   *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8794                   *        "oLanguage": {
8795                   *          "oPaginate": {
8796                   *            "sFirst": "First page"
8797                   *          }
8798                   *        }
8799                   *      } );
8800                   *    } );
8801                   */
8802                  "sFirst": "First",
8803              
8804              
8805                  /**
8806                   * Text to use when using the 'full_numbers' type of pagination for the
8807                   * button to take the user to the last page.
8808                   *  @type string
8809                   *  @default Last
8810                   *  @dtopt Language
8811                   * 
8812                   *  @example
8813                   *    $(document).ready(function() {
8814                   *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8815                   *        "oLanguage": {
8816                   *          "oPaginate": {
8817                   *            "sLast": "Last page"
8818                   *          }
8819                   *        }
8820                   *      } );
8821                   *    } );
8822                   */
8823                  "sLast": "Last",
8824              
8825              
8826                  /**
8827                   * Text to use when using the 'full_numbers' type of pagination for the
8828                   * button to take the user to the next page.
8829                   *  @type string
8830                   *  @default Next
8831                   *  @dtopt Language
8832                   * 
8833                   *  @example
8834                   *    $(document).ready(function() {
8835                   *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8836                   *        "oLanguage": {
8837                   *          "oPaginate": {
8838                   *            "sNext": "Next page"
8839                   *          }
8840                   *        }
8841                   *      } );
8842                   *    } );
8843                   */
8844                  "sNext": "Next",
8845              
8846              
8847                  /**
8848                   * Text to use when using the 'full_numbers' type of pagination for the
8849                   * button to take the user to the previous page.
8850                   *  @type string
8851                   *  @default Previous
8852                   *  @dtopt Language
8853                   * 
8854                   *  @example
8855                   *    $(document).ready(function() {
8856                   *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8857                   *        "oLanguage": {
8858                   *          "oPaginate": {
8859                   *            "sPrevious": "Previous page"
8860                   *          }
8861                   *        }
8862                   *      } );
8863                   *    } );
8864                   */
8865                  "sPrevious": "Previous"
8866              },
8867          
8868              /**
8869               * This string is shown in preference to sZeroRecords when the table is
8870               * empty of data (regardless of filtering). Note that this is an optional
8871               * parameter - if it is not given, the value of sZeroRecords will be used
8872               * instead (either the default or given value).
8873               *  @type string
8874               *  @default No data available in table
8875               *  @dtopt Language
8876               * 
8877               *  @example
8878               *    $(document).ready(function() {
8879               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8880               *        "oLanguage": {
8881               *          "sEmptyTable": "No data available in table"
8882               *        }
8883               *      } );
8884               *    } );
8885               */
8886              "sEmptyTable": "No data available in table",
8887          
8888          
8889              /**
8890               * This string gives information to the end user about the information that 
8891               * is current on display on the page. The _START_, _END_ and _TOTAL_ 
8892               * variables are all dynamically replaced as the table display updates, and 
8893               * can be freely moved or removed as the language requirements change.
8894               *  @type string
8895               *  @default Showing _START_ to _END_ of _TOTAL_ entries
8896               *  @dtopt Language
8897               * 
8898               *  @example
8899               *    $(document).ready(function() {
8900               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8901               *        "oLanguage": {
8902               *          "sInfo": "Got a total of _TOTAL_ entries to show (_START_ to _END_)"
8903               *        }
8904               *      } );
8905               *    } );
8906               */
8907              "sInfo": "Showing _START_ to _END_ of _TOTAL_ entries",
8908          
8909          
8910              /**
8911               * Display information string for when the table is empty. Typically the 
8912               * format of this string should match sInfo.
8913               *  @type string
8914               *  @default Showing 0 to 0 of 0 entries
8915               *  @dtopt Language
8916               * 
8917               *  @example
8918               *    $(document).ready(function() {
8919               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8920               *        "oLanguage": {
8921               *          "sInfoEmpty": "No entries to show"
8922               *        }
8923               *      } );
8924               *    } );
8925               */
8926              "sInfoEmpty": "Showing 0 to 0 of 0 entries",
8927          
8928          
8929              /**
8930               * When a user filters the information in a table, this string is appended 
8931               * to the information (sInfo) to give an idea of how strong the filtering 
8932               * is. The variable _MAX_ is dynamically updated.
8933               *  @type string
8934               *  @default (filtered from _MAX_ total entries)
8935               *  @dtopt Language
8936               * 
8937               *  @example
8938               *    $(document).ready(function() {
8939               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8940               *        "oLanguage": {
8941               *          "sInfoFiltered": " - filtering from _MAX_ records"
8942               *        }
8943               *      } );
8944               *    } );
8945               */
8946              "sInfoFiltered": "(filtered from _MAX_ total entries)",
8947          
8948          
8949              /**
8950               * If can be useful to append extra information to the info string at times,
8951               * and this variable does exactly that. This information will be appended to
8952               * the sInfo (sInfoEmpty and sInfoFiltered in whatever combination they are
8953               * being used) at all times.
8954               *  @type string
8955               *  @default <i>Empty string</i>
8956               *  @dtopt Language
8957               * 
8958               *  @example
8959               *    $(document).ready(function() {
8960               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8961               *        "oLanguage": {
8962               *          "sInfoPostFix": "All records shown are derived from real information."
8963               *        }
8964               *      } );
8965               *    } );
8966               */
8967              "sInfoPostFix": "",
8968          
8969          
8970              /**
8971               * DataTables has a build in number formatter (fnFormatNumber) which is used
8972               * to format large numbers that are used in the table information. By
8973               * default a comma is used, but this can be trivially changed to any
8974               * character you wish with this parameter.
8975               *  @type string
8976               *  @default ,
8977               *  @dtopt Language
8978               * 
8979               *  @example
8980               *    $(document).ready(function() {
8981               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
8982               *        "oLanguage": {
8983               *          "sInfoThousands": "'"
8984               *        }
8985               *      } );
8986               *    } );
8987               */
8988              "sInfoThousands": ",",
8989          
8990          
8991              /**
8992               * Detail the action that will be taken when the drop down menu for the
8993               * pagination length option is changed. The '_MENU_' variable is replaced
8994               * with a default select list of 10, 25, 50 and 100, and can be replaced
8995               * with a custom select box if required.
8996               *  @type string
8997               *  @default Show _MENU_ entries
8998               *  @dtopt Language
8999               * 
9000               *  @example
9001               *    // Language change only
9002               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9003               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9004               *        "oLanguage": {
9005               *          "sLengthMenu": "Display _MENU_ records"
9006               *        }
9007               *      } );
9008               *    } );
9009               *    
9010               *  @example
9011               *    // Language and options change
9012               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9013               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9014               *        "oLanguage": {
9015               *          "sLengthMenu": 'Display <select>'+
9016               *            '<option value="10">10</option>'+
9017               *            '<option value="20">20</option>'+
9018               *            '<option value="30">30</option>'+
9019               *            '<option value="40">40</option>'+
9020               *            '<option value="50">50</option>'+
9021               *            '<option value="-1">All</option>'+
9022               *            '</select> records'
9023               *        }
9024               *      } );
9025               *    } );
9026               */
9027              "sLengthMenu": "Show _MENU_ entries",
9028          
9029          
9030              /**
9031               * When using Ajax sourced data and during the first draw when DataTables is
9032               * gathering the data, this message is shown in an empty row in the table to
9033               * indicate to the end user the the data is being loaded. Note that this
9034               * parameter is not used when loading data by server-side processing, just
9035               * Ajax sourced data with client-side processing.
9036               *  @type string
9037               *  @default Loading...
9038               *  @dtopt Language
9039               * 
9040               *  @example
9041               *    $(document).ready( function() {
9042               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9043               *        "oLanguage": {
9044               *          "sLoadingRecords": "Please wait - loading..."
9045               *        }
9046               *      } );
9047               *    } );
9048               */
9049              "sLoadingRecords": "Loading...",
9050          
9051          
9052              /**
9053               * Text which is displayed when the table is processing a user action
9054               * (usually a sort command or similar).
9055               *  @type string
9056               *  @default Processing...
9057               *  @dtopt Language
9058               * 
9059               *  @example
9060               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9061               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9062               *        "oLanguage": {
9063               *          "sProcessing": "DataTables is currently busy"
9064               *        }
9065               *      } );
9066               *    } );
9067               */
9068              "sProcessing": "Processing...",
9069          
9070          
9071              /**
9072               * Details the actions that will be taken when the user types into the
9073               * filtering input text box. The variable "_INPUT_", if used in the string,
9074               * is replaced with the HTML text box for the filtering input allowing
9075               * control over where it appears in the string. If "_INPUT_" is not given
9076               * then the input box is appended to the string automatically.
9077               *  @type string
9078               *  @default Search:
9079               *  @dtopt Language
9080               * 
9081               *  @example
9082               *    // Input text box will be appended at the end automatically
9083               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9084               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9085               *        "oLanguage": {
9086               *          "sSearch": "Filter records:"
9087               *        }
9088               *      } );
9089               *    } );
9090               *    
9091               *  @example
9092               *    // Specify where the filter should appear
9093               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9094               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9095               *        "oLanguage": {
9096               *          "sSearch": "Apply filter _INPUT_ to table"
9097               *        }
9098               *      } );
9099               *    } );
9100               */
9101              "sSearch": "Search:",
9102          
9103          
9104              /**
9105               * All of the language information can be stored in a file on the
9106               * server-side, which DataTables will look up if this parameter is passed.
9107               * It must store the URL of the language file, which is in a JSON format,
9108               * and the object has the same properties as the oLanguage object in the
9109               * initialiser object (i.e. the above parameters). Please refer to one of
9110               * the example language files to see how this works in action.
9111               *  @type string
9112               *  @default <i>Empty string - i.e. disabled</i>
9113               *  @dtopt Language
9114               * 
9115               *  @example
9116               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9117               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9118               *        "oLanguage": {
9119               *          "sUrl": "http://www.sprymedia.co.uk/dataTables/lang.txt"
9120               *        }
9121               *      } );
9122               *    } );
9123               */
9124              "sUrl": "",
9125          
9126          
9127              /**
9128               * Text shown inside the table records when the is no information to be
9129               * displayed after filtering. sEmptyTable is shown when there is simply no
9130               * information in the table at all (regardless of filtering).
9131               *  @type string
9132               *  @default No matching records found
9133               *  @dtopt Language
9134               * 
9135               *  @example
9136               *    $(document).ready(function() {
9137               *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9138               *        "oLanguage": {
9139               *          "sZeroRecords": "No records to display"
9140               *        }
9141               *      } );
9142               *    } );
9143               */
9144              "sZeroRecords": "No matching records found"
9145          },
9146      
9147      
9148          /**
9149           * This parameter allows you to have define the global filtering state at
9150           * initialisation time. As an object the "sSearch" parameter must be
9151           * defined, but all other parameters are optional. When "bRegex" is true,
9152           * the search string will be treated as a regular expression, when false
9153           * (default) it will be treated as a straight string. When "bSmart"
9154           * DataTables will use it's smart filtering methods (to word match at
9155           * any point in the data), when false this will not be done.
9156           *  @namespace
9157           *  @extends DataTable.models.oSearch
9158           *  @dtopt Options
9159           * 
9160           *  @example
9161           *    $(document).ready( function() {
9162           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9163           *        "oSearch": {"sSearch": "Initial search"}
9164           *      } );
9165           *    } )
9166           */
9167          "oSearch": $.extend( {}, DataTable.models.oSearch ),
9168      
9169      
9170          /**
9171           * By default DataTables will look for the property 'aaData' when obtaining
9172           * data from an Ajax source or for server-side processing - this parameter
9173           * allows that property to be changed. You can use Javascript dotted object
9174           * notation to get a data source for multiple levels of nesting.
9175           *  @type string
9176           *  @default aaData
9177           *  @dtopt Options
9178           *  @dtopt Server-side
9179           * 
9180           *  @example
9181           *    // Get data from { "data": [...] }
9182           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9183           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable( {
9184           *        "sAjaxSource": "sources/data.txt",
9185           *        "sAjaxDataProp": "data"
9186           *      } );
9187           *    } );
9188           *    
9189           *  @example
9190           *    // Get data from { "data": { "inner": [...] } }
9191           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9192           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable( {
9193           *        "sAjaxSource": "sources/data.txt",
9194           *        "sAjaxDataProp": "data.inner"
9195           *      } );
9196           *    } );
9197           */
9198          "sAjaxDataProp": "aaData",
9199      
9200      
9201          /**
9202           * You can instruct DataTables to load data from an external source using this
9203           * parameter (use aData if you want to pass data in you already have). Simply
9204           * provide a url a JSON object can be obtained from. This object must include
9205           * the parameter 'aaData' which is the data source for the table.
9206           *  @type string
9207           *  @default null
9208           *  @dtopt Options
9209           *  @dtopt Server-side
9210           * 
9211           *  @example
9212           *    $(document).ready( function() {
9213           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9214           *        "sAjaxSource": "http://www.sprymedia.co.uk/dataTables/json.php"
9215           *      } );
9216           *    } )
9217           */
9218          "sAjaxSource": null,
9219      
9220      
9221          /**
9222           * This parameter can be used to override the default prefix that DataTables
9223           * assigns to a cookie when state saving is enabled.
9224           *  @type string
9225           *  @default SpryMedia_DataTables_
9226           *  @dtopt Options
9227           * 
9228           *  @example
9229           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9230           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9231           *        "sCookiePrefix": "my_datatable_",
9232           *      } );
9233           *    } );
9234           */
9235          "sCookiePrefix": "SpryMedia_DataTables_",
9236      
9237      
9238          /**
9239           * This initialisation variable allows you to specify exactly where in the
9240           * DOM you want DataTables to inject the various controls it adds to the page
9241           * (for example you might want the pagination controls at the top of the
9242           * table). DIV elements (with or without a custom class) can also be added to
9243           * aid styling. The follow syntax is used:
9244           *   <ul>
9245           *     <li>The following options are allowed:    
9246           *       <ul>
9247           *         <li>'l' - Length changing</li
9248           *         <li>'f' - Filtering input</li>
9249           *         <li>'t' - The table!</li>
9250           *         <li>'i' - Information</li>
9251           *         <li>'p' - Pagination</li>
9252           *         <li>'r' - pRocessing</li>
9253           *       </ul>
9254           *     </li>
9255           *     <li>The following constants are allowed:
9256           *       <ul>
9257           *         <li>'H' - jQueryUI theme "header" classes ('fg-toolbar ui-widget-header ui-corner-tl ui-corner-tr ui-helper-clearfix')</li>
9258           *         <li>'F' - jQueryUI theme "footer" classes ('fg-toolbar ui-widget-header ui-corner-bl ui-corner-br ui-helper-clearfix')</li>
9259           *       </ul>
9260           *     </li>
9261           *     <li>The following syntax is expected:
9262           *       <ul>
9263           *         <li>'&lt;' and '&gt;' - div elements</li>
9264           *         <li>'&lt;"class" and '&gt;' - div with a class</li>
9265           *         <li>'&lt;"#id" and '&gt;' - div with an ID</li>
9266           *       </ul>
9267           *     </li>
9268           *     <li>Examples:
9269           *       <ul>
9270           *         <li>'&lt;"wrapper"flipt&gt;'</li>
9271           *         <li>'&lt;lf&lt;t&gt;ip&gt;'</li>
9272           *       </ul>
9273           *     </li>
9274           *   </ul>
9275           *  @type string
9276           *  @default lfrtip <i>(when bJQueryUI is false)</i> <b>or</b> 
9277           *    <"H"lfr>t<"F"ip> <i>(when bJQueryUI is true)</i>
9278           *  @dtopt Options
9279           * 
9280           *  @example
9281           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9282           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9283           *        "sDom": '&lt;"top"i&gt;rt&lt;"bottom"flp&gt;&lt;"clear"&lgt;'
9284           *      } );
9285           *    } );
9286           */
9287          "sDom": "lfrtip",
9288      
9289      
9290          /**
9291           * DataTables features two different built-in pagination interaction methods
9292           * ('two_button' or 'full_numbers') which present different page controls to
9293           * the end user. Further methods can be added using the API (see below).
9294           *  @type string
9295           *  @default two_button
9296           *  @dtopt Options
9297           * 
9298           *  @example
9299           *    $(document).ready( function() {
9300           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9301           *        "sPaginationType": "full_numbers"
9302           *      } );
9303           *    } )
9304           */
9305          "sPaginationType": "two_button",
9306      
9307      
9308          /**
9309           * Enable horizontal scrolling. When a table is too wide to fit into a certain
9310           * layout, or you have a large number of columns in the table, you can enable
9311           * x-scrolling to show the table in a viewport, which can be scrolled. This
9312           * property can by any CSS unit, or a number (in which case it will be treated
9313           * as a pixel measurement).
9314           *  @type string
9315           *  @default <i>blank string - i.e. disabled</i>
9316           *  @dtopt Features
9317           * 
9318           *  @example
9319           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9320           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9321           *        "sScrollX": "100%",
9322           *        "bScrollCollapse": true
9323           *      } );
9324           *    } );
9325           */
9326          "sScrollX": "",
9327      
9328      
9329          /**
9330           * This property can be used to force a DataTable to use more width than it
9331           * might otherwise do when x-scrolling is enabled. For example if you have a
9332           * table which requires to be well spaced, this parameter is useful for
9333           * "over-sizing" the table, and thus forcing scrolling. This property can by
9334           * any CSS unit, or a number (in which case it will be treated as a pixel
9335           * measurement).
9336           *  @type string
9337           *  @default <i>blank string - i.e. disabled</i>
9338           *  @dtopt Options
9339           * 
9340           *  @example
9341           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9342           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9343           *        "sScrollX": "100%",
9344           *        "sScrollXInner": "110%"
9345           *      } );
9346           *    } );
9347           */
9348          "sScrollXInner": "",
9349      
9350      
9351          /**
9352           * Enable vertical scrolling. Vertical scrolling will constrain the DataTable
9353           * to the given height, an enable scrolling for any data which overflows the
9354           * current viewport. This can be used as an alternative to paging to display
9355           * a lot of data in a small area (although paging and scrolling can both be
9356           * enabled at the same time). This property can by any CSS unit, or a number
9357           * (in which case it will be treated as a pixel measurement).
9358           *  @type string
9359           *  @default <i>blank string - i.e. disabled</i>
9360           *  @dtopt Features
9361           * 
9362           *  @example
9363           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9364           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9365           *        "sScrollY": "200px",
9366           *        "bPaginate": false
9367           *      } );
9368           *    } );
9369           */
9370          "sScrollY": "",
9371      
9372      
9373          /**
9374           * Set the HTTP method that is used to make the Ajax call for server-side
9375           * processing or Ajax sourced data.
9376           *  @type string
9377           *  @default GET
9378           *  @dtopt Options
9379           *  @dtopt Server-side
9380           * 
9381           *  @example
9382           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9383           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9384           *        "bServerSide": true,
9385           *        "sAjaxSource": "scripts/post.php",
9386           *        "sServerMethod": "POST"
9387           *      } );
9388           *    } );
9389           */
9390          "sServerMethod": "GET"
9391      };
9392      
9393      
9394      
9395      /**
9396       * Column options that can be given to DataTables at initialisation time.
9397       *  @namespace
9398       */
9399      DataTable.defaults.columns = {
9400          /**
9401           * Allows a column's sorting to take multiple columns into account when 
9402           * doing a sort. For example first name / last name columns make sense to 
9403           * do a multi-column sort over the two columns.
9404           *  @type array
9405           *  @default null <i>Takes the value of the column index automatically</i>
9406           *  @dtopt Columns
9407           * 
9408           *  @example
9409           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9410           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9411           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9412           *        "aoColumnDefs": [
9413           *          { "aDataSort": [ 0, 1 ], "aTargets": [ 0 ] },
9414           *          { "aDataSort": [ 1, 0 ], "aTargets": [ 1 ] },
9415           *          { "aDataSort": [ 2, 3, 4 ], "aTargets": [ 2 ] }
9416           *        ]
9417           *      } );
9418           *    } );
9419           *    
9420           *  @example
9421           *    // Using aoColumns
9422           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9423           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9424           *        "aoColumns": [
9425           *          { "aDataSort": [ 0, 1 ] },
9426           *          { "aDataSort": [ 1, 0 ] },
9427           *          { "aDataSort": [ 2, 3, 4 ] },
9428           *          null,
9429           *          null
9430           *        ]
9431           *      } );
9432           *    } );
9433           */
9434          "aDataSort": null,
9435      
9436      
9437          /**
9438           * You can control the default sorting direction, and even alter the behaviour
9439           * of the sort handler (i.e. only allow ascending sorting etc) using this
9440           * parameter.
9441           *  @type array
9442           *  @default [ 'asc', 'desc' ]
9443           *  @dtopt Columns
9444           * 
9445           *  @example
9446           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9447           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9448           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9449           *        "aoColumnDefs": [
9450           *          { "asSorting": [ "asc" ], "aTargets": [ 1 ] },
9451           *          { "asSorting": [ "desc", "asc", "asc" ], "aTargets": [ 2 ] },
9452           *          { "asSorting": [ "desc" ], "aTargets": [ 3 ] }
9453           *        ]
9454           *      } );
9455           *    } );
9456           *    
9457           *  @example
9458           *    // Using aoColumns
9459           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9460           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9461           *        "aoColumns": [
9462           *          null,
9463           *          { "asSorting": [ "asc" ] },
9464           *          { "asSorting": [ "desc", "asc", "asc" ] },
9465           *          { "asSorting": [ "desc" ] },
9466           *          null
9467           *        ]
9468           *      } );
9469           *    } );
9470           */
9471          "asSorting": [ 'asc', 'desc' ],
9472      
9473      
9474          /**
9475           * Enable or disable filtering on the data in this column.
9476           *  @type boolean
9477           *  @default true
9478           *  @dtopt Columns
9479           * 
9480           *  @example
9481           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9482           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9483           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9484           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9485           *          { "bSearchable": false, "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
9486           *        ] } );
9487           *    } );
9488           *    
9489           *  @example
9490           *    // Using aoColumns
9491           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9492           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9493           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9494           *          { "bSearchable": false },
9495           *          null,
9496           *          null,
9497           *          null,
9498           *          null
9499           *        ] } );
9500           *    } );
9501           */
9502          "bSearchable": true,
9503      
9504      
9505          /**
9506           * Enable or disable sorting on this column.
9507           *  @type boolean
9508           *  @default true
9509           *  @dtopt Columns
9510           * 
9511           *  @example
9512           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9513           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9514           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9515           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9516           *          { "bSortable": false, "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
9517           *        ] } );
9518           *    } );
9519           *    
9520           *  @example
9521           *    // Using aoColumns
9522           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9523           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9524           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9525           *          { "bSortable": false },
9526           *          null,
9527           *          null,
9528           *          null,
9529           *          null
9530           *        ] } );
9531           *    } );
9532           */
9533          "bSortable": true,
9534      
9535      
9536          /**
9537           * When using fnRender() for a column, you may wish to use the original data
9538           * (before rendering) for sorting and filtering (the default is to used the
9539           * rendered data that the user can see). This may be useful for dates etc.
9540           * 
9541           * *NOTE* It is it is advisable now to use mDataProp as a function and make 
9542           * use of the 'type' that it gives, allowing (potentially) different data to
9543           * be used for sorting, filtering, display and type detection.
9544           *  @type boolean
9545           *  @default true
9546           *  @dtopt Columns
9547           * 
9548           *  @example
9549           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9550           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9551           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9552           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9553           *          {
9554           *            "fnRender": function ( oObj ) {
9555           *              return oObj.aData[0] +' '+ oObj.aData[3];
9556           *            },
9557           *            "bUseRendered": false,
9558           *            "aTargets": [ 0 ]
9559           *          }
9560           *        ]
9561           *      } );
9562           *    } );
9563           *    
9564           *  @example
9565           *    // Using aoColumns
9566           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9567           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9568           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9569           *          {
9570           *            "fnRender": function ( oObj ) {
9571           *              return oObj.aData[0] +' '+ oObj.aData[3];
9572           *            },
9573           *            "bUseRendered": false
9574           *          },
9575           *          null,
9576           *          null,
9577           *          null,
9578           *          null
9579           *        ]
9580           *      } );
9581           *    } );
9582           */
9583          "bUseRendered": true,
9584      
9585      
9586          /**
9587           * Enable or disable the display of this column.
9588           *  @type boolean
9589           *  @default true
9590           *  @dtopt Columns
9591           * 
9592           *  @example
9593           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9594           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9595           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9596           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9597           *          { "bVisible": false, "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
9598           *        ] } );
9599           *    } );
9600           *    
9601           *  @example
9602           *    // Using aoColumns
9603           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9604           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9605           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9606           *          { "bVisible": false },
9607           *          null,
9608           *          null,
9609           *          null,
9610           *          null
9611           *        ] } );
9612           *    } );
9613           */
9614          "bVisible": true,
9615          
9616          
9617          /**
9618           * Developer definable function that is called whenever a cell is created (Ajax source,
9619           * etc) or processed for input (DOM source). This can be used as a compliment to fnRender
9620           * allowing you to modify the DOM element (add background colour for example) when the
9621           * element is available (since it is not when fnRender is called).
9622           *  @type function
9623           *  @param {element} nTd The TD node that has been created
9624           *  @param {*} sData The Data for the cell
9625           *  @param {array|object} oData The data for the whole row
9626           *  @param {int} iRow The row index for the aoData data store
9627           *  @param {int} iCol The column index for aoColumns
9628           *  @dtopt Columns
9629           * 
9630           *  @example
9631           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9632           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9633           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ {
9634           *          "aTargets": [3],
9635           *          "fnCreatedCell": function (nTd, sData, oData, iRow, iCol) {
9636           *            if ( sData == "1.7" ) {
9637           *              $(nTd).css('color', 'blue')
9638           *            }
9639           *          }
9640           *        } ]
9641           *      });
9642           *    } );
9643           */
9644          "fnCreatedCell": null,
9645      
9646      
9647          /**
9648           * Custom display function that will be called for the display of each cell in
9649           * this column.
9650           *  @type function
9651           *  @param {object} o Object with the following parameters:
9652           *  @param {int}    o.iDataRow The row in aoData
9653           *  @param {int}    o.iDataColumn The column in question
9654           *  @param {array}  o.aData The data for the row in question
9655           *  @param {object} o.oSettings The settings object for this DataTables instance
9656           *  @param {object} o.mDataProp The data property used for this column
9657           *  @param {*}      val The current cell value
9658           *  @returns {string} The string you which to use in the display
9659           *  @dtopt Columns
9660           * 
9661           *  @example
9662           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9663           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9664           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9665           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9666           *          {
9667           *            "fnRender": function ( o, val ) {
9668           *              return o.aData[0] +' '+ o.aData[3];
9669           *            },
9670           *            "aTargets": [ 0 ]
9671           *          }
9672           *        ]
9673           *      } );
9674           *    } );
9675           *    
9676           *  @example
9677           *    // Using aoColumns
9678           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9679           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9680           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9681           *          { "fnRender": function ( o, val ) {
9682           *            return o.aData[0] +' '+ o.aData[3];
9683           *          } },
9684           *          null,
9685           *          null,
9686           *          null,
9687           *          null
9688           *        ]
9689           *      } );
9690           *    } );
9691           */
9692          "fnRender": null,
9693      
9694      
9695          /**
9696           * The column index (starting from 0!) that you wish a sort to be performed
9697           * upon when this column is selected for sorting. This can be used for sorting
9698           * on hidden columns for example.
9699           *  @type int
9700           *  @default -1 <i>Use automatically calculated column index</i>
9701           *  @dtopt Columns
9702           * 
9703           *  @example
9704           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9705           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9706           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9707           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9708           *          { "iDataSort": 1, "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
9709           *        ]
9710           *      } );
9711           *    } );
9712           *    
9713           *  @example
9714           *    // Using aoColumns
9715           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9716           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9717           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9718           *          { "iDataSort": 1 },
9719           *          null,
9720           *          null,
9721           *          null,
9722           *          null
9723           *        ]
9724           *      } );
9725           *    } );
9726           */
9727          "iDataSort": -1,
9728      
9729      
9730          /**
9731           * This property can be used to read data from any JSON data source property,
9732           * including deeply nested objects / properties. mDataProp can be given in a
9733           * number of different ways which effect its behaviour:
9734           *   <ul>
9735           *     <li>integer - treated as an array index for the data source. This is the
9736           *       default that DataTables uses (incrementally increased for each column).</li>
9737           *     <li>string - read an object property from the data source. Note that you can
9738           *       use Javascript dotted notation to read deep properties/arrays from the
9739           *       data source.</li>
9740           *     <li>null -  the sDafaultContent option will use used for the cell (empty
9741           *       string by default. This can be useful on generated columns such as
9742           *       edit / delete action columns.</li>
9743           *     <li>function - the function given will be executed whenever DataTables 
9744           *       needs to set or get the data for a cell in the column. The function 
9745           *       takes three parameters:
9746           *       <ul>
9747           *         <li>{array|object} The data source for the row</li>
9748           *         <li>{string} The type call data requested - this will be 'set' when
9749           *           setting data or 'filter', 'display', 'type' or 'sort' when gathering
9750           *           data.</li>
9751           *         <li>{*} Data to set when the second parameter is 'set'.</li>
9752           *       </ul>
9753           *       The return value from the function is not required when 'set' is the type
9754           *       of call, but otherwise the return is what will be used for the data
9755           *       requested.</li>
9756           *    </ul>
9757           *  @type string|int|function|null
9758           *  @default null <i>Use automatically calculated column index</i>
9759           *  @dtopt Columns
9760           * 
9761           *  @example
9762           *    // Read table data from objects
9763           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9764           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable( {
9765           *        "sAjaxSource": "sources/deep.txt",
9766           *        "aoColumns": [
9767           *          { "mDataProp": "engine" },
9768           *          { "mDataProp": "browser" },
9769           *          { "mDataProp": "platform.inner" },
9770           *          { "mDataProp": "platform.details.0" },
9771           *          { "mDataProp": "platform.details.1" }
9772           *        ]
9773           *      } );
9774           *    } );
9775           * 
9776           *  @example
9777           *    // Using mDataProp as a function to provide different information for
9778           *    // sorting, filtering and display. In this case, currency (price)
9779           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9780           *      var oTable = $('#example').dataTable( {
9781           *        "aoColumnDefs": [
9782           *        {
9783           *          "aTargets": [ 0 ],
9784           *          "mDataProp": function ( source, type, val ) {
9785           *            if (type === 'set') {
9786           *              source.price = val;
9787           *              // Store the computed dislay and filter values for efficiency
9788           *              source.price_display = val=="" ? "" : "$"+numberFormat(val);
9789           *              source.price_filter  = val=="" ? "" : "$"+numberFormat(val)+" "+val;
9790           *              return;
9791           *            }
9792           *            else if (type === 'display') {
9793           *              return source.price_display;
9794           *            }
9795           *            else if (type === 'filter') {
9796           *              return source.price_filter;
9797           *            }
9798           *            // 'sort' and 'type' both just use the integer
9799           *            return source.price;
9800           *          }
9801           *        ]
9802           *      } );
9803           *    } );
9804           */
9805          "mDataProp": null,
9806      
9807      
9808          /**
9809           * Class to give to each cell in this column.
9810           *  @type string
9811           *  @default <i>Empty string</i>
9812           *  @dtopt Columns
9813           * 
9814           *  @example
9815           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9816           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9817           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9818           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9819           *          { "sClass": "my_class", "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
9820           *        ]
9821           *      } );
9822           *    } );
9823           *    
9824           *  @example
9825           *    // Using aoColumns
9826           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9827           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9828           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9829           *          { "sClass": "my_class" },
9830           *          null,
9831           *          null,
9832           *          null,
9833           *          null
9834           *        ]
9835           *      } );
9836           *    } );
9837           */
9838          "sClass": "",
9839          
9840          /**
9841           * When DataTables calculates the column widths to assign to each column,
9842           * it finds the longest string in each column and then constructs a
9843           * temporary table and reads the widths from that. The problem with this
9844           * is that "mmm" is much wider then "iiii", but the latter is a longer 
9845           * string - thus the calculation can go wrong (doing it properly and putting
9846           * it into an DOM object and measuring that is horribly(!) slow). Thus as
9847           * a "work around" we provide this option. It will append its value to the
9848           * text that is found to be the longest string for the column - i.e. padding.
9849           * Generally you shouldn't need this, and it is not documented on the 
9850           * general DataTables.net documentation
9851           *  @type string
9852           *  @default <i>Empty string<i>
9853           *  @dtopt Columns
9854           *    
9855           *  @example
9856           *    // Using aoColumns
9857           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9858           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9859           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9860           *          null,
9861           *          null,
9862           *          null,
9863           *          {
9864           *            "sContentPadding": "mmm"
9865           *          }
9866           *        ]
9867           *      } );
9868           *    } );
9869           */
9870          "sContentPadding": "",
9871      
9872      
9873          /**
9874           * Allows a default value to be given for a column's data, and will be used
9875           * whenever a null data source is encountered (this can be because mDataProp
9876           * is set to null, or because the data source itself is null).
9877           *  @type string
9878           *  @default null
9879           *  @dtopt Columns
9880           * 
9881           *  @example
9882           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9883           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9884           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9885           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9886           *          {
9887           *            "mDataProp": null,
9888           *            "sDefaultContent": "Edit",
9889           *            "aTargets": [ -1 ]
9890           *          }
9891           *        ]
9892           *      } );
9893           *    } );
9894           *    
9895           *  @example
9896           *    // Using aoColumns
9897           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9898           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9899           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9900           *          null,
9901           *          null,
9902           *          null,
9903           *          {
9904           *            "mDataProp": null,
9905           *            "sDefaultContent": "Edit"
9906           *          }
9907           *        ]
9908           *      } );
9909           *    } );
9910           */
9911          "sDefaultContent": null,
9912      
9913      
9914          /**
9915           * This parameter is only used in DataTables' server-side processing. It can
9916           * be exceptionally useful to know what columns are being displayed on the
9917           * client side, and to map these to database fields. When defined, the names
9918           * also allow DataTables to reorder information from the server if it comes
9919           * back in an unexpected order (i.e. if you switch your columns around on the
9920           * client-side, your server-side code does not also need updating).
9921           *  @type string
9922           *  @default <i>Empty string</i>
9923           *  @dtopt Columns
9924           * 
9925           *  @example
9926           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9927           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9928           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9929           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
9930           *          { "sName": "engine", "aTargets": [ 0 ] },
9931           *          { "sName": "browser", "aTargets": [ 1 ] },
9932           *          { "sName": "platform", "aTargets": [ 2 ] },
9933           *          { "sName": "version", "aTargets": [ 3 ] },
9934           *          { "sName": "grade", "aTargets": [ 4 ] }
9935           *        ]
9936           *      } );
9937           *    } );
9938           *    
9939           *  @example
9940           *    // Using aoColumns
9941           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9942           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9943           *        "aoColumns": [ 
9944           *          { "sName": "engine" },
9945           *          { "sName": "browser" },
9946           *          { "sName": "platform" },
9947           *          { "sName": "version" },
9948           *          { "sName": "grade" }
9949           *        ]
9950           *      } );
9951           *    } );
9952           */
9953          "sName": "",
9954      
9955      
9956          /**
9957           * Defines a data source type for the sorting which can be used to read
9958           * realtime information from the table (updating the internally cached
9959           * version) prior to sorting. This allows sorting to occur on user editable
9960           * elements such as form inputs.
9961           *  @type string
9962           *  @default std
9963           *  @dtopt Columns
9964           * 
9965           *  @example
9966           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
9967           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9968           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9969           *        "aoColumnDefs": [
9970           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-text", "aTargets": [ 2, 3 ] },
9971           *          { "sType": "numeric", "aTargets": [ 3 ] },
9972           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-select", "aTargets": [ 4 ] },
9973           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-checkbox", "aTargets": [ 5 ] }
9974           *        ]
9975           *      } );
9976           *    } );
9977           *    
9978           *  @example
9979           *    // Using aoColumns
9980           *    $(document).ready(function() {
9981           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
9982           *        "aoColumns": [
9983           *          null,
9984           *          null,
9985           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-text" },
9986           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-text", "sType": "numeric" },
9987           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-select" },
9988           *          { "sSortDataType": "dom-checkbox" }
9989           *        ]
9990           *      } );
9991           *    } );
9992           */
9993          "sSortDataType": "std",
9994      
9995      
9996          /**
9997           * The title of this column.
9998           *  @type string
9999           *  @default null <i>Derived from the 'TH' value for this column in the 
10000           *    original HTML table.</i>
10001           *  @dtopt Columns
10002           * 
10003           *  @example
10004           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
10005           *    $(document).ready(function() {
10006           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
10007           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
10008           *          { "sTitle": "My column title", "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
10009           *        ]
10010           *      } );
10011           *    } );
10012           *    
10013           *  @example
10014           *    // Using aoColumns
10015           *    $(document).ready(function() {
10016           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
10017           *        "aoColumns": [ 
10018           *          { "sTitle": "My column title" },
10019           *          null,
10020           *          null,
10021           *          null,
10022           *          null
10023           *        ]
10024           *      } );
10025           *    } );
10026           */
10027          "sTitle": null,
10028      
10029      
10030          /**
10031           * The type allows you to specify how the data for this column will be sorted.
10032           * Four types (string, numeric, date and html (which will strip HTML tags
10033           * before sorting)) are currently available. Note that only date formats
10034           * understood by Javascript's Date() object will be accepted as type date. For
10035           * example: "Mar 26, 2008 5:03 PM". May take the values: 'string', 'numeric',
10036           * 'date' or 'html' (by default). Further types can be adding through
10037           * plug-ins.
10038           *  @type string
10039           *  @default null <i>Auto-detected from raw data</i>
10040           *  @dtopt Columns
10041           * 
10042           *  @example
10043           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
10044           *    $(document).ready(function() {
10045           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
10046           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
10047           *          { "sType": "html", "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
10048           *        ]
10049           *      } );
10050           *    } );
10051           *    
10052           *  @example
10053           *    // Using aoColumns
10054           *    $(document).ready(function() {
10055           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
10056           *        "aoColumns": [ 
10057           *          { "sType": "html" },
10058           *          null,
10059           *          null,
10060           *          null,
10061           *          null
10062           *        ]
10063           *      } );
10064           *    } );
10065           */
10066          "sType": null,
10067      
10068      
10069          /**
10070           * Defining the width of the column, this parameter may take any CSS value
10071           * (3em, 20px etc). DataTables applys 'smart' widths to columns which have not
10072           * been given a specific width through this interface ensuring that the table
10073           * remains readable.
10074           *  @type string
10075           *  @default null <i>Automatic</i>
10076           *  @dtopt Columns
10077           * 
10078           *  @example
10079           *    // Using aoColumnDefs
10080           *    $(document).ready(function() {
10081           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
10082           *        "aoColumnDefs": [ 
10083           *          { "sWidth": "20%", "aTargets": [ 0 ] }
10084           *        ]
10085           *      } );
10086           *    } );
10087           *    
10088           *  @example
10089           *    // Using aoColumns
10090           *    $(document).ready(function() {
10091           *      $('#example').dataTable( {
10092           *        "aoColumns": [ 
10093           *          { "sWidth": "20%" },
10094           *          null,
10095           *          null,
10096           *          null,
10097           *          null
10098           *        ]
10099           *      } );
10100           *    } );
10101           */
10102          "sWidth": null
10103      };
10104      
10105      
10106      
10107      /**
10108       * DataTables settings object - this holds all the information needed for a
10109       * given table, including configuration, data and current application of the
10110       * table options. DataTables does not have a single instance for each DataTable
10111       * with the settings attached to that instance, but rather instances of the
10112       * DataTable "class" are created on-the-fly as needed (typically by a 
10113       * $().dataTable() call) and the settings object is then applied to that
10114       * instance.
10115       * 
10116       * Note that this object is related to {@link DataTable.defaults} but this 
10117       * one is the internal data store for DataTables's cache of columns. It should
10118       * NOT be manipulated outside of DataTables. Any configuration should be done
10119       * through the initialisation options.
10120       *  @namespace
10121       *  @todo Really should attach the settings object to individual instances so we
10122       *    don't need to create new instances on each $().dataTable() call (if the
10123       *    table already exists). It would also save passing oSettings around and
10124       *    into every single function. However, this is a very significant 
10125       *    architecture change for DataTables and will almost certainly break
10126       *    backwards compatibility with older installations. This is something that
10127       *    will be done in 2.0.
10128       */
10129      DataTable.models.oSettings = {
10130          /**
10131           * Primary features of DataTables and their enablement state.
10132           *  @namespace
10133           */
10134          "oFeatures": {
10135              
10136              /**
10137               * Flag to say if DataTables should automatically try to calculate the
10138               * optimum table and columns widths (true) or not (false).
10139               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10140               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10141               *  @type boolean
10142               */
10143              "bAutoWidth": null,
10144      
10145              /**
10146               * Delay the creation of TR and TD elements until they are actually
10147               * needed by a driven page draw. This can give a significant speed
10148               * increase for Ajax source and Javascript source data, but makes no
10149               * difference at all fro DOM and server-side processing tables.
10150               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10151               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10152               *  @type boolean
10153               */
10154              "bDeferRender": null,
10155              
10156              /**
10157               * Enable filtering on the table or not. Note that if this is disabled
10158               * then there is no filtering at all on the table, including fnFilter.
10159               * To just remove the filtering input use sDom and remove the 'f' option.
10160               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10161               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10162               *  @type boolean
10163               */
10164              "bFilter": null,
10165              
10166              /**
10167               * Table information element (the 'Showing x of y records' div) enable
10168               * flag.
10169               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10170               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10171               *  @type boolean
10172               */
10173              "bInfo": null,
10174              
10175              /**
10176               * Present a user control allowing the end user to change the page size
10177               * when pagination is enabled.
10178               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10179               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10180               *  @type boolean
10181               */
10182              "bLengthChange": null,
10183      
10184              /**
10185               * Pagination enabled or not. Note that if this is disabled then length
10186               * changing must also be disabled.
10187               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10188               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10189               *  @type boolean
10190               */
10191              "bPaginate": null,
10192              
10193              /**
10194               * Processing indicator enable flag whenever DataTables is enacting a
10195               * user request - typically an Ajax request for server-side processing.
10196               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10197               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10198               *  @type boolean
10199               */
10200              "bProcessing": null,
10201              
10202              /**
10203               * Server-side processing enabled flag - when enabled DataTables will
10204               * get all data from the server for every draw - there is no filtering,
10205               * sorting or paging done on the client-side.
10206               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10207               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10208               *  @type boolean
10209               */
10210              "bServerSide": null,
10211              
10212              /**
10213               * Sorting enablement flag.
10214               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10215               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10216               *  @type boolean
10217               */
10218              "bSort": null,
10219              
10220              /**
10221               * Apply a class to the columns which are being sorted to provide a
10222               * visual highlight or not. This can slow things down when enabled since
10223               * there is a lot of DOM interaction.
10224               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10225               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10226               *  @type boolean
10227               */
10228              "bSortClasses": null,
10229              
10230              /**
10231               * State saving enablement flag.
10232               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10233               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10234               *  @type boolean
10235               */
10236              "bStateSave": null
10237          },
10238          
10239      
10240          /**
10241           * Scrolling settings for a table.
10242           *  @namespace
10243           */
10244          "oScroll": {
10245              /**
10246               * Indicate if DataTables should be allowed to set the padding / margin
10247               * etc for the scrolling header elements or not. Typically you will want
10248               * this.
10249               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10250               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10251               *  @type boolean
10252               */
10253              "bAutoCss": null,
10254              
10255              /**
10256               * When the table is shorter in height than sScrollY, collapse the
10257               * table container down to the height of the table (when true).
10258               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10259               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10260               *  @type boolean
10261               */
10262              "bCollapse": null,
10263              
10264              /**
10265               * Infinite scrolling enablement flag. Now deprecated in favour of
10266               * using the Scroller plug-in.
10267               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10268               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10269               *  @type boolean
10270               */
10271              "bInfinite": null,
10272              
10273              /**
10274               * Width of the scrollbar for the web-browser's platform. Calculated
10275               * during table initialisation.
10276               *  @type int
10277               *  @default 0
10278               */
10279              "iBarWidth": 0,
10280              
10281              /**
10282               * Space (in pixels) between the bottom of the scrolling container and 
10283               * the bottom of the scrolling viewport before the next page is loaded
10284               * when using infinite scrolling.
10285               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10286               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10287               *  @type int
10288               */
10289              "iLoadGap": null,
10290              
10291              /**
10292               * Viewport width for horizontal scrolling. Horizontal scrolling is 
10293               * disabled if an empty string.
10294               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10295               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10296               *  @type string
10297               */
10298              "sX": null,
10299              
10300              /**
10301               * Width to expand the table to when using x-scrolling. Typically you
10302               * should not need to use this.
10303               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10304               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10305               *  @type string
10306               *  @deprecated
10307               */
10308              "sXInner": null,
10309              
10310              /**
10311               * Viewport height for vertical scrolling. Vertical scrolling is disabled
10312               * if an empty string.
10313               * Note that this parameter will be set by the initialisation routine. To
10314               * set a default use {@link DataTable.defaults}.
10315               *  @type string
10316               */
10317              "sY": null
10318          },
10319          
10320          /**
10321           * Language information for the table.
10322           *  @namespace
10323           *  @extends DataTable.defaults.oLanguage
10324           */
10325          "oLanguage": {
10326              /**
10327               * Information callback function. See 
10328               * {@link DataTable.defaults.fnInfoCallback}
10329               *  @type function
10330               *  @default 
10331               */
10332              "fnInfoCallback": null
10333          },
10334          
10335          /**
10336           * Array referencing the nodes which are used for the features. The 
10337           * parameters of this object match what is allowed by sDom - i.e.
10338           *   <ul>
10339           *     <li>'l' - Length changing</li>
10340           *     <li>'f' - Filtering input</li>
10341           *     <li>'t' - The table!</li>
10342           *     <li>'i' - Information</li>
10343           *     <li>'p' - Pagination</li>
10344           *     <li>'r' - pRocessing</li>
10345           *   </ul>
10346           *  @type array
10347           *  @default []
10348           */
10349          "aanFeatures": [],
10350          
10351          /**
10352           * Store data information - see {@link DataTable.models.oRow} for detailed
10353           * information.
10354           *  @type array
10355           *  @default []
10356           */
10357          "aoData": [],
10358          
10359          /**
10360           * Array of indexes which are in the current display (after filtering etc)
10361           *  @type array
10362           *  @default []
10363           */
